RFC#: N/A

Please respond to the survey generated upon closing this ticket. It will help us improve the service we provide to the business."
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047839 was raised by a user named Mel who encountered a "Failed Posting" error for an Expense Claim in the Concur system. Despite having applied for more funds on the project and confirming the availability of sufficient funds for the claim, the posting failed. The ticket was assigned to the AM Concur group with a low priority.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and historical tickets, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The Cost Center in the claims was updated.
2. The claim was reprocessed.
3. The claim status was confirmed to be in the "sent for payment" state, indicating no further action was required.
4. The ticket was closed upon confirmation from the user, Mel.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the standard procedures for handling such issues in the Concur system.

Short description: [BRQ][PO2-IDT1]1001-Stuck Queues-PU Ordered quantity exceeded
Description: Update the line item 360 with quantity 29,700 for STO 7500316592
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Stuck queue error PU Ordered quantity exceeded
Resolution: Business updated  the qty in STO
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047824 pertains to a problem with a stuck queue in the SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) system. The issue arose when the quantity in the Interbranch Document (IBD) 184130925 exceeded the quantity in Purchase Order (PO) 7500316592. Specifically, the IBD quantity was more than the PO quantity for line item 360, which led to the error "PU Ordered quantity exceeded by 4320 EA". This resulted in the queue getting stuck and the system was unable to process further.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Validate the IBD 184130925: The team needs to check the details of IBD 184130925 and confirm if the quantity mentioned is correct.
2. Update the Quantity of PO 7500316592: The quantity for line item 360 in PO 7500316592 needs to be increased to 29700 to match the quantity in the IBD. This can be done by the business team.
3. Clear the Stuck Queue: Once the quantities are aligned, the stuck queue error should be resolved, and the queue needs to be cleared for further processing.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or validation.

Short description: [BRQ] INVOCIES NOT ISSUED
Description: Could you please see attached email comms and screenshots, as customer paid the invoices however invoices seem not being issued on customer account and has "open" status.
Resolution notes:
Issue: INVOCIES NOT ISSUED
Resolution: journal entries are created successfully using VA02 tcode
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047823 pertains to an issue where invoices were not being issued on a customer's account despite the customer having paid them. The invoices remained in an open status. The problem was identified in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The customer provided email communications and screenshots as evidence. The task was to investigate why the invoices were not being issued and resolve the issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that journal entries were successfully created using the VA02 transaction code in the S4 application. The resolution involved the following steps:

1. Confirm with the integration team if the fix changes have been applied and if the invoices were successfully sent to the customer.
2. Reach out to the customer to verify if they have successfully received all the invoices.
3. In case the customer encounters any further issues, they should be advised to report back for further investigation and resolution.
4. Continue monitoring the situation to ensure that the issue does not recur.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [ALR][DTW4-IDT1]Auto Alert for BW4: PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY
Description: Hi RAA Team, The following process chain(s) encountered error. Please check. Error occurred for following chains: PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY 06.11.2023 06:30:26 AK952QQSWNFDZJNUN89EMDQLB Transcation data Stock on Hand -LAW Copy Process Activate Requests in DataStore Objects (advanced), variant Generated Variant for Activation in /LION/AD_LAW08 has status Error (instance ADA_AKJXNHHUGAPN5H4CMOMQ4IEWTE) Error when assigning SID: Action VAL_SID_CONVERT InfoObject /LION/BATCHMAT Value '000000000001255242 280404-v22' (hex. '30003000300030003000300030003000300030003000310032') of characteristic /LION/BATCHMAT contains invalid characters Record in activation queue: Request 20231105193925000000000, data package 0000001, record 0001353 Process 000001 returned with errors Error when assigning SID: Action VAL_SID_CONVERT InfoObject 0BATCH Value '280404-v22' (hex. '3200380030003400300034002D00760032003200') of characteristic 0BATCH contains invalid characters Process 000003 returned with errors Could not activate in step SID creation
Resolution notes:
Issue: Process chain PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY job failure.
Impact: Delay in data load.
Cause:
InfoObject 0BATCH Value '280404-v22' (hex. '3200380030003400300034002D00760032003200') of characteristic 0BATCH contains invalid characters.
Resolution Steps:
1: Checked the Invalid characters details in PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY via ST13 based on the alert description.
2. Corrected the invalid big dash value in /LION/CM_LAW08 and /LION/AD_LAW08
3.Repaired the failed step and monitored until completion.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047797 pertains to an error encountered in the process chains of the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA BW4HANA. The specific process chain that encountered the error is PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY. The error occurred during the SID creation step due to invalid characters in the values of InfoObjects LIONBATCHMAT and 0BATCH, causing an activation failure. This resulted in a delay in data load.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. Checked the Invalid characters details in PC_TD_SOH_LAW_COPY via ST13 based on the alert description.
2. Corrected the invalid big dash value in LIONCM_LAW08 and LIONAD_LAW08.
3. Repaired the failed step and monitored until completion.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and do not involve any additional insights or suggestions generated by myself.

Short description: [BRQ] Debit is not being processed for a specific account.
Description: Hey Team, We are trying to do a Transfer of Goods from account 10152829 (credit) to account 10002504 (debit) however when we try to process the complaint 900251678 we are receiving the following errors and we cannot seem to get either the credit or the debit to flow through correctly. Please help to process this as soon as possible.
Resolution notes:
Issue: Debit is not being processed for a specific account.
Resolution: the material 1258841 was not there in CRM, replicated the material to CRM
Application: CRM
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047644 pertains to an issue with the processing of a debit for a specific account in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The team was trying to execute a Transfer of Goods from account 10152829 (credit) to account 10002504 (debit). However, they encountered errors while processing the complaint 900251678, preventing both the credit and debit from flowing through correctly. The issue was of low priority and was assigned to the AM SAP O2C group. The problem was identified as the absence of material 1258841 in the CRM system.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Check the CRM system for the presence of the required material (1258841 in this case).
2. If the material is not present in the CRM system, replicate it from the SAP S4 system to the CRM system.
3. After the material is successfully replicated, try processing the complaint again.
4. If the issue persists, further investigation may be required.
5. Once the issue is resolved, communicate the resolution to the user and close the ticket.
6. Loop in Alisa Totau and Anna Gough for further assistance or clarification if needed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the resolution notes.

Description:
Hi,

I will forward WMS info for 87978090, 87978274, 87978278 & 87978276 that failed to PGI.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Quantity of the material was setup incorrectly
Resolution: AM team manually updated OBD qty and STO qty, manually PGI'd OBD
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047623 was raised due to the failure of BRQPGI1IAP187978090 87978274 87978278 87978276 to Post Goods Issue (PGI). The issue was identified as the quantity of the material being set up incorrectly. This issue was related to the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW application.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided in the ticket, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The AM team manually updated the quantity in the Outbound Delivery (OBD) and Stock Transport Order (STO).
2. The team then manually posted the goods issue for the OBD.
3. The team was advised to check if there were other returns that needed to be completed first with Lion Connect or others.
4. Once the above step was confirmed, the team was instructed to manually PGI the OBD.
5. The resolution was achieved when BVC processed another return to create the batch in sloc.
6. After the batch was created in sloc, the PGI job was run successfully.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047621 was raised due to the failure of BRQNSPGI2IOT1 74038339186 74038339181 to Post Goods Issue (PGI). The issue was identified as the expected quantity missing in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW application. The problem was that the Bevchain (BVC) team picked the original delivery quantity, but the Stock Transport Order (STO) had been changed. The STO needed to be increased to match the delivery quantity shipped.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and the historical ticket INC0035844, the following steps are recommended:

1. Check if there are other returns that need to be completed first with Lion Connect or others.
2. Confirm the above step.
3. Increase the quantity of the line item of STO number for an additional CAR to match the actual picked quantity. This step needs to be performed by Renata Dillon.
4. Once the STO quantity is increased, create a new delivery for this CAR to match the actual picked quantity.
5. Manually PGI the Outbound Delivery (OBD).
6. If the batch is not extended to sloc 1010, process another return to create the batch in sloc 1010.
7. After the batch is created in sloc 1010, run the PGI job successfully.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge.

Short description: [BRQ-DT][RPT1-SUE1]Committed Measure Empty In BW Query /LION/CP_R2R02_Q006
Description:
Hi enable.me,

Can you please route this ticket to RAA BW support team? 

RAA team, the measure Committed in BW Query /LION/CP_R2R02_Q006 is coming through empty for all entries. After troubleshooting in Abdul, we have identified an issue with an extract job in LION/AD_R2R13 where each load is being deleted repeatedly.

Attached are screenshots of job, deleting loads and example spreadsheet

Can you please look into this for me? Give me a shout if you need any details

Cheers,

Nick
Resolution notes:
Issue: No data in BW Query /LION/CP_R2R02_Q006
Impact; Delay in month end reporting
Resolution:
1. Query is part of month data load process chain PC_ME_R2R_CO and it runs every for 2 hours, while running the pc there will be no data in this query, user need to wait until job complete.
2. once job complete inform user to validate the data in report and ask the user confirmation for ticket closure
3. user agreed to close the ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047546 was raised due to an issue with the measure 'Committed' in the BW Query LIONCP_R2R02_Q006, which was coming through as empty for all entries. The problem was identified in the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA BW4HANA. After troubleshooting, an issue was identified with an extract job in LIONAD_R2R13 where each load was being deleted repeatedly. This issue was causing a delay in month-end reporting.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution for this issue involved understanding that the query is part of the monthly data load process chain PC_ME_R2R_CO, which runs every 2 hours. During the running of the process chain, there will be no data in this query, and the user needs to wait until the job is complete.
2. Once the job is complete, the user should be informed to validate the data in the report and asked for confirmation for ticket closure.
3. The user agreed to close the ticket, indicating that the issue was resolved.
4. It was also clarified that the process chain runs during the month-end, which falls in the first week of the current month, according to the calendar. The process chain runs the whole week, and the final day for the month-end was the day the ticket was resolved.
5. The user was advised to check the data after the process chain finished running.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the actions taken by the team handling the issue.

Short description: ZFIN HU 193186911055923023 not showing GR at 3PL but has been receipted by Bevchain 1024
Description:
This HU is showing in SSCC recon report as still required receipt at site 1024 (Bevchain, Launceston)
Bevchain have confirmed it was receipted at 03:23 on 01.11.2023.
Please see attachment.
Can we please have assistance. Thank you.
Resolution notes:
Root Cause: Didn't receive the GR message for this from BVC to SAP
Resolution: AM team ask bussiness to re-send the GR message for this ASN coming from EOL.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047518 was raised due to an issue with Handling Unit (HU) 193186911055923023. This HU was showing in the SSCC reconciliation report as still requiring receipt at site 1024 Bevchain Launceston. However, Bevchain confirmed that it was receipted at 03:23 on 01/11/2023. The problem was identified as a missing Goods Receipt (GR) message for this HU from Bevchain to SAP.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The AM team took the following steps to resolve the issue:

1. Identified the root cause as the missing GR message from Bevchain to SAP.
2. Requested the business to resend the GR message for this Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN) coming from End of Line (EOL).

In addition, based on historical tickets, the following steps were recommended:

1. Check for any open Stock Transport Order (STO)/delivery. If the HU wasn't created properly in S4 when MII requested, and the Outbound Delivery (OBD) failed to pick it because it didn't exist, there is no HU for that stock.
2. If a finished goods pallet is stuck in a specific location, search for any duplicate Goods Receipts (GRs) and confirm that ghost pallet reversals have been completed correctly.
3. If the issue persists, it might be related to SAP server issues. In such cases, follow the instructions in the helpsheet provided by the team for the deletion of the Outbound Deliveries (OBDs), reversal of the GR, and deletion of the Stock Transport Order (STO).
4. After these steps, the stock should be cleared. The team can then confirm that no more data could be found for this plant, and the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the helpsheet provided by the team.

Short description: [BRQ-AC][SEC1-S403]No Access
Description: I cant access C4C, i try to log in but not sure if my password is correct, there is no function to 'reset' password.
Resolution notes:
Resolution: We have provisioned job role to user which provides the access to C4C as well to user and received confirmation from user over MS Teams. Hence we are proceeding with closure of the ticket.
RFC: NA
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047492 was raised by a user who was unable to access SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C). The user was unsure about their password and reported that there was no function available to reset it. The issue was categorized under Sales & Marketing Products, specifically Cloud for Customer (C4C), and was assigned a low priority. Upon investigation, it was found that the user needed a job role provisioned to gain access to C4C.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided and historical tickets, the following steps were likely taken to resolve the issue:

1. Login to Cloud For Customer (C4C) as per the instructions in KB0010963.
2. Navigate to Administrator -> General Settings -> Business Users workcenter.
3. Search for the user using their Employee number, UserId, or Firstname/Lastname.
4. Once the user is found, select the user and open Edit -> access rights.
5. Select the business role that needs to be added in the assigned to user checkbox.
6. Click save. The roles will be added after clicking save.
7. If this was the user's first time accessing C4C, navigate to Administrator -> Employees workcenter and search for them using their Employee number or Firstname/Lastname.
8. Select Edit and then the Department field by clicking on OVS/F1 (double square). Select AU01 for Australian users.
9. Click Save and Close.

In addition to these steps, the resolution notes indicate that a job role was provisioned to the user, which provided them with access to C4C. Confirmation of successful access was received from the user over MS Teams, leading to the closure of the ticket. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the knowledge base documents, and may not reflect the exact steps taken to resolve the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][PGI1-IIT1]Failed National orders and STO's to be PGI'ed due to Bevlink/DFN issue
Description:
Hi team,

Please PGI the orders and STO's on the first tab of the attached.

Thanks
Resolution notes:
Root cause : Multiple split STO's have been failed to PGI due to DFN implementation in BVC on last Friday 27th oct.
Resolution: AM Team manually processed and  PGI'd.
Prevention Action is Still pending with BVC . Raised problem ticket to follow up with BVC. PRB0040431
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047427 pertains to the failure of national orders and Stock Transport Orders (STOs) to be Post Goods Issued (PGI) due to a BevlinkDFN issue. The problem arose in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The root cause was identified as multiple split STOs failing to PGI due to a DFN implementation in BVC on 27th October. There were discrepancies in the DT_PAL table versus the quantity in the STO, which caused variance and prevented further processing.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The AM Team manually processed and PGI'd the orders and STOs. The following steps were taken:

1. Check the delivery details: Ensure that all necessary details, including the load number, are correctly included in the delivery before it is sent for confirmation.
2. Handle redelivery requests: When handling redelivery requests, make sure that the order is correctly reassigned to a new load to prevent the load ID from being missing in the payload.
3. Retrigger ship confirmation: In case of missing ship confirmation, the Bevlink Team should retrigger the ship confirmation.
4. Regular system checks: The Webmethods Team should regularly check deliveries waiting for pick confirmation messages to ensure that all confirmations are received in a timely manner.
5. Incident closure: Once the issue is resolved and the delivery has been successfully PGIed, the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge. The prevention action is still pending with BVC and a problem ticket PRB0040431 has been raised to follow up with them.

Short description: [BRQ]Urgent- I need to complete docs and the invocie is not showing warehouse say that all is done on their end order 12830013
Description: Urgent- I need to complete docs and the invocie is not showing warehouse say that all is done on their end order 12830013
Resolution notes:
Issue: invoice is not showing warehouse say that all is done on their end order 12830013
Resolution: User manually deleted the line items 80 in Sales order 12830013 after delivery is created which is incorrect. set a rejection reason to that line item using VA02 tcode
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047376 was raised due to an issue with order 12830013 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The user needed to complete documents, but the invoice was not showing up, even though the warehouse confirmed that everything was done on their end. The problem was identified as the user manually deleting line items 80 in Sales order 12830013 after the delivery was created, which is an incorrect process. This action resulted in an incompletion log in the sales order, preventing the invoice from being generated.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Check the status of the order in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system.
2. Verify the confirmation from the warehouse about the completion of the order.
3. Investigate why the invoice for the order is not appearing in SAP.
4. Identify that the line items in the sales order were manually deleted after the delivery was created, which is an incorrect process.
5. To resolve the issue, use the VA02 transaction code to set a rejection reason for the line item that was deleted. This action should allow the sales order to be invoiced.
6. After making the necessary changes, confirm that the invoice has been generated for the order.
7. Proceed with the closure of the ticket, ensuring to communicate with the business about the resolution.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [ALR][DTW4-IDT1]Auto Alert for BW4: PC_META_DAILY_NIGHT
Description: Hi RAA Team, The following process chain(s) encountered error. Please check. Error occurred for following chains: PC_META_DAILY_NIGHT 31.10.2023 22:30:22 AEQ4F0PUAF76UQZ0T6NDN90IN Meta Chain - Daily - Night Process Start Process Chain in Local System, variant Master Data - Meta Chain has status Error (instance AFRAAGLCCC7TQ1Q1C4LQ6WVKV) Process Start Process Chain in Local System, variant Master Data - MQE has status Error (instance DR3YL2EL5PPDRNXH90B1D0WKF) Process Execute Data Transfer Process, variant FULL - 1CL_OLIO001 / EMDCLNT020 -> /LION/BATCHMAT has status Error (instance DTPR__20231031114814000065000) Update terminated in accordance with error handling setting Roll back executed for data package 000002 Error in substep Messages for 1 data records saved; request is red acc. to configuration Data package 2 / 31.10.2023 22:56:28 / Status 'Processed with Errors'
Resolution notes:
Issue:  PC_META_DAILY_NIGHT failed due to duplicate BatchMat
Impact: Delay in data load
Cause: Process Execute Data Transfer Process, variant FULL - 1CL_OLIO001 / EMDCLNT020 -> /LION/BATCHMAT has status Error
Resolution:
1. Get the Batchmat details and provide the same details to P2M team.
2. skip the failed job
3. re-run the failed job after P2M team remove the duplicate BATCHMAT record.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047353 pertains to an error encountered in the process chains of the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA (BW4HANA). The specific process chain that encountered the error is PC_META_DAILY_NIGHT. The error was due to a duplicate BatchMat, which caused the Process Execute Data Transfer Process variant FULL - 1CL_OLIO001 - EMDCLNT020 - LIONBATCHMAT to fail. This resulted in a delay in data load.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution provided in the ticket involves the following steps:

1. Get the Batchmat details and provide the same details to the P2M team.
2. Skip the failed job.
3. Rerun the failed job after the P2M team removes the duplicate BATCHMAT record.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

3. If the UD is completed but the stock is still in quality inspection, manually move the stock to unrestricted.
4. Confirm that the stock is now in unrestricted and can be consumed as needed.

Short description: [BRQ-EWM2][IUE2]Unable to clear an old active physical inventory document
Description: In PI Document 100067001 there was a zero count which didn't have the box ticked. As a result I can't create a new PI document until this old one is posted. Unfortunatley the posting date is closed. Please see the attached screenshots
Resolution notes:
Root Cause: As we observe  one material which was left in the Physical Inventory document that was not yet posted. Because of the one material which was opened this error occurs.
Resolution: proceed to post that material using the same Physical Inventory document but using a date in the past for ex. 10.25.2023, this will allow you to complete the posting.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047279 pertains to an issue with clearing an old active physical inventory document in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The problem arose with PI Document 100067001, which had a zero count that didn't have the box ticked. As a result, the user couldn't create a new PI document until the old one was posted. However, the posting date was closed. The issue was of moderate priority and was assigned to the AM SAP LAW group. The root cause of the issue was identified as one material left in the Physical Inventory document that was not yet posted. This open material caused the error.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Proceed to post the open material using the same Physical Inventory document but using a past date, for example, 10/25/2023. This will allow the completion of the posting.
2. After posting the open material, check if there are no more open items for the PI document.
3. If the issue persists, consider raising the ticket to a higher priority and reach out to the support team for urgent assistance.
4. Once the issue is resolved, confirm with the user if the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

4. Monitor System: Regular monitoring of the system is recommended to ensure that SKUs are successfully integrated into BevLink in a timely manner, especially when they are needed to be sold ASAP.

Short description: [BRQ][OBD16-IIT1]7403829960%2 failed to PGI
Description:
Hi team,

I will forward WMS pick data and TLC for 7403829960%2 that failed to PGI.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Root cause : For the split STO 7403829960%2 that failed to PGI due to DFN implementation in BVC on last Friday 27th oct.
Resolution: AM Team sent mail to BVC customer service Team, to optimize the split STOs and its been PGI'd.
Prevention Action is Still pending with BVC . Raised problem ticket to follow up with BVC. PRB0040431
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047194 was raised due to a failure in the Post Goods Issue (PGI) for the job id 74038299602. The issue was identified in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) application. The problem was that a blank line item was received in the DT_PAL table, which prevented the creation of a delivery for the remaining quantity of line item. The issue was escalated to the SAP LAW assignment group. The root cause for this issue was due to DFN implementation in BVC on Friday which failed to optimize the split STOs.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution for this issue involved two main steps:

1. Business Renata updated the STO line item with the required quantity. This step was necessary to ensure that the correct quantity was reflected in the system.

2. The AM Team manually processed the delivery. This step was taken to bypass the issue with the automatic creation of the delivery due to the blank line item in the DT_PAL table.

After these steps were taken, the delivery was successfully created for the remaining quantity of line item and it was successfully PGId. The ticket was then closed after confirmation from Aleks Velkovski, the Inventory Controller. 

Prevention Action is still pending with BVC and a problem ticket PRB0040431 has been raised to follow up with BVC. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IIT1]ASN received in WMS but GR did not flow through to SAP
Description:
Hi team,

Please see the 2 files attached, same as ticket INC0046958 that I raised earlier.

Thanks
Resolution notes:
Root Cause: ASN received in WMS but GR did not flow through to SAP due to DFN implementation in BVC on last Friday 27th oct.
Resolution: AM Team sent mail to Bevlink Team, to trigger GR message and after in SAP all IBD's have beed GR'd.
Prevention Action is Still pending with BVC . Raised problem ticket to follow up with BVC. PRB0040431
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0047033 pertains to an issue where an Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN) was received in the Warehouse Management System (WMS), but the Goods Receipt (GR) did not flow through to the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. This issue was similar to a previously raised ticket, INC0046958. The root cause was identified as the implementation of DFN in Bevlink on the 27th of October, which disrupted the flow of GR to SAP.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Contact Bevlink Team: The AM team sent an email to the Bevlink team to trigger the GR message. This is a necessary step to ensure the GR flows through to the SAP system.
2. Check Inbound Deliveries: After the GR message was triggered, all Inbound Deliveries (IBDs) in SAP were checked and confirmed to have been GR'd. This step is crucial to verify that the issue has been resolved.
3. Follow up with Bevlink: A problem ticket, PRB0040431, was raised to follow up with Bevlink regarding the prevention action, which is still pending. This step is important to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.
4. Ticket Closure: Once all the IBDs have been confirmed as GR'd, the ticket can be closed. However, it is recommended to monitor the situation to ensure the issue does not recur.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: [SAQU-IDT2]RTA Sales Quote won't convert
Description:
Hi team

Rob Clayton (SE) is trying to convert a Sales Quote for 10111987 Brew Plus however it won't let him convert the SQ because of a blocked account associated with the customer.  We raised an ISM to MDG to update the relationships on the accounts which had ZZZCape Cellars as a Ship-To Party but it hasn't resolved the issue.

I will be on annual leave all week next week, can you please reach out to Rob Clayton (SE) or Nic Alizzi as needed.

Thank you

Laura
Resolution notes:
Issue : RTA Sales Quote wont convert
Cause : Sales Quote was having a blocked account as ship-to party
Resolution : Raised ISM ticket to remove the blocked ship-to and manually updated the Sales Quotes with correct Ship-to
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046999 was raised due to an issue with converting a Sales Quote for Brew Plus (10111987) in the SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) system. The Sales Executive, Rob Clayton, was unable to convert the Sales Quote due to a blocked account associated with the customer. An ISM was raised to MDG to update the relationships on the accounts, but this did not resolve the issue. The problem was identified as a misalignment in the 'Ship to Account' details. The Sales Quote was having a blocked account as the 'Ship to' party.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided and the recommendations from GenAI, the following steps were taken and should be considered for future similar incidents:

1. Investigate the 'Ship to Account' details: The initial investigation revealed that the blocked account was the 'Ship to' account for Brew Plus, which is why the Sales Quote was not able to be converted. 

2. Raise an ISM ticket: An ISM ticket was raised to update the master data and correct the 'Ship to Account' details.

3. Monitor the progress of the ISM ticket: The progress of the ISM ticket was monitored to ensure that the master data was updated correctly.

4. Verify the correction: Once the master data was updated, it was verified that the Sales Quote for Brew Plus was able to be converted.

5. Close the incident: After the issue was resolved and verified, the incident was closed. However, it's important to keep the communication lines open for any further queries or concerns from the Sales Executive or other team members.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the situation.

Short description: [BRQ-AC][SEC1-S403]Can I please be re-added to the customer approver team
Description:

This has caused issues for the NZ Service Excellence Sales and Logistics teams as their change requests are not being actioned or approved in a timely manner. 2. Informed the user to raise ISM ticket to request enabling PSD for the customer.
3. Get user confirmation for ticket closure.

ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046884 was raised due to an issue with the OPC (Order, Price, Configuration) not loading for account ID 10159618 (Maryborough IGA) on the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA BW4HANA platform. The problem was identified as the PSD (Promo Discounts) not being enabled for the customer in the master data.
Summarized_Recommendations:

2. Raise an ISM ticket: The user was informed to raise an ISM ticket to request enabling PSD for the customer. This is a necessary step as the absence of PSD was identified as the root cause of the problem.

3. Get user confirmation for ticket closure: After the above steps were implemented, the user was asked to confirm the ticket closure. 

4. Wait for the changes to reflect in the reports: Once the customer has been updated, it is necessary to wait for the next day for the changes to reflect in the reports.

Short description: [BRQ]Delegation of Authority
Description: Anushi Stringer is currently on leave for 3 weeks and hasn't set up her delegation of authority.  We are currently having to raise tickets for all transactions that are sent to her.  Can you please forward her DOA to Samuel Herrick so that he can approve Capex creations and Close outs in her absence.  This project is currently stuck for close out because it is sitting with Anushi.
Resolution notes:
Resolution: Re-routed the requests using SWIA transaction code
Top-Level Task: WS90200036 (Project Request Workflow template)
Status: Filter for not equal to COMPLETED (this will select open tasks only)
Created On: Enter desired creation date range.
Creation Time: Enter 00:00:00 to 23:59:59 to get all created for the whole day
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046872 was raised due to an issue with the Delegation of Authority (DOA) in the SAP S4 Record to Report (R2R) system. Anushi Stringer, who was currently on leave for three weeks, had not set up her DOA. As a result, tickets had to be raised for all transactions sent to her. The request was to forward her DOA to Samuel Herrick so that he could approve Capex creations and Close outs in her absence. A project was stuck for close out because it was sitting with Anushi.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and work notes, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The requests were rerouted using the SWIA transaction code.
2. The 'Top-Level Task WS90200036 Project Request Workflow template' was used.
3. A status filter for 'not equal to COMPLETED' was applied to select open tasks only.
4. The 'Created On' field was used to enter the desired creation date range.
5. The 'Creation Time' field was entered as '000000 to 235959' to get all tasks created for the whole day.
6. The approver request was rerouted from Anushi Stringer to Samuel Herrick.
7. As no further action was pending, the ticket was closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard procedures.

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Favourties missing for customer
Description:
Hi Hybris team
customer has lost all the favourites , Please check and fix the issue:
Billabong Bottle Shop -10123089 - vamsi@billabongbottleshop.com.au
Resolution notes:
Issue - Favourties missing for customer
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue here is with customer unable to see their favorites in the Marketplace.
2. This is a known issue, as it is because of the exclusion conditions or the products being removed by business. So, one of the Wishlist entry product turns to be null/empty.
So because of it in the front end favorites are not being visible.
3. We had already suggested a CI for the fix of this issue to business.
4. As a workaround, we search in Backoffice in the Customer Wishlist for a null product and delete them manually.
5. We also have a query where we run it and delete those NULL Pk manually in Hybris Backoffice
6. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that favorites list are now visible for Customer.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046856 was raised by the Billabong Bottle Shop (10123089) due to an issue with their favourites disappearing on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The customer was unable to see their favourites in the Marketplace. This is a known issue, often caused by exclusion conditions or products being removed by the business, resulting in one of the Wishlist entry products turning null/empty. This, in turn, makes the favourites invisible on the front end.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. Identified the issue with the customer being unable to see their favourites in the Marketplace.
2. Recognized this as a known issue, often due to exclusion conditions or products being removed by the business, causing one of the Wishlist entry products to turn null/empty.
3. Suggested a Continuous Improvement (CI) fix for this issue to the business.
4. As a workaround, searched in Backoffice in the Customer Wishlist for a null product and deleted them manually.
5. Ran a query to delete the NULL Primary Keys (PKs) manually in Hybris Backoffice.
6. Informed the user about the steps taken and received confirmation that the favourites list is now visible for the customer.

The issue was resolved by following these steps. However, for a more permanent solution, it is recommended to raise a CI to address this recurring issue. The business has been informed of this recommendation.

Short description: [BRQ] No lines on return in VA03
Description:
Issue with invoice/return as there are no lines on the return in VA03 
9000250716  93039725   
Busselton Freight Services 30115439
Resolution notes:
Issue: No lines on return in VA03
Resolution:  product 1260242 which is used in said complaint 9000250716 has X-dist. Chain status is equal "22 – Pre-RTO". Product with this state is not acceptable for customer complaint creation. informed user the same
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046854 pertains to an issue with the invoice return in the SAP Hana Cloud system. The problem is that there are no lines on the return in VA03 for complaint 9000250716, which is linked to Busselton Freight Services 30115439. The product 1260242 used in the complaint has an X-dist Chain status equal to 22 - PreRTO. This status is not acceptable for customer complaint creation, resulting in empty product details in the return order created.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The material status needs to be updated as it is currently set to 22 - PreRTO, which is not acceptable for customer complaint creation. This action needs to be coordinated with the material master team or by raising an ISM ticket.
2. Once the material status is corrected, new complaints should be raised correctly with the stock.
3. Monitor the system to ensure that the lines appear on the return in VA03 after they are generated.
4. If the issue persists, it is recommended to reach out to the SAP O2C Support team for further assistance.
   
Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the SAP Hana Cloud system.

Short description: [BRQ]RT87940086 failed
Description:
Hi team,

Please advise for RT87940086 that failed to flow through to SAP.

Thanks
Resolution notes:
Issue: RT87940086 failed
Resolution: There was an existing logic in the system for unplanned returns if same material is present in multiple line in the delivery it will throw an error message. that is the reason why this return is failed. as solution raised a planned return for this
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046849 pertains to the failure of return order RT87940086 to flow through to the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The issue was identified when the return order was put on hold due to the same material being present in multiple line items of the delivery. This was causing an error as per the existing logic in the system for unplanned returns.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided in the ticket, the following steps are recommended:

1. Identify the material that is present in multiple line items of the delivery.
2. Cancel the unplanned return order that has failed.
3. Create a planned return order to replace the failed unplanned return.
4. Ensure that the same material is not present in multiple line items in the new return order.
5. Monitor the new return order to ensure it flows through to the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system successfully.

Please note that these recommendations are purely generated by me based on the information provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ]Request Customer not pulling through
Description: Yesterday and today I have tried to credit a new customer via Request Customer in SAP.  No error appears once I select Submit, however I'm unable to locate my new customers.  One is a consumer under Monique Wright, and the other is an organisation under Kiwi Liquor Darfield (a 2 account). Thanks
Resolution notes:
Issue: Request Customer not pulling through
Resolution: Cleared the stuck queues and consumer accounts now available in S4 & CRM
Application: SAP S4/CRM
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046846 was raised due to an issue with creating a credit for a new customer via the "Request Customer" function in SAP. The user did not receive any error message upon selecting "Submit", but was unable to locate the new customers afterwards. The customers in question were a consumer under the name "Monique Wright" and an organization under the name "Kiwi Liquor Darfield". The issue was categorized as low priority and was assigned to the AM - SAP O2C group.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Clear the stuck queues in the system. This was the resolution provided in the ticket, which resulted in the consumer accounts becoming available in S4 CRM.
2. Validate the creation of the new customers in CRM. This can be done by searching for the customers in the CRM system.
3. If the issue persists, provide a step-by-step procedure of the actions being performed, along with screenshots for further investigation.
4. As a general guide for creating a Relationship Credit in C4C, the following steps can be followed: 
   - Load the account that is to be credited.
   - Click on the "Complaint" arrow.
   - Select "Create complaint".
   - Choose "Transaction Type Relationship Credit".
   - Click "Create Relationship Credit without Reference".
   - Fill in the "Description" and "External Reference".
   - Scroll down and fill in the "Items" tab.
   - Add the product by material number, fill in the "Quantity" and "Unit", and add the credit amount per unit in "Ref. Credit Amount".
   - Fill in the "Notes" Tab to fit the reasoning of the relationship credit.
   - Attach the related correspondence in "Attachments".
   - Review the complaint and if correct, click "Save", and then remember to hit "End Interaction".
5. Please note that these steps are based on my understanding and may not be entirely accurate. It's recommended to refer to the official guide or seek assistance from a knowledgeable colleague if you encounter any issues.
6. Respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Pricing issue with cart and landing page.
Description:
Good Morning team Furphy and potenially other skus are displaying wrong in landing page and cart 
Customer pricing for SKU# 1256057 showing  $ 38.02 in Landing page , Cart price showing # $ 45.22
SKU# 1257793 # Landing page price # $38.03 but Cart price # $45.23

Venue: St Kilda Cellars -10108126
Login # liusiyu2010@126.com
Login # damian@stkildacellars.com

Please check and assist.
Resolution notes:
Resolution Details: 
1) Checked with S4 team and found there is an no ZCP1 enabled for this customer.
2) In hybris, there is a ZCP1 condition which is causing discounts in PLP pages.
3) Did the Mode C change, so that all the prices will be re triggered in the next day pricing data load.
4) Verified the prices in portal and all good.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046831 pertains to a pricing discrepancy issue on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The problem was specifically with the Furphy SKU and potentially other SKUs, where the pricing displayed on the landing page and in the cart was incorrect. The customer pricing for SKU 1256057 was showing as 3802 on the landing page, but the cart price was showing as 4522. Similarly, for SKU 1257793, the landing page price was 3803, but the cart price was 4523. The venue affected was St Kilda Cellars (10108126). The issue was categorized under SAP in the Hybris eComm category and was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm group.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved several steps:
1. The team checked with the S4 team and found that there was no ZCP1 enabled for this customer.
2. In Hybris, there was a ZCP1 condition which was causing discounts in PLP pages.
3. The team performed a Mode C change so that all the prices would be retriggered in the next day's pricing data load.
4. The team verified the prices in the portal and confirmed that they were correct.
5. The team then informed the customer that the solution for the ticket had been completed and requested the customer to perform a validation from their end.
6. The team also requested the customer to respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service provided to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation and validation.

Short description: [BRQ] eInvoice (Electronic Invoice) for orders failing validation in the Coles Gateway.
Description:

This is the email.  Orders affected are L-70890876R, L-70890880R and L-70890877R 
This comes with an attachment, I have attached one of them to this ticket

Dear Supplier, 

eInvoice (Electronic Invoice) for order L-70890876R has failed validation in the Coles Gateway. 

Error Message -

MOA Segment - Value must be numeric. Data Contains0.0. 

LIN Segment - Missing LIN Segment. 


Can you please fix and resend. 

If you require assistance fixing this error please contact your IT Team or Solution Provider. 

Your earliest attention to this matter would be appreciated. 

Regards 
Coles eCommerce Support
Resolution notes:
Issue: eInvoice (Electronic Invoice) for orders failing validation in the Coles Gateway.
Resolution: Upon checking its already sent successfully from S4
Application: S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046791 pertains to an issue with eInvoices for orders L70890876R, L70890880R, and L70890877R failing validation in the Coles Gateway. The error messages indicated issues with the MOA Segment (Value must be numeric) and the LIN Segment (Missing LIN Segment). The issue required understanding why the eInvoices were failing and how to fix and resend them.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the invoices were already sent successfully from the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system to WebMethods. The items were invoiced at 0 due to not being picked. The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. Check the status of the eInvoices in the SAP S4 O2C system.
2. If the eInvoices are failing validation, identify the error messages.
3. In this case, the error messages were related to the MOA Segment and the LIN Segment.
4. Upon checking, it was found that the invoices were already sent successfully from S4 to WebMethods.

Description:

My Intention
I am trying to load variable rates by state, by Brand for Tap Beer, Cider and RTD. I have also tried doing this at sub brand but I’m not able to do that either. I have also tried to update F23 Outlook at Brand level (Version: Monthly Work) and I get the same error.

Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user, Rob Charles, a Senior Analyst in Sales, was experiencing an issue while trying to load the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) for On-Premise Pourage rights in SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) using the key figure "2413 Sales Plan Pourage Rights Base Adjusted Agg L" at the Brand level in the AOPCAF version. Short description: Keg Line thinks its still in downtime while running
Description: Hi we had 10 minutes of downtime at 1:02 but SAP is still recording as downtime even with the line running
Resolution notes: Site engaged their 3rd party support provider to resolve the issue. Closing this incident on Michael's confirmation.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046741 pertains to an issue with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system on the Keg Line. Despite the line running, the system was still recording a downtime of 10 minutes at 10:02. The issue was assigned to the AM SAP MII team. The problem was that the filler was reporting states 1 and 16, which translate to Line Downtime and Outfeed Fault respectively. While the Line Downtime represented actual short stops, the Outfeed Fault did not stop production. The issue was resolved by the site's 3rd party support provider.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Update downtime events manually from the Manage Downtime dashboard as a workaround for this issue. This involves ticking the box at the left and then entering an end time after pressing the Edit button down the bottom.
2. Monitor the system for similar occurrences. If this issue happens frequently, further investigation and potential system improvements may be required.
3. Consider system performance optimization to prevent momentary system slowness, which could be causing the locking error.
4. Close the incident ticket, given the root cause has been identified and a workaround is in place.
5. Be aware that the next time the machine goes between 1 and 16 or any other non-running state, MII will interpret it as a new downtime event, so the process may need to be repeated until the cause of these ongoing outfeed faults is resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

2. We asked MDG team about those errors and found that account 10166338 is not replicating to Hybris since there is no Transportation zone is maintained.
3. We raised an ISM Ticket # 912181 to MDG Business team.
4. After the changes done by MDG Business team, the account # 10166338 is replicated to Hybris successfully without errors.
5. Informed same to user that now we are able to see the Venue # 10166338 present in Hybris Backoffice.
 
 
Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046721 was raised due to Venue 10166338 not being available on Hybris Backoffice. The team was asked to check if this venue had EDI functionality enabled. If it did, the request was to opt this venue out of EDI Partner Function so they could have access to Lion Marketplace. Upon investigation, it was found that the venue was not replicated in Hybris Backoffice due to errors in the data load. The MDG team identified that the account was not replicating to Hybris because there was no Transportation zone maintained.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The team checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that Venue 10166338 was not replicated and there were errors in the data load.
2. The MDG team was consulted about these errors and it was found that account 10166338 was not replicating to Hybris since there was no Transportation zone maintained.
3. An ISM Ticket 912181 was raised to the MDG Business team.
4. After the changes were made by the MDG Business team, the account 10166338 was successfully replicated to Hybris without errors.
5. The user was informed that Venue 10166338 was now present in Hybris Backoffice.

The issue was resolved by following these steps. The user was asked to validate the solution from their end and respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service provided to the business.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][AN1-AOT5]ASN didn't come trough
Description: An ASN didn't come through for Visy Packaging for PO 7500317662
Resolution notes: The issue is not at the LION's end but at the supplier's end. Supplier has to check and resend the ASN
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046706 was raised due to an Advance Ship Notice (ASN) not coming through for Visy Packaging for Purchase Order (PO) 7500317662. The issue was categorized under SAP in the SAP Ariba onDemand business application with a low priority level. The supplier, Visy Packaging, was contacted but there was no response. The issue was not on LION's end but at the supplier's end. The supplier was required to check and resend the ASN. However, it was found that the supplier had only sent the invoice and no ASN was sent against the PO.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided, the following steps are recommended:

1. Contact the Supplier: The supplier should be contacted again to send the ASN for the PO 7500317662. 

2. Check ASN Status: The supplier should log in to their Ariba Network and check if their Ship Notices has been sent to LION. They should ensure that the Routing status of the ASN is in the 'Acknowledged' state.

3. Check Master Data: It was noted that there are no Master data maintained in Ariba. This needs to be checked and corrected if necessary.

4. Manual IBD: A manual Inbound Delivery (IBD) was created against the PO as there was no ASN sent from the supplier's end. This could be a temporary solution while the supplier issue is being resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]Material prices have been changed in SAP incorrectly driving $1m price variance
Description:
Hi There, 

There have been Material price changes that have been loaded into SAP as of the 10/10. These prices were not approved, and in some instances are materially incorrect generating significant financial issues (currently >$1m). 

E.g. material 1252700 in plant 1022 has been loaded with a price of 18.67, when the standard is 129.36.

We need to urgently see the full list of all materials that have had a price change, we will provide the correct pricing to be re-loaded and then we will need the BOMs corrected. In addition, need to understand the process for how these prices were loaded and who approved them. 

Thank you, 
Ashleigh
Resolution notes:
If cost estimates are wrong they have to delete it using CKR1 and reroll.

The price changes are done by business team.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046682 was raised due to incorrect material price changes that were loaded into SAP as of the 10th of October. These unapproved price changes were causing significant financial issues, with an estimated price variance of 1 million. An example provided was material 1252700 in plant 1022, which was loaded with a price of 1867 when the standard is 12936. The user, Ashleigh, requested an urgent full list of all materials that had a price change, the correct pricing to be reloaded, the Bill of Materials (BOMs) to be corrected, and an understanding of the process for how these prices were loaded and who approved them.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and historical tickets, the following steps are recommended:

1. If cost estimates are incorrect, they should be deleted using CKR1 and rerolled. This action should be performed by the business team who are responsible for price changes.
2. Reach out to Jhemerlyn Mapi, who was identified as the person who changed the standard price for the material in plant 1022 from the standard to 1867 AUD on 10th October. This step is crucial to understand the approval process and prevent future unauthorized changes.
3. After gathering the correct pricing information, reload the correct prices into the SAP system.
4. Correct the Bill of Materials (BOMs) as needed.
5. Review and improve the approval process for price changes to prevent such issues in the future.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and the steps taken to resolve similar issues in the past.

Short description: Missing shift due to NZT daylight savings
Description:
Hi
Is someone able to investigate what happened at the Pride on 01.10.23? This was a Sunday and also the night that NZ transitioned from NZST to NZDT. When navigating through the previous shifts in MII operator dashboard, the list jumps straight from NS 30.09.23 to AM shift 02.10.23 (missing AM, PM, and NS for 01.10.23). See attached screenshots below.
This caused us some issues with our end of line pallet movements as all production before midnight on 01.10.23 had not date to assign to and had to have all of the ASN retriggered. 
Just wanting to ensure that this issue will not arise when we transition to and from NZST & NZDT in the future.
Cheers
Resolution notes: SAP ticket 960374 / 2023 has been created for this issue and do a testing for workaround to ensure we don't have same issue in April 2024.  Closing this issue upon user confirmation.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046676 pertains to an issue with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system. The problem arose on October 1, 2023, a Sunday, which was also the day New Zealand transitioned from New Zealand Standard Time (NZST) to New Zealand Daylight Time (NZDT). The MII operator dashboard skipped the AM, PM, and NS shifts for October 1, 2023, jumping straight from the NS shift on September 30, 2023, to the AM shift on October 2, 2023. This caused issues with end-of-line pallet movements, as all production before midnight on October 1, 2023, had no date to assign to and required all of the ASN to be retriggered. The user wanted to ensure that this issue would not recur during future transitions between NZST and NZDT.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. A SAP ticket (960374 - 2023) was created to investigate this issue and test a workaround to prevent the same problem from occurring in April 2024.
2. The team should keep the user posted regarding the SAP ticket and the results of the workaround test.
3. If the user needs any assistance for the October 2023 issue, they should be encouraged to reach out for support.
4. The team should continue to monitor the system, especially during transitions between NZST and NZDT, to ensure that shifts are not skipped in the MII operator dashboard.
5. If the issue is resolved and the user confirms, the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue. Further investigation may be required to fully resolve the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IIT1]Pallets not on file- drivers unable to scan for putaway
Description: Pallets not on file- these pallets show up in MII but do not show up in S4 SSCC reconciliation report. Same issue as previous at the Pride; I will raise a separate ticket to investigate why our system did not work properly when NZ changed to daylight savings time. List of pallets to retrigger is attached
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Goods Receipt didnt not flow through successfully due to the posting period error at that time.
Resolution: AM team manually processed the PGI of the OBD's so that ASN can be receipted.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046673 was raised due to an issue with pallets not being on file, which was preventing drivers from scanning them for putaway. The pallets were visible in MII but did not appear in the S4 SSCC reconciliation report. This issue was similar to a previous one at the Pride. The root cause was identified as a Goods Receipt (GR) that did not flow through successfully due to a posting period error at that time.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and additional comments, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The AM team manually processed the Post Goods Issue (PGI) of the Outbound Deliveries (OBDs) so that the Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN) could be receipted.
2. The business was requested to provide a list of the pallets in an Excel format, as the team did not have authorization to view the file that the business had initially provided.
3. Upon receiving confirmation from the business that the deliveries had been Goods Receipted in SAP, and that the pallets had been scanned by the end of line drivers, the ticket was closed.

For future similar issues, the following steps are recommended:

1. Investigate and correct the SSCC scanning issues for the listed pallets to enable the warehouse to scan them.
2. Follow up with the MII team regarding the missed GR.
3. Retrigger some Handling Units (HUs) from the LAW team and have the MII team reprocess some HUs.
4. If further issues arise, a new ticket should be raised for investigation.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or clarification.

Short description: [BRQ][PO2-IUE2]OBD created for STO not flowing through to Warehouse Monitor for GI of materials
Description:
Hi,
For STO 7403813810 we've created OBD 87941534 but it's not being distributed.  I think it's because the SLOC for the material isn't populated (it needs to be 1004), but when I try to put that via Change OBD, I get the error message that 0 of my material is available.
I have however already done the warehouse task to move the pallets into INB_STAGE, which should be 1004 in EWM but that doesn't show up in S4 (this is not unusual - I do a similar process regularly for stock write off's and while I've stopped checking it rarely if ever shows the stock in 1004 in the Display Stock screen).  
I can't find any stuck queues or any material mismatches between S4 and EWM, S4 just isn't showing the movement of the stock into 1004 which would I think allow me to update the OBD for it to distribute.
I vaguely remember being able to put the SLOC into the OBD in the past with the same process for other deliveries, but don't have documented evidence of this.
Thanks,
Sally
Resolution notes:
Root cause: STO 7403813810 was created with wrong sloc 1005 for the receiving plant boags. where it should be 1004  sloc for receiving in boags.
Resolution: AM Team informed business to update the sloc to 1004 in the STO for that we need to delete the existing delivery 87941534. AM team deleted the delivery and business update the STO sloc to 1004 and create a new delivery 87949023 and update the sloc to 1005 for the newly created delivery.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046664 pertains to an issue with the distribution of Outbound Delivery (OBD) for Stock Transport Order (STO) 7403813810. The problem seems to be related to the Storage Location (SLOC) for the material not being populated. The user, Sally, attempted to update the SLOC to 1004 via Change OBD but received an error message indicating no available material. Despite completing the warehouse task to move the pallets into INB_STAGE, which should correspond to SLOC 1004 in EWM, this is not reflected in S4. Sally has not found any stuck queues or material mismatches between S4 and EWM. The root cause was identified as the STO 7403813810 being created with the wrong SLOC (1005) for the receiving plant boags, where it should have been 1004.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Delete Existing Delivery: The AM team needs to delete the existing delivery (87941534) to allow for the update of the SLOC in the STO.
2. Update SLOC in STO: The business needs to update the SLOC to 1004 in the STO.
3. Create New Delivery: After updating the SLOC in the STO, a new delivery (87949023) needs to be created.
4. Update SLOC in New Delivery: The SLOC needs to be updated to 1005 for the newly created delivery.
5. Regular Checks: Regular checks should be performed to avoid such issues in the future. This includes checking for any stuck queues or material mismatches between S4 and EWM.
6. Training: Sally may need further training or assistance to ensure the correct procedures are followed in the future.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][OBD3-IUE2]Duplicate OBD for one order

Resolution notes: We have provided the enough information regarding duplicate OBD. User confirmed for the closure of the incident.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046660 was raised due to the generation of two Outbound Deliveries (OBDs) for the same products under order 12818309 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The two OBDs, 87914133 and 87904413, were created for the exact same products, which prompted an investigation into why this duplication occurred. The issue was identified as a system limitation in BVC that resulted in two line items being created with the same material in the Stock Transport Order (STO) system.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided and historical tickets, the following steps are recommended:

1. Investigate the order in question and confirm the creation of duplicate OBDs.
2. Identify the root cause, which in this case was found to be a system limitation in BVC that created two line items with the same material in the STO system.
3. Confirm that the system did not generate a duplicate delivery, but created two OBDs to complete all the requested quantity of the order.
4. Ensure that all line items have been processed correctly and that the total quantity matches the demand.
5. Once all issues are resolved and confirmed by the business, close the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge.

HCI-DS Task - S4HANA_KF_BA6APLANPRODRCPT_IBP_NZ AE system: PROD_UC4 Client: 0001 Object: JOBS.SAP_HCI.PROD_PLAN_NZ.LOGOUT Run#: 0531849156 State Text: ENDED_NOT_OK - aborted (1800) Retcode: +0000000000000002 Date/Time: 24-10-2023 06:03:50 Parent of this object (if available): Parent: JOBP.SAP_HCI.PROD_PLAN_NZ.GET.INFO Type: JOBP Run#: 0531849151 Please assign this P2 to Automic team. ***This is an auto generated email. DO NOT REPLY!***
Resolution notes: Manually cancelled job and reprocessed the job via schedule, job completed successfully
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046648 pertains to a failure in the Automic Integration for the Production Plan NZ in the SAP Hana Cloud. The error was identified as ENDED_NOT_OK, indicating that the job was aborted. This issue was causing a delay in posting the Production Plan NZ to S4 in time. The job was blocked due to a CPIDS Connection timeout issue. The Automic team was requested to investigate the reason behind the job failure.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The Automic team should investigate the root cause of the Automic Integration failure.
2. The team should look into the CPIDS Connection timeout issue that is blocking the job.
3. If the job needs to be retriggered, the Automic team should do so as soon as possible to avoid further delays.
4. If the job does not need to be retriggered, as suggested by the IBP team, the succeeding jobs should be monitored to ensure they are running fine.
5. The status of the ticket should be updated to RESOLVED once all the above steps are completed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][OBD3-IUE2]Issue with Returning Stock to Supplier (RPO process)
Description:
Potential stuck queue relating to RPO process - returning two pallets (1,120 an 120) of 1252678.
Both pallets were in blocked status prior to starting RPO process.
Please call Jason.
RPO : 7600000984
Orig. ERP Document : 87942326
Cannot complete Outbound Delivery Order.
Display Stock Overview for 1252678 is also showing 1,000 more cartons than we physically have on site. Unsure if this is related.
Are we able to delete the RPO and try again?
Resolution notes:
Root cause : Business requested to deleted OBD's and STO as the pallets were in blocked status.
Resolution: AM Team deleted the requested outbound deliveries 87942326, 87960401 and tagged deletion indicator for STO 7600000984
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046616 was raised due to a potential stuck queue related to the Return Purchase Order (RPO) process for returning two pallets (1120 and 120) of material 1252678. Both pallets were in blocked status prior to starting the RPO process. The issue was also related to a discrepancy in the stock overview for material 1252678, which showed 1000 more cartons than physically present on site. The user was unsure if this discrepancy was related to the stuck queue issue. The user requested to delete the RPO and try the process again. The root cause was identified as the business requesting to delete Outbound Deliveries (OBDs) and Stock Transport Order (STO) as the pallets were in blocked status.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM Team deleted the requested outbound deliveries 87942326 and 87960401 and marked the deletion indicator for STO 7600000984. This was the immediate resolution to the issue.
2. The user was informed that stocks would not be deleted, only the delivery would be cancelled in the system.
3. The user was asked to confirm if the delivery 87942326 needed to be cancelled.
4. The user was advised to check and confirm for ticket closure after the cancellation of the delivery and marking of the deletion indicator for the PO.
5. For future reference, it is recommended to ensure that pallets are not in blocked status before starting the RPO process to prevent similar issues from occurring. If such an issue does occur, the same resolution steps can be followed: delete the unnecessary OBDs and mark the deletion indicator for the STO.
   
Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Unable to switch between linked venues on MP
Description:
Good afternoon S-NOW team,

Hope you are well. Please investigate the issue where login credentials with email address "41088697 - accounts@parkhotelmotel.com" are linked to 2 venues:

1. 10119611 - The Park Hotel
2. 10116266 - Sunrise Cellars

However, customer is unable to switch between the 2 venues on marketplace. Please see the evidence. Kindly investigate & resolve.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Unable to switch between linked venues on MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue is with customer unable to change between the linked venues on Marketplace.
2. Checked in Portal and can see that user is unable to change and were unable to add products to cart.
3. Further checked in Hybris Backoffice found that there is cart with 4 products along with one faulty product.
4. As there is a faulty product we have deleted that cart manually from backoffice and saved it.
5. After the removal of faulty product, checked in MP and confirmed that we are able to switch between the customer linked venues.
6. Informed user on the same and Got Confirmation from user for closure.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046593 was raised due to an issue where a customer was unable to switch between two linked venues on the Marketplace. The customer's login credentials with the email address 41088697@accountsparkhotelmotel.com were linked to two venues, namely 10119611 - The Park Hotel and 10116266 - Sunrise Cellars. However, the customer was unable to switch between these two venues on the Marketplace.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by following these steps:

1. The team first identified the issue with the customer being unable to switch between the linked venues on the Marketplace.
2. They checked the Portal and found that the user was unable to change venues and add products to the cart.
3. Further investigation in Hybris Backoffice revealed a cart with four products, one of which was faulty.
4. The faulty product was manually deleted from the cart in the backoffice and saved.
5. After the removal of the faulty product, the team checked the Marketplace and confirmed that the customer could now switch between the linked venues.
6. The user was informed of the resolution and confirmed that the issue was resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [VST2-IUE2]Unable to complete Task - can't check in customer visit
Description: Unable to complete Task - can't check in customer visit
Resolution notes:
Issue : Can't check in Visit
Resolution : Advised to check out from the preceding visit
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user was unable to complete a task in the SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) application due to an issue with checking in a customer visit. This issue was affecting the user's reporting and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The user had previously raised a ticket about this issue but was told everything was fine. However, the user was still unable to access a link that was sent to them. The user was also experiencing an error with a specific ID number.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and work notes, the issue seems to be related to the type of visit being created. The user was creating a Non-physical visit, which does not generate a Tap review. The recommendation is to create a Physical visit in order for the Tap review to be generated successfully. This solution was confirmed by the user to have worked. 

Steps to follow:
1. Login to C4C.
2. Navigate to the Visits section.
3. Create a new visit, ensuring to select 'Physical' as the visit type.
4. Set up the customer's tap counter within this physical visit.

Additionally, the user was advised to check out from the preceding visit. If the user encounters an error with a specific ID number, they should reach out to the C4C Team for further assistance. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of the C4C application.
