Short description: [ALR][ITG1-IDT1] Automic Alert for BODS: JOBS.IHUB_IBP_AI_PROCESSBATCH_CASTLEMAIN_S4
Description: Notification details are as follows: High Priority alert for PROD_UC4! System name PROD_UC4 Client 0001 (Prod) Object JOBS.IHUB_IBP_AI_PROCESSBATCH_CASTLEMAIN_S4 Run Id 0531810437 Object Type JOBS Return code +0000000000000001 Time 2023-10-23 09:33:04 Parent object JOBP.S4_IHUB_PROCESS_ORDERS_DAILY_INTRADAY Parent type JOBP
Resolution notes:
Issue: Job failure in JOBS.IHUB_IBP_AI_PROCESSBATCH_CASTLEMAIN_S4

Impact: Delay in data load

Cause: 
'PK__AI_Proce__2B73F38062BA8D0A'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.AI_ProcessBatch'. The duplicate key value is (50, R228, 1022, 1257449, I66179600).

Resolution: 
1. Login into Automic Prod and open the failed job.
2. Go to last monitor and find the failed sub job inside job plan.
3. Go back to the job plan click on failed step and select the failed BODS job and pate the job in management console to see the error.
4 . It is duplicate key issue, we need to unblock the failed step and skip the same failed sub job plan to resolve the issue.
5. Send the mail to P2M team with the complete error details to remove the duplicate key from the S4 side, once P2M resolve the issue you may re-activate the skipped failed step and monitor until it get complete.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The incident INC0046561 pertains to a high priority alert for the PROD_UC4 system in the SAP Data Services application. The issue was a job failure in JOBS.IHUB_IBP_AI_PROCESSBATCH_CASTLEMAIN_S4 due to a duplicate key issue. This resulted in a delay in data load. The incident was assigned to the SAP RAA group and was categorized under SAP. The priority of the incident was initially set to Low but was later escalated.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Login into Automic Prod and open the failed job.
2. Go to the last monitor and find the failed sub-job inside the job plan.
3. Go back to the job plan, click on the failed step, and select the failed BODS job. Paste the job in the management console to see the error.
4. It is a duplicate key issue. To resolve the issue, unblock the failed step and skip the same failed sub-job plan.
5. Send an email to the P2M team with the complete error details to remove the duplicate key from the S4 side. Once the P2M team resolves the issue, reactivate the skipped failed step and monitor until it gets completed.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the resolution details provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ] [INT05-IAP4] IBP ZBA SP Deployment Process scheduled run failed on the weekend & what usually takes 40 min to run is still  running
Description:
IBP ZBA SP Deployment Process scheduled run failed on the weekend & what usually takes 40 min to run is still  running from the 4.30 am scheduled job.

Deployment can not be run until this application has finished & we are risk of being charged for linehaul capacity we can't use.
Resolution notes:
ZBA SP Deployment Process job completed at 8:09AM. Long run was due to step "Integrate UOM and UOM conversion" which was affected by CPI-DS issue. Problem record has been raised for this: PRB0040421
RFC#: N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046550 pertains to a failure in the scheduled run of the IBP ZBA SP Deployment Process over the weekend. The process, which usually takes 40 minutes to run, was still running from the 4:30 am scheduled job. This failure prevented the deployment from running until the application had finished, posing a risk of being charged for linehaul capacity that couldn't be used. The issue was identified in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) application and was categorized under SAP in the Integrated Business Planning (IBP) subcategory.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The ZBA SP Deployment Process job eventually completed at 8:09 am. The extended run time was due to the "Integrate UOM and UOM conversion" step, which was affected by a CPIDS issue.
2. A problem record (PRB0040421) was raised to address this issue. This should be followed up to ensure that the problem is resolved and to prevent similar issues in the future.
3. The ticket was closed after the job completion, but the user was advised to reopen the ticket if they had further questions or concerns.
4. It is recommended to monitor the ZBA SP Deployment Process job to ensure it runs within the expected time frame in the future.
5. If similar issues occur, it may be necessary to investigate the underlying cause, particularly focusing on the "Integrate UOM and UOM conversion" step and any potential CPIDS issues.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Deals page incorrect behaviour
Description:
Hi team,
Please can you investigate why the deals page appears to be behaving incorrectly in the following example

Customer: Liquorland Centrepoint - 10001595
User: bulkstore@ilt.co.nz

This customer has several items on "deal" - all of their pack beer, cider and premix products.
When browsing those products the orange deal column is visible on the product tiles (as per screenshots)

However, when the customer is on the deals page, only 12 items come up.

I have checked the json to compare products in and out of the deals page and they are the identical conditions being used.
See attachments for the following comparison
Macs Gold 330mL Bottle 12 pack - IS showing up in deals page
Macs 3 Wolves 330mL Bottle 12 Pack - is NOT showing up in deals page

By contrast, I have checked another customer who has many products on deal (10003332 M Social Auckland, user maurice.ligutom@msocial.co.nz) and their deals page is displaying 111 items in the results.
Resolution notes:
Issue - User unable to see deals on MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Checked in MP the user had deals in catalogue page but not on deals.
2. As per checking it was a solr config  limitation to the pricing search facet which was set to 500 only 
3.  Made the config changes 
4. Informed user and verified in MP and we can now see all the deals.


Resolution - it was a solr config  limitation to the pricing search facet which was set to 500 only 
So the problem is, the items on deals which are expected to show in MP could be at around number 501-800+. Thus not being returned when getDeals is called.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046285 was raised due to an issue with the deals page on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The customer, Liquorland Centrepoint (10001595), noticed that while several items were marked as deals, only 12 items were displayed on the deals page. The issue was specific to this customer as another customer with many products on deal displayed 111 items in the results. The problem was identified as a limitation in the Solr configuration for the pricing search facet, which was set to only 500. This meant that items on deals expected to show in the marketplace could be at around number 501-800 and thus were not being returned when the getDeals function was called.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved several steps:
1. The team first checked the marketplace and confirmed that the user had deals in the catalogue page but not on the deals page.
2. Upon further investigation, it was found that the issue was due to a Solr configuration limitation to the pricing search facet which was set to 500 only.
3. The team made the necessary configuration changes.
4. The user was informed and the changes were verified in the marketplace. All the deals were now visible.
5. The team then followed up for closure as the issue was fixed and requested the user to validate the solution from their end. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]System time not aligned with actual time.
Description: There is an hour difference between the actual production of a pallet on the Keg Line and the GI time in SAP. Looking back, it has started from October 1 so there is potential for the issue being related with Daylight Savings starting in NSW. Can this be looked at so we can better control our inventory please.
Resolution notes: SAP time is Sydney time and Plant timezone is Brisbane time hence there is 1 hour difference.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046235 pertains to a problem with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system. The issue was identified as a one-hour difference between the actual production time of a pallet on the Keg Line and the Goods Issue (GI) time in SAP. This discrepancy started from October 1, suggesting a potential relation to the start of Daylight Savings in New South Wales. The problem was causing difficulties in inventory control. The root cause was identified as the difference in time zones between the SAP server (Sydney time) and the plant (Brisbane time).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue was investigated and replicated in the Test system (MITEMT), which behaved the same as the production system. This suggests that the current behavior is correct, as the SAP server is in Sydney time, which is one hour ahead of Brisbane time.
2. It is recommended to monitor the system behavior when daylight saving ends in April. If the GI time in MII and S4 shows the same after the end of Daylight Saving Time (DST), then the issue needs to be resolved.
3. If the issue persists, further investigation may be required, potentially involving adjustments to the system to account for the time difference.
4. In the meantime, it may be necessary to adjust operational procedures to account for the one-hour difference in time zones.
5. If no change can be made to align the system time with the actual time, the ticket can be closed as per the user's suggestion.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][PO1-IUE1]Create inbound delivery not bringing up all SKUs to receipt
Description: When trying to create an IBD for PO: 7500296073, only a few SKUs are showing up in the overview. Others are missing even though the confirmation control is set to ASN with IBD
Resolution notes:
Root Cause: Different plants material was used in PO, that is the reason system not allow to create the IBD.
resolution : guided the user delete the other plant materials in PO line items then try to create the IBD.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046213 was raised due to an issue with creating an Inbound Delivery (IBD) for Purchase Order (PO) 7500296073 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. When attempting to create the IBD, only a few Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) were showing up in the overview, with others missing despite the confirmation control being set to ASN with IBD. The root cause of the issue was identified as the use of different plants' material in the PO, which prevented the system from creating the IBD.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Delete Other Plant Materials: The user was guided to delete the materials from other plants in the PO line items. This is because the SAP system does not allow the creation of an IBD with materials from different plants.
2. Create the IBD: After deleting the other plant materials, the user should try to create the IBD again. This time, the system should be able to pick up all the SKUs.
3. Confirm Resolution: The user should confirm if the issue has been resolved after following the provided steps.
4. Close the Ticket: If there are no further issues, the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system.

Short description: [BRQ][EWM9-IUE2]1001-Stuck Queues-PU Ordered quantity exceeded
Description: We are currently checking on the stuck queues and have found one which is for IBD 184063819. As per checking, the IBD was created against line item 40 of PO 7500312940. we have stuck queue on it where IBD quantity is more that PO quantity.

Root Cause: Queue stuck due to IBD quantity is more that PO quantity.
Resolution: Updated line item 40 with quantity 32,000 for STO 7500312940.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046212 pertains to a stuck queue issue in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The problem arose due to the ordered quantity in the Purchase Order (PO) 7500312940, specifically for line item 40, being exceeded. An Inbound Delivery (IBD) 184063819 was created against this line item, and its quantity was more than the PO quantity. This discrepancy led to a stuck queue issue. The error message "PU Ordered quantity exceeded" was displayed in the system.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and historical tickets, the following steps can be taken to resolve this issue:

1. Identify the IBD with the stuck queue issue.
2. Check the IBD quantity against the PO quantity.
3. If the IBD quantity exceeds the PO quantity, update the PO to match the IBD quantity. In this case, the quantity for line item 40 in the STO should be updated to 32000.
4. Confirm that the stuck queue is cleared after the update.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and may not apply to all similar situations.

4. Provided the above information and Trisha confirmed ticket closure.

The issue was identified in the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA BW4HANA. The root cause was identified as changes made to the customer hierarchy for customer 10003212 on October 4, which may have caused the data to not show on October 2.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Provided the refresh timing for LIONCP_R2R01_Q001 Actuals data.
2. Checked the timestamp of the data load for Customer 10003212 and 10166375 in the LIONAD_R2R01 change log table. Both were loaded in September and expected to show in the report on the same day.
3. Checked the customer hierarchy of the above customers in S4 KNVH table and found changes to hierarchy for 10003212.

Short description: New users need setting up as Person Responsible (to be used on WBS elements)
Description:
Hi Team,
  I have a ticket to update WBS elements with new Person's Responsible. I note that 5 of the users are not set up in the tab (TCJ04) so can't be added:

Owner                User name
Rick Payne         RPAYNE
Josh Clarke         JOCLARKE
Ashley Fullelove AFULLELO
Chris O'Donohue CODONOHU
Brett Maclean BMACLEAN

Please have the above users set up and advise once it's done. There may be another one, to replace Tony Vitelli whose a/c was locked in September. I'll advise if this is the case.
Regards,
Peter
Resolution notes:
Adding name in PM list:

1. Search User ID in SU01D

2.copy the full name user ID and BP number.

3.Open BP transaction code and click identification tab and note SAP ID

4. open FFID and give tcode OPS6 

5. click on new entries and enter SAP ID, Full name, user ID

6.save the data 

7 sent mail to user

the name was added in PM list, it will automatically add in CRF tool
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046138 was raised by Peter Croghan who needed to update WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) elements with new Persons Responsible. However, five of the users were not set up in the tab TCJ04 and therefore couldn't be added. The users were Rick Payne (RPAYNE), Josh Clarke (JOCLARKE), Ashley Fullelove (AFULLELO), Chris ODonohue (CODONOHU), and Brett Maclean (BMACLEAN). The ticket was assigned to the AM SAP R2R group and was categorized under SAP Record to Report (R2R).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Search for the User ID in SU01D.
2. Copy the full name, user ID, and BP number.
3. Open the BP transaction code, click on the identification tab, and note the SAP ID.
4. Open FFID and enter the transaction code OPS6.
5. Click on new entries and enter the SAP ID, full name, and user ID.
6. Save the data and send an email to the user informing them that their name has been added to the PM list and it will automatically be added to the CRF tool.
7. Wait for the user's confirmation that they are able to use the code.
8. Once the user confirms, proceed to close the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and do not include any additional insights or suggestions.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Skus not displaying on MP
Description:
Hi Team
Please could you check why 2 skus # 1259216 # White Rabbit Hoppy 375ml Can 6x4 Pack & 1259389 # White Rabbit Hoppy 49.5L Keg
Not displaying on MP.
- have made sure they are ecomm rel is Yes
- cloud berry has images
- checked and cron job was run successfully
- checked NO restrictions applied to bot skus
Still not showing on MP.
Please could you investigate urgently.
Resolution notes:
Issue - Skus not displaying on MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue here is with 2 skus # 1259216 # White Rabbit Hoppy 375ml Can 6x4 Pack & 1259389 # White Rabbit Hoppy 49.5L Keg. Not displaying on MP.
2. In Hybris there are active exclusive records which is causing the issue.
3. We did checked with O2C team and found there are no exclusivity records in S4.
4. SKU team confirmed that there is no exclusion records for this 2 materials its should be visible to all.
5. So to fix this issue in hybris we had to make exclusion record active flag to false and do indexing so that its visible to all users.
6. After the changes done in Hybris the above 2 materials are visible to all Customers. Got Confirmation from user.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0046112 was raised due to an issue with two SKUs (1259216 - White Rabbit Hoppy 375ml Can 6x4 Pack and 1259389 - White Rabbit Hoppy 495L Keg) not displaying on the Marketplace (MP). Despite ensuring that they were e-commerce relevant, had images in Cloudberry, and had no restrictions applied, the SKUs were still not visible on MP. The issue was urgent and required immediate investigation.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by following these steps:

1. The issue was identified as active exclusive records in Hybris, which were causing the problem.
2. The team checked with the O2C team and found there were no exclusivity records in S4. The SKU team confirmed that there were no exclusion records for these two materials and they should be visible to all.
3. To fix the issue in Hybris, the team had to make the exclusion record active flag to false and perform indexing so that the SKUs would be visible to all users.
4. After making these changes in Hybris, the two materials became visible to all customers. This was confirmed by the user.

It is recommended to perform a validation from the user's end to ensure the issue has been resolved. If the issue persists, further investigation may be required to identify any other discrepancies between Hybris and O2C. It is also suggested to check for any missing sales units with the MDG team and confirm with the DLAUBSWLogisticsNPDTeam. If the issue is related to an existing Direct Contract i.e., related to Material code, email the Contract Admin team. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT2-IDT1]Permanent delivery instructions not displaying on MP in-cart
Description:
Good afternoon Sreeja,

Venue 10162174 has complained that their permanent delivery instructions on MP are not visible. They're constantly getting overridden. Customer wants the permanent delivery instructions to be displayed in cart at all times.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Resolution notes:
Resolution Details:
1) Checked from S4 end. We see delivery instructions present in s4.
2) Checked in hybris logs with keyword same as delivery instructions.
3) The Delivery Instruction does not appear in the textbox. Rather it is populated in the label above the text box. It resolved the issue.
4) Verified in portal and can see delivery instructions.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045951 was raised due to an issue with the permanent delivery instructions on the MP cart for venue 10162174. The customer complained that their permanent delivery instructions were not visible and were constantly getting overridden. The customer wanted the permanent delivery instructions to be displayed in the cart at all times. The ticket was assigned to the AM - Hybris eComm group and was categorized under SAP, with a subcategory of eComm.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved through the following steps:

1. Checked from the S4 end: The team found that the delivery instructions were present in S4.

2. Checked in Hybris logs: The team checked the Hybris logs using the same keyword as the delivery instructions.

3. Identified the display location: The team found that the Delivery Instruction does not appear in the textbox. Instead, it is populated in the label above the text box. This resolved the issue.

4. Verified in the portal: The team verified in the portal and confirmed that the delivery instructions were visible.

After these steps, the team asked the customer to validate the solution from their end. The team also requested the customer to respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service provided to the business. The team offered further assistance if the customer had any more questions or concerns related to this ticket. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: Time Stealer not working
Description: Time Stealer not showing any downtime for over 24hrs.
Resolution notes: Data is not getting captured as Machine is running with fault code. As there is no action pending from MII, closing this incident upon user confirmation.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045934 pertains to an issue with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system, specifically with the Time Stealer not showing any downtime for over 24 hours. The problem was identified within the Data, Reporting & Analytics Products category. The issue was that the Time Stealer was not capturing data as the machine was running with a fault code. The machine in question was GL2PL01, which was in a HOLD state (16384), a state not correctly set up in the MII machine state model. In most cases, the machine was having a critical fault/warning but was still running. For the palletizer, the most likely issue was an air conditioning fault.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue, the following steps are recommended:

1. Investigate the fault code that the machine is running with. This could involve checking the system logs or any error messages that were generated during this period.
2. Check the state of the machine (GL2PL01) in the MII machine state model. If the HOLD state (16384) is not set up correctly, this needs to be addressed.
3. Consult with the SAP MII team for further assistance, as they may have additional insights or troubleshooting methods to resolve the issue.
4. If the issue persists, consider escalating it to SAP support for a more in-depth investigation.
5. As a workaround, consider manually opening a downtime event from the Manage Downtime dashboard. Do not put an end time as it is still open as per historian. The next time MII receives a state change to close downtime from historian, it will complete the open downtime you have created.
6. Maintain open communication with the business, and arrange for a call if requested.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge.

Short description: [BRQ] [QI01- IDT1]Inspection lots not dropping for current packaging run
Description: PO 100003571056 hasn't had an inspection lot drop since we started the run a couple of hours ago.
Business Application: SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE)
Resolution notes: Inspection lot generated after inspection set up done for material by MDG team, user confirmed for ticket closure, hence closing this ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045923 was raised due to an issue with the SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE). The problem was that no inspection lots were dropping for the current packaging run for Purchase Order (PO) 100003571056, which had started a few hours prior. This issue was of low priority and was assigned to the AM - SAP P2M group under the category of SAP and the subcategory of Plan to Manufacture (P2M).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by the MDG team who performed an inspection setup for the material. After this setup was done, the inspection lot was generated. The user confirmed this resolution, leading to the closure of the ticket. For future reference, if a similar issue arises, the following steps can be taken based on the knowledge base and my understanding:

1. Open the 'Change Inspection Lot' tile.
2. Enter the Inspection Lot Number and click 'Continue'.
3. Click on the 'Inspection Specifications' Tab and then click 'Task List/Spec'.
4. Select the Inspection plan to assign and click on it.
5. Select the quality inspection plan with the same operations route the Process Order (PO) is using.
6. If a message is received showing that a new inspection lot has been assigned, click 'Save'.
7. The inspection lot should now have status 'REL' instead of 'CRTD'. The 'Quality' button should now show in 'MIITIP'.
8. If the 'Quality' button does not appear on an operation in MII, go to the previous or next operation and click the quality button. Use arrows to select operations. After the 2nd inspection point is created, the system should automatically create further inspection points at correct intervals.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the knowledge base and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Favourties have disappeared from MP
Description:
Pineapple Hotel Kangagroo Point  - 10104406
Email: sales@pineapplehotel.com.au
Customer is saying they have lost there favourties folder  this week,
checked customer claims a folder " Pineapple " used to exist and had around 30 skus as fav.
Please check and assist.

thanks
Gurinder
Resolution notes:
Issue - Favourties have disappeared from MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue here is with customer unable to see their favorites in the Marketplace.
2. This is a known issue, as it is because of the exclusion conditions or the products being removed by business. So, one of the Wishlist entry product turns to be null/empty.
So because of it in the front end favorites are not being visible.
3. We had already suggested a CI for the fix of this issue to business.
4. As a workaround, we search in Backoffice in the Customer Wishlist for a null product and delete them manually.
5. We also have a query where we run it and delete those NULL Pk manually in Hybris Backoffice
6. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that favorites list are now visible for Customer.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045897 was raised by Gurinder Singh, a Digital Support Executive at Lion Digital, on behalf of Pineapple Hotel Kangaroo Point (10104406). The customer reported that their favorites folder, named "Pineapple", which contained around 30 SKUs, had disappeared from the Marketplace on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The issue was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm group and was categorized as a low priority under SAP.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by following these steps:

1. The team identified that the customer was unable to see their favorites in the Marketplace. This was a known issue, often caused by exclusion conditions or products being removed by the business, resulting in one of the Wishlist entry products turning null/empty and making the favorites invisible on the front end.

2. The team had previously suggested a Continuous Improvement (CI) fix for this issue to the business.

3. As a workaround, the team searched in Backoffice in the Customer Wishlist for a null product and deleted them manually. They also ran a query to delete these NULL Pk manually in Hybris Backoffice.

4. The user was informed of the steps taken and confirmed that the favorites list was now visible for the customer.

5. The team had also created an automatic report to fetch all the NA or null products from the Wishlist and send it to the business. The business would then provide Replacement SKUs, which the team would replace accordingly. This job was set to run every few days.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard procedures.

Short description: [BRQ] [SP04-IOT3] IBP Is not planning product in time
Description:
Trying to determine why IBP is letting 1000288 - Castlepoint 50L KEG go OOS for ~4 months before replenishing from site 1001 when there is available capacity on the Keg Line?  It uses the same BB as 1000275 - Lion Brown 50L KEG which is producing every second week.  It is planning production at site 1033 but not 1001. Can you please look into why this is happening as I have explored all the usual avenues checking Production Source, Location Source, Production Source Header but can't seem to figure out the reason for the OOS.
Cheers,
Lorika
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: resolved via 3-strike rule as there was no feedback since October 27.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045893 was raised due to an issue with the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. The user, Lorika, was trying to understand why IBP was allowing product 1000288 (Castlepoint 50L KEG) to go out of stock (OOS) for 4 months before replenishing from site 1001, despite there being available capacity on the Keg Line. The product uses the same BB as 1000275 (Lion Brown 50L KEG), which is producing every second week. The system was planning production at site 1033 but not at 1001. Despite checking Production Source, Location Source, and Production Source Header, the user could not identify the reason for the OOS.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and historical tickets, the following steps are recommended:

1. Review the MTO Strategy: The issue might be due to the MTO Strategy maintained in the Time-series Location Product master data. This strategy could be causing the discrepancy in the forecast and the actual stock deployment.

2. Raise a Change Incident (CI): The user, Lorika, is advised to raise a CI to separate Time Series and Response behaviour. This could help in resolving the inconsistency between the forecast and the actual stock deployment.

3. Provide Screenshots: The user should provide screenshots once the plan is published this week. These screenshots could provide further insights into the issue and help in its resolution.

4. Await User Feedback: The ticket was set on hold until the user provides the screenshots. Once the screenshots are provided, further investigation can be carried out based on the additional information.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or clarification.

Short description: [BRQ]CRM Shipping Conditions Sales Order Creation
Description:
Hi there team, this has been previously logged as a General Request but as we get closer to Christmas there's now a higher need for a fix here.

RITM0059301: SAP CRM + O2C

Hi there, we're trying to uncover why when placing a ZRO Rush Order in CRM, and updating the Shipping Conditions in the order header to 03 Pick Up why it doesn't populate the correct pick up route as per mapped in TROLZ?
It's populating NZ0171  or NZ0169 instead of NZ0160/NZ0161.
See screenshots in attached document.
Resolution notes:
Issue: CRM Shipping Conditions Sales Order Creation
Resolution:  Route code is populating according to TROLZ, provided the latest TROLZ extract to user
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045887 was raised due to an issue with the CRM Shipping Conditions during Sales Order Creation in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The problem arose when placing a ZRO Rush Order in CRM and updating the Shipping Conditions in the order header to '03 Pick Up'. Instead of populating the correct pick-up route as per mapped in TROLZ, it was populating NZ0171 or NZ0169 instead of NZ0160/NZ0161. This issue was becoming more critical as Christmas approached, increasing the need for a fix.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution for this issue was that the route code is populating according to TROLZ. The latest TROLZ extract was provided to the user for reference.
2. For the South Island route, NZ0171 is maintained for shipping condition 03 in TROLZ.
3. For the North Island, the TZone mentioned in the ticket is different for the customer 10000000 and route NZ0169 is maintained in TROLZ.
4. It is recommended to check and verify the TZone and the corresponding routes in TROLZ for the specific shipping conditions.
5. If the issue persists, further investigation may be required to identify any discrepancies in the TROLZ mapping or the CRM order placement process.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or adjustments based on the specific circumstances of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]Project Managers name to be added to SAP for WBS management
Description: Please add Magno Melo Guimaraes de Souza <Magno.MeloGuimaraesdeSouza@lionco.com>
Resolution notes:
Adding name in PM list:

1. Search User ID in SU01D

2.copy the full name user ID and BP number.

3.Open BP transaction code and click identification tab and note SAP ID

4. open FFID and give tcode OPS6 

5. click on new entries and enter SAP ID, Full name, user ID

6.save the data 

7 sent mail to user

the name was added in PM list, it will automatically add in CRF tool
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045849 was raised to request the addition of a Project Manager's name, Magno Melo Guimaraes de Souza, to SAP for Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) management. The ticket was categorized under SAP and specifically under Record to Report (R2R). The priority level of the ticket was low.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution for this issue was successfully carried out by following these steps:

1. Search for the User ID in SU01D.
2. Copy the full name, User ID, and BP number.
3. Open the BP transaction code, click on the identification tab, and note the SAP ID.
4. Open FFID and enter the transaction code OPS6.
5. Click on new entries and enter the SAP ID and full name of the User ID.
6. Save the data.
7. Send an email to the user informing them that the name has been added to the PM list and it will automatically be added to the CRF tool.

The user was also advised to raise a service request next time to add a name to the list instead of an incident. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of SAP systems.

Short description: [BRQ][DAT1-IDT1]UOM for ASN's to BVC is in CAN rather than CTN
Description:
The HSD can pallets that we just fixed the ASN's for are all showing CAN as a Base unit rather than CTN.  Which means that they'll fail as they get GR'd into BVC as they're not set up for CAN, and would count it as cartons.
Material: 1257810
I'm not sure what we can do to fix this, so that BVC can GR them or what the next step will be.
See attached for email from BVC inventory for the issue.
Resolution notes:
Root Cause:
Gr failed due to missing material material setup

Resolution:
AM team asked MDG to update the UOM  as Carton
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045843 pertains to an issue with the Unit of Measure (UoM) for Automated Shipping Notices (ASNs) sent to BVC. The base unit for the HSD can pallets (material 1257810) was showing as 'CAN' (cans) instead of 'CTN' (cartons). This discrepancy was causing issues as BVC was not set up for 'CAN' and would count it as cartons. This issue was causing the Goods Receipt (GR) process to fail at BVC. The root cause of the issue was identified as a missing material setup.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Identify the Incorrect Unit of Measure: The issue was with the base unit of measure being displayed as 'CAN' instead of 'CTN' for the HSD can pallets (material 1257810).
2. Request for Master Data Update: The AM team requested the MDG team to update the Unit of Measure to 'Carton' (CTN).
3. Update the Unit of Measure: The MDG team updated the Unit of Measure to 'Carton' (CTN) as per the request.
4. Verification of the Update: After the update, the AM team asked the Site Materials Specialist to check if the issue has been resolved by scanning one pallet.
5. Confirmation from the Business: The final step would be to get a confirmation from the business that the issue has been resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ-BS] Indirect CCID accruring against direct sales volume
Description:
Please assign this request to REV – SAP S4 Revenue (REV) AM team.
See below email trail with Jyoti for further detail
Resolution notes:
Issue:Indirect CCID accruring against direct sales volume
Resolution:
Even though the contract type is 'Indirect', since the condition type (ZC30 / YC30) is part of direct volume pricing (i.e., orders / credit requests etc.,), the accrual will be done in the direct volumes as well.
The accrued value in the 'direct volume' would then be reversed when the next delta accrual is executed.

We are proceeding to close this incident, in case of any issues please ping us or raise a new incident.



RFC: NA
Application: S4 
  
We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045796 was raised due to an issue with the SAP S4 Revenue (REV) system. The problem was that an Indirect Cost Center ID (CCID) was accruing against direct sales volume. This issue was assigned to the AM SAP REV group and was categorized under SAP in the Revenue subcategory. The user was concerned about the accrual process and sought clarification on why an indirect CCID was affecting direct volumes.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution provided explains that even though the contract type is Indirect, the condition type ZC30/YC30 is part of direct volume pricing (i.e., orders, credit requests, etc.). Therefore, the accrual will be done in the direct volumes as well.
2. The accrued value in the direct volume would then be reversed when the next delta accrual is executed.
3. The team proceeded to close the incident, but they advised the user to reach out or raise a new incident in case of any further issues.
4. The user was also encouraged to respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Summarized_Issue:

The ticket INC0045790 was raised due to an issue with an Advance Shipping Notice (ASN) in the SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) system. The problem was that two lines needed to be deleted from a partially completed ASN so that the Inbound Delivery (IBD) could be closed. The two pallets associated with these lines were damaged in transit and could not be unloaded, hence they needed to be removed from the ASN. Short description: [BRQ]Order 12813423 dated incorrectly
Description:
Hi team,
Please can you investigate why the system dated order 12813423 incorrectly.
Customer placed the order via Marketplace on 10 Oct at 10.14AM (before their cut off) so the order should therefore have dated for delivery on 12 Oct.
Instead, it dated for 19 Oct.
Please investigate why this didn't default to 12 Oct as expected.
Resolution notes: Closed by Caller
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to a customer who placed an order (12813423) via Marketplace on 10th October at 10:14 AM, which was before their cut-off time. The order should have been dated for delivery on 12th October. However, it was incorrectly dated for 19th October. The system's dating logic did not work as expected for this order. The factory calendar ID currently in use for this customer is W0, which has workdays from Monday to Friday. Therefore, after creating an order from Sunday after the cut-off, it will be plus 2 days which is Monday then Tuesday.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Investigate the dating logic for orders placed before the cut-off time. The system should be able to correctly date the orders for the following Tuesday if the order is placed before the cut-off time on Sunday.
2. Check the factory calendar ID (W0) settings. If the customer has a Tuesday delivery, the calendar settings should reflect this.
3. If necessary, adjust the factory calendar ID settings to ensure that they align with the customer's delivery schedule.
4. Test the updated settings to ensure that the dating logic works correctly for future orders.
5. Communicate the changes to the relevant stakeholders to avoid confusion in the future.
6. As per the additional comments, it seems that the delivery date logic in the Hybris system is set to "today+1" behavior, which might be causing the issue. This needs to be investigated and adjusted if necessary.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

The revenue for sales order 12777508 was not reflected in the report, while the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) was. The user requested assistance in understanding why this was happening. The issue was identified as an error in creating an invoice for the order. The data was missing in the ACDOCA table for this sales order, which led to the absence of revenue data in the report.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Request the business to provide data extract up to the document number level for comparison. This data should be validated by the Order to Cash (O2C) team.
2. Analyze the values of the list price in S4 versus what is seen in AFO for August to determine any discrepancies.
3. Confirm how the values on the Year-to-Date (YTD) current financial amount and YTD Current financial Quantity are being determined. This could help understand why the quantity for August is very little, causing discrepancies on the price list.
4. Coordinate with the Reporting & Analytics (RAA) team for any required details for further checks.
5. Continue the investigation to identify any variances between the source ACDOCA values and the report.
6. If no action is needed from Record to Report (R2R), consider reassigning the ticket to O2C.
7. Upon resolution, request feedback from the business to help improve the service.
8. The issue might be due to an error while creating an invoice for the order. The project team was checking the issue. Once it has been released to accounting, the data should be available in ACDOCA and AFO.
9. The user should make sure to remove the excel Sum formula at the bottom of the AFO table as it may cause some data to not show.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted as more information becomes available.

This problem is causing the plant route and shipping point to be missing in the Advance return created.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Route details are generally determined using the Shipto account. In this case, the Shipto party 10134960 is missing necessary details.
2. The user is advised to raise an ISM ticket to update the missing details in the account 10134960. This should include the plant and shipping condition.
3. Once the missing details are updated, the route and shipping point should no longer be missing from the return, allowing the credit and return number to flow through to the account.

Short description: [BRQ] [OBD1-IIT1] STO 7403737968 - TMS/WMS Interface Issue
Description:
Hi SAP Team,

It's confusing to identify the root cause issue of attached document. 
Scheduler informed parent order was scheduled midday on 28/09 and child order (split %1) exported before 2PM. But WMS cannot see anything because they are informing cancellation occur at 1.27PM ... how could this happen?

Attached: Run Sheet with details and time from scheduler + Email w WMS explanation.

Thanks for clarifying.

Regards,
RD
Resolution notes:
Root cause: This is a onetime issue in BVC TMS in splitting the delivery for an STO, which line item can be picked and the other one-line item which not having any stocks. 
Resolution: AM team have secured that the STO will not be processed in Bevlink.
Preventive: As per understanding this is issue was only encountered for the first time in BVC and preventive measure can only be taken through a change in Ignition through DFN coming in.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045572 was raised due to an issue with the Stock Transport Order (STO) 7403737968 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The problem was identified when the parent order was scheduled midday on 28/09 and the child order split 1 was exported before 2 PM. However, the Warehouse Management System (WMS) did not register any activity because a cancellation occurred at 1:27 PM. The root cause of the issue was identified as a one-time issue in BVC TMS in splitting the delivery for an STO, which had one line item that could be picked and another line item that did not have any stocks.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue, the following steps are recommended:

1. Engage the BVC TMS team to clarify the root cause of the issue.
2. Wait for feedback from the BVC team.
3. Align the Unit of Measure (UOM) in both SAP and Bevlink systems to ensure consistency and prevent future integration errors. This recommendation is based on a similar issue from a historic ticket (INC0010850).
4. Monitor the system to confirm that the delivery order flows through to the WMS without any errors after the UOM alignment.
5. Close the ticket as the business has confirmed for the closure. However, if the issue is encountered again, it should be escalated with the vendor from the BVC side to investigate the root cause straight away.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [Duplicate][BRQ]Incorrect Delivery Date - Family Bar 10005798
Description:
Hi team,

On Family Bar's (10005798) order 12808996, one order-line had dated for the incorrect delivery day. Order was placed before their Monday 11am cut-off for Tuesday delivery so the whole order should have dated for Tuesday 10th Oct delivery but the Corona Extra 18x355mL btl's has dated for delivery on Friday 13th Oct.

This order has not been edited or changed by the customer or Lion employee's (as far as we can tell). Also, the product in question has now been cancelled and rekeyed by the Service team.

Can you please investigate why this one product has dated incorrectly? Please refer to attached images

Cheers,

Seth Cooper
Resolution notes:
Issue: Incorrect Delivery Date - Family Bar 10005798
Resolution: We looped the user in other email tracker where discussion is on-going on the similar issue and resolving it as duplicate.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to Family Bar's (10005798) order 12808996 in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The order was placed before their Monday 11am cutoff for Tuesday delivery, so the entire order should have been scheduled for Tuesday 10th October delivery. However, one line item, Corona Extra 18x355mL bottles, was scheduled for delivery on Friday 13th October. This discrepancy in delivery dates was not due to any edits or changes made by the customer or Lion employees. The product in question was later cancelled and rekeyed by the Service team. The issue was raised to understand why this one product had a different delivery date.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue was investigated and found to be similar to another ongoing issue, and thus was resolved as a duplicate. The user was looped into the email tracker where the similar issue was being discussed.
2. The logic of delivery date having a "today+1" behavior was identified as a potential cause for the discrepancy in delivery dates. This issue was under investigation by the ABAP team.
3. It was recommended to provide recent orders facing the same issue to aid in the investigation, as the issue seemed to be intermittent.
4. Monitoring of orders created for the SKU was suggested, as it was believed that this might be a one-time issue.
5. It was advised to check if the Goods Receipt Hours (GRH) is available for the day when the delivery date is determined.
6. These recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the resolution notes.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Issue with pricing for skus incorrect in MP
Description:
Hi Hybris team
Please check why pricing for the customer for some skus is not matching the cart.
Venue # 10122511
Login # Josh@thekincraig.com.au

SKU # 1258780 - 
Landing page shows $42.40, 
cart # $53.65
Landing page SKU# 1258821  Price #$31.53
Cart price #$39.81
SKU# 1258648 Landing page price # $41.37
Cart price # $50.37

And others also, please could you validate and see what the issue is.

Thanks
Gurinder Singh
Resolution notes:
Issue -Issue with pricing for skus incorrect in MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue is with mismatches in prices in catalogue and cart page.
2. Verified with o2c team the cc id was not applicable to this user whereas hybris had the ccid active.
3. We had to end date the ccid to fix the issue.
4: After the pricing job run we got the updated records for this customer-material which fixed the issue.
5. Informed user on the same and Got Confirmation from user for closure.
 
Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045465 was raised due to a discrepancy in pricing for certain SKUs for a customer on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The prices displayed on the landing page did not match the prices in the cart. The issue was traced back to a mismatch in prices in the catalogue and cart page. The Condition Contract ID (CCID) was not applicable to this user, but Hybris had the CCID active. This was a known issue where customer details were deleted in the CCID, causing the ZCP1 pricing issue. The CCID was created and changed by different users who no longer work for Lion.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Verify the issue: The team verified with the O2C team that the CCID was not applicable to this user, but Hybris had the CCID active.
2. End-date the CCID: The team had to end-date the CCID to fix the issue. This step was necessary as the CCID was causing the ZCP1 pricing issue.
3. Run the pricing job: After end-dating the CCID, the team ran the pricing job and got the updated records for this customer/material, which fixed the issue.
4. Inform the user: The team informed the user about the steps taken to resolve the issue and got confirmation from the user for closure.
5. Engage with the business: The team engaged with Gurinder for help from the business end and asked for MODE C for the customer.
6. Confirm the POC to end-date the CCID: The team advised the user to confirm who will be the POC to end-date the CCID, as the CCID was created and changed by different users who no longer work for Lion.
7. Validate the solution: After implementing the changes, the solution was validated and confirmed by the user, and the ticket was closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation and validation.

Short description: [BRQ] [DP04-IUE1] Query about snapshot KFs
Description:
What's the purpose of these jobs, and why do we run on Wednesday & Sunday?
- ZBA SP Weekly Snapshots Wednesday
- ZBA SP Weekly Redo Snapshots Sunday

I was investigating the snapshot KF's that it populates, but there seems to be an issue with the most recent snapshots. 

For example:
ZSCSSPRODUCTION_SS_1
ZSCSSPRODUCTION_SS_2
Both seem to contain the same data, not 1 and 2 weeks ago.

All of the snapshots are therefore not X weeks ago, as would be expected.

Could you please have a look and let me know?
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: Will be taken over by the project team as a CI.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045450 was raised due to a query about snapshot Key Figures (KFs) in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. The user was investigating the purpose of the jobs "ZBA SP Weekly Snapshots Wednesday" and "ZBA SP Weekly Redo Snapshots Sunday" and why they run on Wednesday and Sunday respectively. The user noticed an issue with the most recent snapshots, specifically "ZSCSSPRODUCTION_SS_1" and "ZSCSSPRODUCTION_SS_2", which seemed to contain the same data, not representing 1 and 2 weeks ago as expected. The user requested a review of this issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue will be taken over by the project team as a Continuous Improvement Request (CIR). 
2. The Wednesday and Sunday snapshot jobs were set up to capture the NZ and AU supply planning results respectively. However, since the jobs have been reverted back to snapshot operator, the flexibility to separate out the snapshots using filters has been lost. 
3. A potential solution could be to revert back to copy operators, but issues previously encountered with this approach would need to be addressed.
4. The snapshot jobs for AU and NZ could be separated for clarity. The steps in the Application job could be correctly named to indicate the copying process from "_1" to "_2", etc. 
5. A new Key Figure could be created to represent the current week, such as "_0", or guidance could be provided on which Key Figure meets that purpose.
6. The situation should be monitored, particularly after the next Sunday run to check if the week gets populated by the job before proceeding with the copy operator changes.
7. The user should be informed of any updates and further concerns should be addressed promptly.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on further investigation or changes in the situation.

Short description: [BRQ] [DP01-IDT2] Dependent Production Demand Snapshot not populating in Material Price Roll up template
Description:
In the Material Price Roll Up template the 125.03. Sales - Plan - Dependent Production Demand Snapshot volumes aren't populating.  Stella has got Marina to run the below job which should populate from I think weekly supply planning version into monthly work however it's still blank.

Job is:
"ZBA AU SOP Lock Supply Plan Output and Create PlanObj for COGS Var in Monthly Work - NEW"
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: 

1. Run the jobs:
ZBA AU Copy Version - Dependent Production Demand - Baseline to Monthly Work Ad Hoc
ZBA AU SOP Lock Supply Plan Output and Create PlanObj for COGS Var in Monthly Work - NEW

RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045441 pertains to an issue with the Dependent Production Demand Snapshot not populating in the Material Price Roll Up template in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. The problem was identified with the 12503 Sales Plan Dependent Production Demand Snapshot volumes. Despite running the job "ZBA AU SOP Lock Supply Plan Output and Create PlanObj for COGS Var in Monthly Work - NEW", the volumes were still not populating. The issue was impacting the visibility of the Dependent Production Demand, which is only visible on the Base Version, and therefore, when the job was run, it did not copy over to the Snapshot Key Figure on the Monthly Work Version.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Run the jobs "ZBA AU Copy Version - Dependent Production Demand - Baseline to Monthly Work Ad Hoc" and "ZBA AU SOP Lock Supply Plan Output and Create PlanObj for COGS Var in Monthly Work - NEW". These jobs should help in populating the Dependent Production Demand Snapshot in the Material Price Roll Up template.
2. Identify who in the workflow is responsible for loading the pricing. This seems to be a crucial step in getting the product to show in the Plan.
3. Work on maintaining the pricing information for the affected material. This task has been agreed upon by Shelley, Rohit, and the team.
4. Ensure that the workflow area showing complete is indeed complete and not missing any crucial steps or information.
5. Reconvene after the issue is fixed to discuss what the process should look like for the next one.
6. Assign the ticket to Joseph Virgil Salazar for further handling.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or clarification.

Short description: [BRQ][OBD17-IIT1]STO order stuck in SAP
Description:
Hi Team, 

STO 7403763328 with OBD 87883916 has been updated to completed by the inventory team however it is still appearing the Law Interface Report with the below status
    
7403763328   1030 SHIPPING PENDING SAP SHIP CONF PENDING Ship Confirmation received, but Delivery Optimization not yet received in SAP  00:00:00

Can you please assist in completing the order so it does not appear on the report?
Thanks
Resolution notes:
Root cause: STO 7403763328 which failed to be processed by BVC team , it still existing in LAW Interface report even after fixing the STO with OBD 87883916.
Resolution: AM Team update the LAW interface report through dt_pal table with the delivery 87883916 and updated the status.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045434 pertains to a Stock Transport Order (STO) 7403763328 with Outbound Delivery (OBD) 87883916 that was stuck in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. Despite being updated to 'completed' by the inventory team, the order was still appearing in the Law Interface Report with the status 'Ship Confirmation received but Delivery Optimization not yet received in SAP'. The root cause was identified as the STO failing to be processed by the BVC team, causing it to persist in the LAW Interface report even after the STO and OBD were fixed.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Confirm the status of the STO and OBD in both the SAP system and the Law Interface Report.
2. If the order is still appearing in the report despite being completed, investigate the discrepancy between the two systems.
3. The AM team resolved the issue by updating the LAW Interface report through the dt_pal table with the delivery 87883916 and updating the status. This step could be replicated for similar issues in the future.
4. After the resolution, request the business to check the LAW Interface Report again to confirm that the STO is no longer visible.
5. Monitor the system to ensure that the issue does not recur.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of typical procedures in SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][EX13-CEP3]Out of packet expense payment
Description:
Financial posting failed. Report number HEGELE
This is an out of pocket expense that was caused by the Westpac credit card issue in NZ at the end of September.
Resolution notes:
Resolution: Expense is sent for payment and informed user about it . Hence, as there is no action required we are closing this ticket.
steps : 
1.check the claim in concur
2.if it is failed due to financial posting
3.check the audit trail
4.if it is because of vendor id
5.add vendor id in concur profile and reprocess the claim in s4 and concur
RFC#: N/A

Please respond to the survey generated upon closing this ticket. It will help us improve the service we provide to the business."
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045425 pertains to an issue with an out-of-pocket expense claim in the Concur system. The claim was marked as "Financial Posting Failed". This expense was related to a problem with the Westpac credit card in New Zealand at the end of September. The user, Logan Campbell, needed to know the status of the claim and whether it would be paid into the same account as his salary.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved the following steps:
1. Check the claim in Concur.
2. If the claim failed due to financial posting, proceed to the next step.
3. Check the audit trail.
4. If the failure is due to the vendor ID, proceed to the next step.
5. Add the vendor ID in the Concur profile and reprocess the claim in S4 and Concur.

After these steps, the expense was sent for payment and the user was informed about it. The user confirmed that the claim status was updated to "for payment". The user was informed that the payment would be made into the same account as his salary. Upon receiving this confirmation, no further action was required and the ticket was closed. The user was also requested to respond to a survey upon the closure of the ticket to help improve the service provided to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard procedures.

Short description: [BRQ][PO5-IAP4]Pallet not scanning for putaway- discrepancy between MII FG receipt report and S4 SSCC recon report
Description: Pallet not able to be scanned by forklift drivers for putaway.  SSCC has been GR from packaging (document number 5008110903) but does not show up in SSCC reconciliation report in S4. Unsure of solution- do we need to retrigger material document?
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Requested HU failed due to the base unit of measure of the material is locked by SAP_WERT.g
Resolution :AM team retriggered the output for the delivery, which created new STO, OBD and ASN. And also business provided some HU's which also failed to PGI. AM PGI'd manually.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045397 pertains to an issue with scanning a pallet for putaway. The pallet had been GR from packaging document number 5008110903 but did not show up in the SSCC reconciliation report in S4. This discrepancy between the MII FG receipt report and the S4 SSCC recon report was causing difficulties for forklift drivers who were unable to scan the pallet. The root cause of the issue was identified as a failure of the requested HU due to the base unit of measure of the material being locked by SAP_WERTg.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team retriggered the output for the delivery which created a new STO, OBD, and ASN.
2. The business provided some HUs which also failed to PGI. The AM team manually PGId these.
3. The business was asked to confirm the completion of reprocessing and triggering of the message to generate the ASN.
4. The business was also asked to confirm for the closure of the ticket.
5. The AM team manually PGId the deliveries for those ones that had failed to process successfully due to the error. These deliveries have now created an ASN for them to be receipted. The business was asked to check at their end and let the team know if they may now proceed in closing the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and not generated by myself.

Short description: Material incorrectly set up as EWM material and should be IM
Description: Hi there, we are a couple of days away from changing over to a new Swan Draught keg cap. The new keg cap has incorrectly set up as a EWM (scan) material vs IM (post) material. Both keg caps are in the correct location 1009. We had a similiar issue earlier in the year with our Swan Gold keg caps. Email attached on who and how it was resolved. Old keg cap 1200789 New keg cap 1260148
Resolution notes:
the component was extended to EWM location 1005 which was leading to SLOC determined based on PSA maintained in work center. 
MDG team deleted the material extension to 1005 and now PRocess order picks IM location.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045367 pertains to an issue with the setup of a new Swan Draught keg cap in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The new keg cap has been incorrectly set up as an Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) material instead of an Inventory Management (IM) material. This is problematic as both keg caps are in the correct location 1009. The issue is similar to a previous one encountered with Swan Gold keg caps. The old keg cap number is 1200789 and the new keg cap number is 1260148.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Identify the incorrect setup: The new Swan Draught keg cap has been incorrectly set up as an EWM material instead of an IM material.
2. Contact the Master Data Governance (MDG) team: The MDG team should be informed about the incorrect setup and asked to correct it.
3. Correct the setup: The MDG team should delete the material extension to location 1005 in the system. This will ensure that the process order picks the IM location instead of the EWM location.
4. Confirm the changes: After the changes have been made, they should be confirmed to ensure that the issue has been resolved.
5. Learn from past issues: This issue is similar to a previous one encountered with Swan Gold keg caps. The resolution for that issue should be referred to for guidance on how to resolve this one.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Paroa Hotel [10000520] have a Tuesday 2pm cut-off for Thursday delivery, but order 12802728 was placed via Marketplace on Wednesday 4th October @1:35am and for some reason the delivery day incorrectly set for Thursday October 5th but a delivery number was never assigned and the order is still currently 'Open' (as they had already passed the cut-off for that delivery day).

The issue was raised to understand why the order selected the incorrect delivery date and to confirm whether this is a wider issue that may have affected other orders/customers.
Summarized_Recommendations:

1. The issue was found to be occurring for all NZ orders placed around 10pm to 12am AEST (which is equal to 12am to 2am NZT).

Short description: UD doesn't work properly in MII for BPR PO's
Description:
Hey Michael,

I've noticed that sometimes BPR materials don't get UD correctly in MII. When the BTs UD a PO, the button doesn't turn white, but if you click on it does say that the UD has been made. However, the stock doesn't move from QI to Unrestricted. I have to do a little workaround in the Inspection Lot to get it to go to Unrestricted. This happens exclusively with BPR POs. Could you please have a look at this?
Business Application: SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE)
Resolution notes: To prevent this issue, CI item is being raised with P2M team.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045324 pertains to an issue with the User Decision (UD) functionality in the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system for Beverage Processing Plant (BPR) Purchase Orders (POs). The problem arises when the Batch Technicians (BTs) make a UD on a PO, the button does not turn white as expected, even though the system indicates that the UD has been made. However, the stock does not move from Quality Inspection (QI) to Unrestricted as it should. This issue seems to occur exclusively with BPR POs. The ticket was assigned to the SAP MII team for resolution and was categorized as a low priority issue under the SAP category, specifically focusing on Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution for this issue involved raising a Continuous Improvement (CI) item with the P2M team to prevent this issue from recurring in the future.
2. The team should implement a preventive measure where when Technically Complete (TECO) is done for an order, all order operations with the status "New", "Hold" or "Active" in MII should be completed. Currently, operations with the "New" status remain as they are in MII. This preventive measure is planned to be implemented through a change request.
3. It is recommended to monitor the system to ensure the issue does not recur. If similar issues arise in the future, it may be beneficial to consult with the MII team or the SAP MII team for assistance.
4. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge.

Short description: [BRQ][OBD13- IDT1]No ASN generated for STO
Description: STO 7403765773 / OBD 87862971, which is being sent from site 1033 to 1068, has not generated an ASN. I received confirmation that the stock left the site this morning, so it seems like there may be a stuck queue error message. Can you please check if this has happened as we cannot receipt the stock at site 1068.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: OBD 87862971 failed to PGI due to stuck queue error message where HU is located under resource level.
Resolution: AM team updated the HU to the storage bin OUT_STAGE2 and processed the delivery. By user confirmation closing the ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045208 pertains to an issue where an Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN) was not generated for Stock Transport Order (STO) 7403765773 and Outbound Delivery (OBD) 87862971, which was being sent from site 1033 to 1068. This issue was preventing the receipt of stock at site 1068. The root cause was identified as a stuck queue error message where the Handling Unit (HU) was located under the resource level, causing the OBD 87862971 to fail to Post Goods Issue (PGI).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and historical tickets, the following steps can be taken to resolve such issues:

1. Identify the root cause: In this case, the root cause was the deletion set in the STO line items which caused the output to fail, hence the ASN was not automatically created.

2. Update the HU location: The AM team updated the HU to the storage bin OUT_STAGE2 and processed the delivery. This action cleared the stuck queue error message.

3. Reprocess the Outbound Delivery (OBD): After updating the HU location, reprocess the OBD. After reprocessing, the ASN should flow through and be available for receipting at the site.

4. Confirm resolution: Once the above steps are completed, confirm with the user that the issue has been resolved and the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific circumstances and system configurations.

Short description: [DUPL][BRQ]Materials to be moved from EWM to IM
Description:
As part of our ongoing optimization efforts, and after due consideration of our operational requirements, we have decided to transition the management of all materials from EWM (Storage Location 1001) to IM (Storage Location 1009). This decision has been made to streamline our processes and better suit the site's current operational needs.

In light of the above, we kindly request the necessary updates to be made to the master data in SAP to facilitate this shift. We envision this change to encompass:

 - Updating the default storage location of all materials currently set to 1001 to now reflect 1009.
 - Ensuring that all requisite parameters and settings in IM (Storage Location 1009) are appropriately configured to manage the incoming materials without any disruptions.
Conducting a review post-migration to ascertain that no materials remain erroneously linked to Storage Location 1001.

Kindly acknowledge the receipt of this request and provide us with a tentative timeline for completion. Additionally, we would appreciate it if you could keep us informed of the progress at regular intervals.

We understand that such a transition may necessitate close collaboration between our teams. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you require any clarifications or additional information from our end.

Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:

The request includes updating the default storage location of all materials currently set to 1001 to now reflect 1009, ensuring that all requisite parameters and settings in IM Storage Location 1009 are appropriately configured, and conducting a review post-migration to ascertain that no materials remain erroneously linked to Storage Location 1001. The ticket was assigned to the SAP LAW group under the category of SAP and subcategory of Enterprise Warehouse Management EWM.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided in the ticket, the following steps are recommended:

1. Identify all materials currently set to EWM Storage Location 1001.

3. Ensure that all requisite parameters and settings in IM Storage Location 1009 are appropriately configured to manage the incoming materials without any disruptions.

Short description: [BRQ][MWF1-BOS5]Performing Plant Extensions for Tooheys Site with LMS System
Description:
We currently have an issue where all sourcing change projects moving into Tooheys doesn’t get registered by LMS system that looks at the material Bill of Materials at the Tooheys site since it’s not included in the enrichment workflow at all (as seen below). 

I wanted to know if there is a way to manually update/replicate this so that a enrichment request can also be sent to Tooheys as well so the site engineer Callum an approve of it to make sure Tooheys run properly. 

I’m proposing the below in order for LMS to be included in this transition for Plant Extensions in future if there is a permanent way of making this change for Tooheys specific?
Resolution notes:
Request: change in existing design of workflow
Resolution: Informed user to raise it as a CI as it was a request to change existing workflow design which requires more time & analysis.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045087 pertains to an issue with the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) system, specifically with the Tooheys site not being registered by the LMS system during sourcing change projects. This is due to the Tooheys site not being included in the enrichment workflow. The user proposed a change to include LMS in the transition for Plant Extensions in the future, specifically for Tooheys. However, this request was identified as a change in the existing workflow design, which requires more time and analysis.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The user was advised to raise this issue as a Continuous Improvement (CI) request, as it involves a change in the existing workflow design.
2. The user was also advised to raise this as a P2 (high urgency) issue, as production was scheduled for the upcoming Friday and the LMS system was not displaying any information.
3. The ticket should be reassigned to the AM MII team to retrigger the conversation for LMS visibility.
4. The user was advised to provide a list of materials for which the Bill of Materials (BOM) needed to be retriggered.
5. The user was advised to create a new BOM with an alternate, as SAP can only distribute simple BOMs and will not transfer ones with an alternate.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

2.Kindly reach out to DL-AU-BSW-LogisticsNPDTeam@lionco.com and request them to change the material status to 'In-Use'. Once updated retrigger the order and once order is successful, kindly ask team to revert the changes made on Material status.

Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045078 pertains to an EDI error that occurred when a customer placed an order. The order appeared on the EDI error report due to an issue with a SKU that was marked as "Returns Only". Despite attempts to release the SKU from this status to delete it from the order, the order would not process. The issue involved the customer with SoldTo Party ID 10115075, who had a similar issue the previous week. The error message indicated that the material 1255495, a product named WHITE CLAWVARIETY45 2X10X330MLCANCPSLK, had a status of "Returns Only".
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and my understanding of the issue, the following steps are recommended:

1. Request EDI customers to create orders by removing the problematic material (1255495) from their orders. This step can help bypass the issue and allow orders to process as expected.

2. Reach out to DLAUBSWLogisticsNPDTeamlioncocom and request them to change the status of the problematic material to "InUse". This change should allow the order to be retriggered and processed successfully.

3. Once the order has been successfully processed, ask the team to revert the changes made on the material status. This step is important to ensure that the material status is accurate and reflects its true availability.

4. Respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on further details or developments.
