Short description: [BRQ-AC][EX12-CAC3]I can't remember my Concur Password on mobile app, hence can't access concur from my mobile phone.
Description:
Could I please be provided with my current Concur Password for mobile app or have it reset.
Thank you.
Resolution notes:
Resolution: User is able to reset password and now user able to login into concur through mobile. . Hence, as there is no action required we are closing this ticket.
RFC#: N/A

Please respond to the survey generated upon closing this ticket. It will help us improve the service we provide to the business."
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user, Christopher Lawler, was unable to access the Concur mobile app as he had forgotten his password. The issue was reported under ticket number INC0045067 and was assigned to the AM Concur group. The issue was categorized as an Access issue under the Application Other subcategory.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The user was advised to reset his password using the following steps:
1. Download the Concur Mobile App.
2. Find the Mobile Registration link on the Profile menu in the web version of SAP Concur.
3. Depending on the company's configuration, use the same login credentials as the web version of SAP Concur, use Single Sign On (SSO), or use a PIN (mobile-only password).
4. To sign in, tap on the device apps list, then on the Sign in to Concur screen, enter the work email or SAP Concur (web version) username.
5. Tap Next, then enter the password and tap Sign In to Concur OR Tap if the company uses SSO to access the SAP Concur mobile app.
6. The company code can be found under Profile > Profile Settings > Concur Mobile Registration.
7. Alternatively, the Concur Username and Concur Mobile Pin can be used to access the mobile app. If the Mobile Pin is forgotten, it can be reset by clicking Forgot Mobile Pin in the left-hand menu.

After following these steps, the user was able to successfully reset his password and log into the Concur mobile app. As there were no further actions required from the support team, the ticket was closed. The user was also reminded to respond to the survey generated upon closing the ticket to help improve the service provided by the business. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][AN1-AOT5]ASN not received on site
Description:
It appears that SA 551021100200070JIT were released as an ASN from VISY supplier, as usual, and we didn't receive the (ASN) linked to this SA. 

Could you review if SA 551021100200070JIT were released? Or did the supplier release 551021100000070JIT? Is that why we cannot see the ASN in our system? 

To give you some context, last week was the first time that we released  SA. (5510211002),
Resolution notes: GR has been created and the Schedule agreement is Invoiced
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0045054 pertains to an issue with the Advance Ship Notice (ASN) not being received on site. The ASN was expected to be released from the VISY supplier as per usual, but it was not received. The Schedule Agreement (SA) 551021100200070JIT was investigated, but no ASNs were found against the SA line from the supplier. The issue was categorized as low priority and was assigned to the AM Ariba group under the Ariba subcategory in the SAP Ariba onDemand business application.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided and historical tickets, the following steps are recommended:

1. Check with the supplier: The supplier should be contacted to confirm if they have sent the ASN for the Schedule Agreement (SA) 551021100200070JIT. 

2. Request for ASN re-submission: If the supplier confirms that they have sent the ASN but it is not visible in the system, ask the supplier to cancel and resend the Ship Notices. 

3. Generate Inbound Delivery: Once the ASN is visible in the system, an inbound delivery should be generated in SAP. 

4. Inform the business: After the inbound delivery is generated, the business should be informed about it. 

5. Close the ticket: If there are no pending actions after resolving the issue, the ticket can be moved for closure. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket description, as well as my understanding of the issue.

Resolution notes:

Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044956 pertains to a problem in the SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) system. The issue is categorized under SAP and falls within the subcategory of Logistics and Warehousing (LAW). The problem arose when the ordered quantity in the PU order exceeded the limit, resulting in stuck queues. Specifically, the IBD was created against line item of PO where the IBD quantity was more than the PO quantity. This discrepancy led to a request to update the quantity for line item of STO. The issue was assigned to the AM - SAP LAW group and was categorized as a low priority issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of SAP EWM system, the following steps can be taken to resolve this issue:

1. Review the ordered quantities in the PU order and the PO to ensure they match. In this case, the quantity for the specific line item in the STO should be updated.
2. Implement preventive measures to avoid such discrepancies in the future. In this case, the business has been advised to ensure the ordered quantities in the PU order and the PO match to prevent stuck queues.
3. Monitor the system regularly to identify and resolve such issues promptly to minimize business impact.
4. Update the SA tolerance in the item level of the material in the scheduling agreement and tick the Unlimited tolerance limit for the material which generated the stuck queue.
5. Verify that the stuck queue has been cleared.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific circumstances of the issue.

The user encountered an issue while trying to modify the WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) code MNZKIRN210001SSA from Statistical to Non-Statistical in the SAP S4 Record to Report (R2R) system. The user received an error message stating that the Order/WBS element cannot be both statistical and plan integrated. The issue was of low priority and was assigned to the AM SAP R2R group.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The WBS created with SSA is not modifiable once created. The account assignment element is already ticked for the WBS, which prevents the removal of the cost center from Master data.
2. Since the WBS is no longer modifiable, a new WBS should be created. The FA team has created a new WBS with the code MNZKIRN210002SSA.
3. For future reference, when creating a WBS, it should be noted that it can only be statistical or integrated planned, but not both.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and do not include any additional insights or suggestions.

Short description: [BRQ][EWM9-IUE2]Stuck Queue from PO ordered quantity exceeded that's not clearing when the PO amount is increased at 1021
Description:
Hi,
We've got a stuck queue at Tooheys from a PO ordered quantity being exceeded, but with a scheduling agreement rather than a PO.
PU Ordered quantity exceeded by 7,780 EA : 1257781 1021 1004 0025634356  184027515
The materials planner has increased the PO, but the queue is still showing up as stuck, when that is usually enough to clear it. See attached email.
How can we clear this queue?  Is it a timing thing or does the SA rather than PO mean that the usual process won't work?
Thanks,
Sally
Resolution notes:
Root Cause:  Queue has been stuck with error PU Ordered quantity exceeded by 7,780 EA
Resolution:  We updated the SA 5510221000 for the material 1257781, which generated the stuck queue. 
Now we could see that the stuck queue has been cleared after updating  the tolerance in the item level of the material in the scheduling agreement and tick the "Unlimited" tolerance limit .
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044928 pertains to a problem with the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The issue is specifically related to a stuck queue, with the error message "PU Ordered quantity exceeded by 7780 EA". This problem arose due to the ordered quantity exceeding the available quantity for material 1257781 in the system. The issue is associated with Schedule Agreement 5510221000 for plant 1021 and has resulted in a stuck queue with the error code DLWSEMPCLNT0100184027515. Despite the materials planner increasing the PO, the queue remained stuck.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket, the following steps can be taken to resolve this issue:

1. Review the ordered quantity for material 1257781 in Schedule Agreement 5510221000.
2. Compare the ordered quantity with the available quantity in the system.
3. If the ordered quantity exceeds the available quantity, adjust the ordered quantity to match the available quantity.
4. Update the tolerance in the item level of the material in the scheduling agreement and tick the Unlimited tolerance limit.
5. Clear the stuck queue in the system once the quantities have been corrected.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific circumstances of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][IBD7-IIT1]Finished Good ASN not on file with BevChain
Description:
Hi,

The below finished good pallet SSCC isn't showing up for Bevchain.  Can we please resend through the ASN.

Material: 1257791
SSCC:  193118901054736792
BBD: 26.06.2024
IBD: 184000516
OBD: 87816524
GR: 5008212255

Thanks,
Sally
Resolution notes:
Root cause: ASN was not sent to BVC.
Resolution: AM team have retriggered the ASN 184000516, which successfully receipted in WMS.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to ticket number INC0044926, which was raised due to a missing Advance Ship Notice (ASN) for a finished good pallet SSCC that was not showing up for Bevchain. The material in question was 1257791, with SSCC 193118901054736792, BBD 26062024, IBD 184000516, OBD 87816524, and GR 5008212255. The root cause of the issue was identified as the ASN not being created automatically because the Post Goods Issue (PGI) didn't happen automatically due to insufficient stocks in the batch.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team retriggered the ASN 184000516, which was successfully receipted in the Warehouse Management System (WMS).
2. The business was reminded to note that ASNs/IBDs are only created manually if the Stock Transport Order (STO) is coming from a Vendor/Supplier.
3. For all STOs coming from BVC and Manufacturing sites, the ASN should be generated automatically when the Goods Issue has been triggered in the delivery.
4. It is recommended to check the stock levels regularly to avoid similar issues in the future.
5. After the resolution, the user was asked to check and confirm for ticket closure.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ] [APN2-IAP1] Mismatch in the time profile between OS and TS
Description:
Hello P2M Fam, 

Stella has brought to my attention that there is a mismatch in the time profile weekly periods between time series (TS) and order series (OS).

OS time profile (1445) weekly periods commences from Monday 00:00:00 till Sunday 23:59:59. example for current week WC 02-10/23 attached.
 
For TS time profile (445), for the same week in time series, for WC 02-10-23, here we see the week starts from Sunday 14:00:00 till the following Sunday 13:59:59 

Can we please align TS time profiles to be the same as OS and assess impacts (if any) of doing so. 

Also all the job templates need to be changed to use AEST time zone. Currently, most of the job templates are using UTC timezone and each time, post daylight savings, the scheduled time for scheduled jobs moves back or forwards by one hour. if we used AEST timezone, this will avoid this issue moving forwards.

Please reach out to Stella and Myself if there are any issues with the above.
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: Stella and team applied a period shift in the copy operator.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044910 pertains to a discrepancy in the time profile weekly periods between the time series (TS) and order series (OS) in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. The OS time profile 1445 weekly periods start from Monday 00:00:00 till Sunday 23:59:59, while the TS time profile 445 for the same week starts from Sunday 14:00:00 till the following Sunday 13:59:59. This mismatch was causing data in the order series to appear in the previous week when copied from the time series. Additionally, most of the job templates were using the UTC timezone, which caused the scheduled time for jobs to shift by one hour post daylight savings. The request was to align the TS time profiles with the OS and to change all job templates to use the AEST timezone to avoid this issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Apply a period shift in the copy operator: This was the temporary workaround that was implemented to address the issue. Given the potential data inconsistencies that could arise from changing the time buckets in the time series of the time profile, this workaround should be made permanent.
2. Change job templates to use AEST timezone: To avoid the issue of scheduled job times shifting by one hour post daylight savings, all job templates should be changed to use the AEST timezone.
3. Close the OSS call: An OSS call was logged to understand potential issues with changing the time buckets in the time series of the time profile. Given SAP's advice not to proceed with this change, this call can now be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation.

Short description: [BRQ] Order not consolidated
Description:
Hi team
Please check orders 12800248 and 12800266 for customer 10120506 who has consolidated invoice flag to Y. Both orders PGI out of same plant with same UOM on same day but smaller order charged min freight. Min freight condition should not have applied.
Resolution notes:
Issue: Order not consolidated
Resolution:  orders created on 02.10.2023 and respective delivery and invoice created on 04.10.2023. But on customer master data, consolidated invoice 'Y' is updated on 05.10.2023. informed user the same
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to the non-consolidation of orders 12800248 and 12800266 for customer 10120506 in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. Despite having the consolidated invoice flag set to 'Y', both orders were Post Goods Issued (PGI) out of the same plant with the same Unit of Measure (UOM) on the same day, but the smaller order was charged a minimum freight. The expectation was that freight charges would be consolidated for orders dispatched and invoiced on the same day, but each order was charged the minimum freight surcharge separately.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Check the date when the consolidated invoice flag was updated in the customer master data. In this case, the orders were created on 02/10/2023 and the respective delivery and invoice were created on 04/10/2023. However, the consolidated invoice flag was updated to 'Y' on 05/10/2023, which is after the orders were processed. This could be the reason why the orders were not consolidated.
2. Inform the user about the timing of the update to the consolidated invoice flag in the customer master data. The flag needs to be updated before the orders are processed for the consolidation to take effect.
3. If the issue persists, further investigation may be required to identify any potential issues in the system logic or configuration.
4. Encourage the user to respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Issue with SW pricing for kegs still wrong for customer
Description:
Hi team
issue still persists with some customers pricing for kegs for S W is way wrong as compared to cart price , please see screenshots
Camelia Grove Hotel -10157017 # joel.williams@cameliagrovehotel.com.au

Please look at this as an urgency, as we are having issues with returns and refunds etc.

Thanks
Gurinder Singh
Resolution notes:
Issue - Issue with SW pricing for kegs still wrong for customer
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked for the pricing conditions we received in Hybris end and found that there is one active ZCP1 condition type
2. Issue identified after further investigation is that for below Condition Contract - cc":"2000145876" is expired in S4 but active in Hybris.
3. Investigated with O2C and ABAP team and found that this CC need to end date the ccid to be picked up by extractor.
4. After End dating the CCID and removing the one customer, we are now able to see the prices correctly.
5. Informed user on the same.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by end date the CCID.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044902 was raised due to a discrepancy in the pricing for kegs for South West (SW) for certain customers. The issue was that the pricing was significantly different when compared to the cart price. This issue was causing problems with returns and refunds. The issue was identified to be that the Condition Contract cc2000145876 was expired in S4 but active in Hybris.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:
1. The team checked for the pricing conditions received at the Hybris end and found that there was one active ZCP1 condition type.
2. The team identified that the Condition Contract cc2000145876 was expired in S4 but active in Hybris.
3. The team investigated with the O2C and ABAP team and found that this Condition Contract needed to be end-dated for the CCID to be picked up by the extractor.
4. After end-dating the CCID and removing one customer, the prices were displayed correctly.
5. The user was informed about the resolution.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation and validation.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Indirect customer has access to MP
Description:
Hi Team
Please see why an Indirect customer # retail@narangbavalleytavern.com.au  Account # 10102251
Has access to MP.
I have checked and they are able to login, view invoices etc.
also checked in Backoffice and I can see the account and the logins available.
Please investigate why this has happened as this will cause issues in the future.
thanks
Gurinder
Resolution notes:
Issue - Indirect customer has access to MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. Issue is with Customer is Indirect customer in MDG but it is still showing Hybris
2. We confirmed that an Indirect Customer won't be replicated to Hybris.
3. User is asked then why this is available in Hybris, after investigation we found that initially this was an Indirect customer later around sept 2020 this was made as Direct Customer then the customer was loaded to Hybris Successfully.
4. Again around Nov 2020 this customer was made as an Indirect Customer since then the replication is failing to Hybris.
5. Informed user on the same and asked us to make the changes manually.
6. We made the login disable false for the accounts which are linked to this customer.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044840 was raised due to an issue with an indirect customer (account 10102251 - retailnarangbavalleytaverncomau) having access to the Master Portal (MP) in the SAP Hybris eCommerce system. The customer was able to log in, view invoices, etc. The issue was identified when it was found that the account and the logins were available in the backoffice. The concern was that this could cause future issues.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved the following steps:

1. The issue was identified as an indirect customer showing up in Hybris, which should not happen as indirect customers are not replicated to Hybris.

2. Upon investigation, it was found that the customer was initially an indirect customer, but was made a direct customer around September 2020, which led to its successful loading to Hybris.

3. However, around November 2020, the customer was made an indirect customer again, which caused the replication to Hybris to fail.

4. The user was informed about this and asked to make changes manually.

5. The team made the login disable false for the accounts linked to this customer, resolving the issue.

6. The user was asked to validate the solution and respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service provided to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution details provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][AN1-AOT5]  ASN 2294 not flowing to Warehouse monitor
Description:
Hi Team,

ASN 2294 related to a delivery from WestRock is not flowing. The reason is 2 of the 22 pallets should not have been included in this ASN as this material needs to be GRd indirect.

can you please help by indicating what need to happen in order to allow for the other 20 pallets to be GRd as per normal process?

Thank you.
Resolution notes: Goods Receipt has been manually created as the supplier could not able to send the ASN
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to ticket INC0044813, where ASN 2294 related to a delivery from WestRock was not flowing. The problem arose because two of the 22 pallets should not have been included in this ASN as this material needed to be Goods Receipted (GR'd) indirectly. This issue was preventing the other 20 pallets from being GR'd as per the normal process. The root cause was identified as the ASN not being generated since a line item had been deleted in the Stock Transfer Order (STO) after it had been sent to BevChain (BVC), causing the integration to fail. The system was not recognizing the line item as it had been deleted in the STO.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The Goods Receipt was manually created as the supplier could not amend the ASN.
2. It is recommended to avoid manual deletions of line items in STOs to prevent such issues in the future.
3. If similar issues occur in the future, it is recommended to raise a ticket for resolution.
4. The team should wait for confirmation from the business to close the ticket as the investigation had already been provided.
5. The supplier should be contacted to check and send the ASN.
6. The ticket should be routed to the Ariba team to check the ASN.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] Promo orders not being rejected at cut off
Description:
Hi Team, I am finding an issue with promo orders at cut off, where the order is out of stock but the rejection job is not rejecting the order. eg 12794352, 12794252, 12794280. 
can you please advise if this is something that can be fixed? can we reject promo orders at cut off when out of stock?
Resolution notes:
Issue: Promo orders not being rejected at cut off
Resolution:  As per the design the rejection job is set up for docu.cat "C"
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044812 was raised due to an issue with promotional orders at cut off. The problem was that when the order was out of stock, the rejection job was not rejecting the order. Examples of such orders were 12794352, 12794252, and 12794280. The user wanted to know if this issue could be fixed and if promotional orders could be rejected at cut off when out of stock.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the rejection job is set up for document category C. However, all promotional orders have document category as I. This is why the rejection job was not picking up these orders. The following steps can be taken to address this issue:

1. Review the current design of the rejection job and consider modifying it to include promotional orders (document category I).
2. Monitor the system closely during cut off to identify any orders that are not being rejected as expected.
3. Communicate with all stakeholders to manage expectations regarding order processing and rejection.
4. Respond to the survey generated upon ticket closure to provide feedback and help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] order ran through cut off for day of delivery
Description:
Hi team, 
order 12801857 placed on 03.10.2023 before cut off for delivery 04.10.2023
went on credit hold
released from credit hold today 04.10.2023 and ran through cut off today 04.10.2023 even though the order was dated today 04.10.2023. This should not be possible.
can you please advise why this keep happening from time to time?
Resolution notes:
Issue: order ran through cut off for day of delivery
Resolution: Because job variant having the delivery date as current day and current day+1 day. Advised the same to user.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044742 was raised due to an issue with order 12801857. This order was placed on 03/10/2023 before the cut-off for delivery on 04/10/2023. However, it went on credit hold and was released from the hold on the day of delivery, 04/10/2023. The order then ran through the cut-off on the same day, which should not have been possible. The user sought clarification on why this issue keeps happening intermittently.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue was resolved by explaining to the user that the job variant had the delivery date as the current day and current day + 1 day. This is why the order went through the cut-off on the same day as the delivery date.
2. It was recommended to the user to review the guide on "How to Change a Delivery Date" to understand the process and the reasons why a delivery date might need to be changed.
3. The user was advised to ensure that the delivery date at the header level and each line level match when changing the delivery date.
4. If the issue persists, it may be necessary to review the job variant settings to ensure they align with the business requirements.
5. The user was also encouraged to respond to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]10102806 - Account Status from MDG not replicating in S4 ++ Account doesn't have access to Marketplace
Description:
Hi Sreeja,

Venue 10102806 (Rainbow Hotel) has type ""Direct & Indirect" in MDG. However this is not replicated in other S4 interphases. Also, this venue does not has access to Lion Marketplace. Can you please investigate this issue and propose a resolution so:

1. Customer's account type is replicated across all S4 interphases.

2. Customer's data sync.s with Lion Marketplace and is given access to Marketplace.

Please see attachment.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - 10102806 - Account Status from MDG not replicating in S4 ++ Account doesn't have access to Marketplace
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that Venue # 10102806 is not replicated and in data loaded there are errors.
2. We asked MDG team about those errors and found that account 10102806 is not replicating to Hybris since it has more than 1 std address
3. After the changes done by MDG Business team, we are able to see the venue is replicated successfully to Hybris.
4. After logging into Marketplace we found the pricing is not available in catalogue and cart page. Raised an ISM ticket # 895335 - Customer # 10102806 is not having Price list and Currency to MDG Business team.
5. Changes are done by MDG business team and we can see prices available in both catalogue and cart pages.
6. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that they were able to login in Marketplace.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044740 was raised due to an issue with the replication of account status from Master Data Governance (MDG) to S4 for the account 10102806, Rainbow Hotel. Despite being a Direct and Indirect venue in MDG, this was not reflected in other S4 interfaces. Additionally, the venue did not have access to the Lion Marketplace.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved several steps:

1. The team checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that Venue 10102806 was not replicated and there were errors in the data loaded.
2. The MDG team was consulted about these errors and it was found that account 10102806 was not replicating to Hybris because it had more than one standard address.
3. After the MDG Business team made changes, the venue was successfully replicated to Hybris.
4. Upon logging into the Marketplace, it was found that pricing was not available in the catalogue and cart page. An ISM ticket (895335) was raised to the MDG Business team regarding the issue that Customer 10102806 did not have a Price list and Currency.
5. Changes were made by the MDG business team and prices became available in both catalogue and cart pages.
6. The user was informed of the changes and confirmation was received that they were able to login to the Marketplace.
7. The issue was resolved by following the above steps and the ticket was closed upon receiving confirmation from the user.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

The ticket INC0044739 was raised by Laura Smith who was unable to create a Purchase Order due to an authorization error. The error message indicated a missing authorization for Purchase Order Create Doc Type ZNB. The issue was categorized under SAP Security and was assigned to the AM - SAP Security group. The SAP Security team identified a Segregation of Duties (SOD) risk while trying to assign this role to Laura Smith. Despite multiple follow-ups, the team did not receive a response from Laura Smith.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The SAP Security team should continue to identify potential SOD risks when assigning roles to ensure compliance and mitigate potential conflicts.
2. In cases where SOD risks are identified, the team should request a SOD mitigation sign-off from the requester's leader. This involves filling out a SOD Mitigation Sign-off excel sheet.
3. The requester's leader should provide the necessary approval and complete the SOD Mitigation Sign-off excel sheet to acknowledge the assignment of the role despite the identified SOD risk.
4. Once the approval is received, the SAP Security team can proceed with assigning the requested role to the user.
5. After the role assignment, the user should confirm that the role has been successfully assigned.
6. Upon receiving confirmation from the user, the SAP Security team can proceed with the closure of the ticket.
7. If no response is received from the user after multiple follow-ups, the team can proceed to close the ticket following the "3 strike rule".
8. The user should be advised to raise a new request if they still need assistance.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and standard SAP Security procedures.

Short description: [BRQ][IBD3-IUE2]Orora glass receipting issue, stuck queue
Description:
Orora glass receipting issue, stuck queue. Email send with more info.
PO: 7500315130
184015027
Resolution notes:
Root cause: GR'd failed for the IBD 184015027 due to "Date of Manufacture" in the batch which was in future date.
Resolution: AM asked business to delete the existing IBD and create new IBD 184025081. By business confirmation closing the ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044729 pertains to a stuck queue issue in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The problem was with the Inbound Delivery (IBD) 184015027 for Purchase Order (PO) 7500315130. The Goods Receipt (GR) failed for this IBD due to the Date of Manufacture in the batch being set to a future date. This resulted in an issue with Orora glass receipting, causing a stuck queue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The root cause of the issue was identified as the Date of Manufacture in the batch being set to a future date. This needs to be corrected.
2. The AM team asked the business to delete the existing IBD and create a new one (IBD 184025081). This was the resolution implemented to solve the issue.
3. Before creating the new IBD, it's recommended to update the Date of Manufacture in the batch, which is currently set to 03/10/2024. Updating this date should prevent the error message from appearing.
4. After these steps, the business should confirm the successful creation of the new IBD and the resolution of the issue. The ticket can then be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific circumstances and system environment.

Short description: [BRQ][DTW4-SDT1] Missing Billing Documents
Description: Hello, Ill send an email for the list. Can you help me load in BW please? Thank you!
Resolution notes:
Issue: Missing Billing Documents
Cause: Billing document was not reloaded in BW
Resolution: 
1. Check AD_R2R15 in BWP via SE16 if record is in the table
2. Check WB2_V_CCS_ACCREV in EMP via SE16 if recorded is in the table
3. Reload document using PC_ADHOC_ACCREV process chain in RSA1
4. Monitor process chain run completion and verify with user if document is now showing on their end
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044620 was raised due to missing billing documents in the SAP Business Warehouse for HANA (BW4HANA). The user requested assistance in loading these documents into BW. The issue was categorized under SAP and specifically under Reporting & Analytics (RAA). The problem was that the billing document was not reloaded in BW.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Check AD_R2R15 in BWP via SE16: The team started by checking if the record is in the AD_R2R15 table in BWP using the SE16 transaction.
2. Check WB2_V_CCS_ACCREV in EMP via SE16: The team then checked if the record is in the WB2_V_CCS_ACCREV table in EMP using the SE16 transaction.
3. Reload document using PC_ADHOC_ACCREV process chain in RSA1: The missing document was reloaded using the PC_ADHOC_ACCREV process chain in RSA1.
4. Monitor process chain run completion and verify with user: The team monitored the completion of the process chain run and verified with the user if the document is now showing on their end.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]Credit's not Processing for Customer
Description:
Hi team,
Regarding complaint number 9000235722, the products had been receipted in by our warehouse, however the credit had never processed. If we could please look into this and get the credit flown through as soon as possible that would be great thank you as this complaint is dating back from a few months ago now.
Cheers, Will
Resolution notes:
Issue: Regarding complaint number 9000235722, the products had been receipted in by our warehouse, however the credit had never processed.
Resolution: Credit did not create because of incomplete data in reference invoice on 14/07. We retriggered the advance returns on 03/10 and credit memo created successfully.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044611 was raised due to an issue with the processing of credits for a customer in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The specific problem was with complaint number 9000235722. The products related to this complaint had been received by the warehouse, but the credit had not been processed. This issue was of concern as the complaint dated back a few months.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution for this issue was identified as a problem with incomplete data in the reference invoice on 14/07. This incomplete data was preventing the creation of the credit.
2. The O2C Support team retriggered the advance returns on 03/10, which successfully created the credit memo.
3. It is recommended to review the process of data entry in the reference invoice to prevent such issues in the future.
4. Regular checks on the status of complaints and their associated credits could help in identifying and resolving such issues in a timely manner.
5. The user, Will, was informed about the successful creation of the credit memo. It is recommended to maintain clear communication with the user about the status and resolution of their issues.

Short description: [BRQ-BS] [AN2-SLP5]  Ariba rules: Copy tax from PO to standard invoice
Description: Hi Team. For the time being please check if you're able to activate Ariba rules: Copy tax from PO to standard invoice for Interpack. As per attached email from Dilyara Badyrova, as long as the PO tax data is correct, it will copy to the invoice and supplier shouldn't have to manually select tax code when creating the invoice in Ariba portal. This inconvenient was raised by Rhea from Interpack in Sep 2023.
Resolution notes: Activated the Ariba rules: Copy tax from PO to standard invoice for Interpack supplier group.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044602 pertains to a request to activate Ariba rules to copy tax from Purchase Order (PO) to standard invoice for the supplier group Interpack. This request was made to ensure that as long as the PO tax data is correct, it will be copied to the invoice, eliminating the need for the supplier to manually select the tax code when creating the invoice in the Ariba portal. This issue was raised by Rhea from Interpack in September 2023.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Activate the Ariba rules to copy tax from PO to standard invoice for the Interpack supplier group. This will ensure that the correct tax data from the PO is automatically copied to the invoice.
2. Review the configuration of the Ariba Network. If an Ariba Network buyer account has been enabled to generate PDF invoice copies, it should automatically generate digitally signed PDF invoices in a custom format after a supplier creates an invoice.
3. Check the requirements for digitally signed invoices in the relevant countries. SAP Ariba buyer administrators can configure Ariba Network to receive either the digitally signed copies of the standard template invoices or custom PDF invoices.
4. Review the article KB0405066 on SAP's help page for assistance on why this information is appearing.
5. Raise a Service Request (SR) to Ariba regarding the issue of "Not a tax invoice" triggering for some invoices.
6. Ensure all invoices state "Tax Invoice" as per legislative requirements.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Venue 10113968 - Craftys Sports Bar - Not present in Hybris Backoffice
Description:
Good Morning S-NOW team,

Venue 10113968 is Direct & Indirect. However this venue is still not present on Hybris Backoffice. Can you please investigate and fix this so the information sync.s with Hybris Backoffice & customer can have access to Lion Marketplace?

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Venue 10113968 - Craftys Sports Bar - Not present in Hybris Backoffice
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that venue is not available.
2. Then we checked in the data load and found that the data loaded is false, there were errors and asked MDG team about those errors.
3. MDG team informed us that the account is an EDI Partner Function which is why it is not replicated to Hybris. 
4. Informed user on the same and user asked us to remove the EDI Partner Function as they want this account to be available in Marketplace.
5. We then reached out to MDG Business team to remove the EDI Partner Function.
6. After removing the EDI Functionality Venue # 10113968 is replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors.
7. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that they were able to login in Marketplace.
 

Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044599 was raised due to Venue 10113968 (Craftys Sports Bar) not being present in Hybris Backoffice. Despite being a Direct and Indirect venue, it was not visible in Hybris Backoffice, preventing access to the Lion Marketplace. The issue was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm group and was categorized under SAP with a low priority. The problem was traced back to the account having an EDI Partner Function, which was preventing it from being replicated to Hybris.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The team confirmed that the venue was not available in Hybris Backoffice.
2. They checked the data load and found errors, prompting them to consult the MDG team.
3. The MDG team informed them that the account had an EDI Partner Function, which was why it was not being replicated to Hybris.
4. The user requested the removal of the EDI Partner Function to make the account available in the Marketplace.
5. The team reached out to the MDG Business team to remove the EDI Partner Function.
6. After the removal of the EDI Functionality, Venue 10113968 was successfully replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors.
7. The user was informed of the changes and confirmed that they were able to log in to the Marketplace.

The issue was resolved by following these steps. The user was asked to validate the solution from their end and respond to a survey to help improve the service. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ-SY][PU1-COC1]Required Action to Maintain SAP Integration with Concur Solutions (SAP ICS)
Description: please action
Resolution notes:
Resolution: since the changes will carried on December 2023/January2024 we tag this ticket as resolved for now. We will still investigate/check the progress from our end
RFC#: N/A

Please respond to the survey generated upon closing this ticket. It will help us improve the service we provide to the business."
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user was unable to access the Concur application due to a faulty hardware component in the WebMethods server, which was preventing the application from receiving orders from EDI partners. The issue was categorized under SAP and assigned a low priority.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Access the Mobile Registration link on the Profile menu in the web version of SAP Concur.
2. Depending on the company's configuration, use the same login credentials as the web version of SAP Concur, use Single Sign On (SSO), or use a PIN (mobile-only password).
3. On the device's app list, tap on the Concur app.
4. On the Sign in to Concur screen, enter the work email or SAP Concur (web version) username.
5. Tap Next and enter the password on the next screen.
6. Tap Sign In to Concur or tap on the SSO option if the company uses it to access the SAP Concur mobile app.
7. If needed, the company code can be found under Profile > Profile Settings > Concur Mobile Registration.
8. Alternatively, the Concur Username and Concur Mobile Pin can be used to access the mobile app. If the pin is forgotten, it can be reset by clicking on 'Forgot Mobile Pin' in the left-hand menu.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the knowledge base document titled "How to Login on the Concur Mobile App". The issue was confirmed as resolved after the faulty hardware component was replaced. Short description: [BRQ][REP02-IIT1] Empty SOH files for 3PL plants 1025 and 1031 for Sunday 01/10/2023
Description:
Hi Alma,

I will forward you the empty SOH files for 3PL plants 1025 and 1031 for Sunday 01/10/2023.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Root cause: WMS concern: Daylight savings occurred that morning… clocks jump forward by an hour, so if the trigger time was never reached then EOD didn't run those days in those accounts.
Resolution: One time issue and as discussed in the call, no required changes is needed.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044573 was raised due to an issue with the Stock on Hand (SOH) files for 3PL plants 1025 and 1031 on Sunday, October 1, 2023. The SOH files were empty, which was unusual and prompted the ticket. The root cause of the issue was identified as a concern with the Warehouse Management System (WMS) due to daylight savings time. The clocks jumped forward by an hour on that day, and if the trigger time was never reached, the End of Day (EOD) didn't run for those days in those accounts.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. This issue was identified as a one-time issue due to daylight savings time. No changes were required as per the resolution notes.
2. It is recommended to monitor the system during daylight savings time changes to prevent similar issues in the future.
3. Regular checks on the SOH report transmission should be conducted to ensure timely data availability.
4. If similar issues occur in the future, immediate communication with the BVC team and the IT team is advised for a quick resolution.
5. The business should confirm whether they require the report during weekends, as it was noted that no one is working during Sunday.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]orders placed over the weekend in SA
Description:
Due to the Public Holiday in SA today 02.10.2023, the cut off was on Friday 29.09.2023 for orders for delivery 03.10.2023.
This was not done and 86 orders for SA -plant 1025 customers were placed over the weekend expecting delivery tomorrow. Can you please advise how this has occurred?
Resolution notes:
Issue: orders placed over the weekend in SA having incorrect delivery dates
Resolution: This is missed by AM team to create new calendar excluding Tuesday while performing necessary actions on Holiday activity. User re-dated all the affected orders and no further action is required.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to ticket number INC0044556, which was raised due to 86 orders for SA plant 1025 customers being placed over the weekend, despite the cut-off being on the previous Friday (29/09/2023) for deliveries scheduled for 03/10/2023. This was due to a public holiday in SA on 02/10/2023. The user wanted to understand how this occurred.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the AM team missed creating a new calendar excluding Tuesday while performing necessary actions on the Holiday activity. This led to the orders being placed over the weekend with incorrect delivery dates. The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The user redated all the affected orders, which resolved the immediate issue.
2. The AM team was made aware of the mistake and discussed how to prevent such occurrences in the future.
3. The team is currently checking on the user's query on how this can be done moving forward to avoid similar issues.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Venue 10106131 is not replicated in Hybris Backoffice
Description:
Hi S-NOW team,

Hope you are well. Venue 10106131 - XO Cellars Noosa Junction - inspite of having "Direct & Indirect" type; is not present on Hybris Backoffice system. Thus they do not have access to Lion Marketplace. I have attached evidence - please refer to the same.

Kindly investigate and fix the issue with account type of this venue so they get access to Lion Marketplace.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Venue 10106131 is not replicated in Hybris Backoffice
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that venue is not available.
2. Then we checked in the data load and found that the data loaded is false, there were errors and asked MDG team about those errors.
3. MDG team informed us that the account is an EDI Partner Function which is why it is not replicated to Hybris. 
4. Informed user on the same and user asked us to remove the EDI Partner Function as they want this account to be available in Marketplace.
5. We then reached out to MDG Business team to remove the EDI Partner Function.
6. After removing the EDI Functionality Venue # 10106131 is replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors.
7. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that they were able to login in Marketplace.



Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044550 was raised due to the venue 10106131, XO Cellars Noosa Junction, not being present on the Hybris Backoffice system despite having a Direct and Indirect type. This issue was preventing the venue from accessing the Lion Marketplace. The problem was identified in the SAP Hybris eCommerce application and was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm group. The issue was initially thought to be related to the account type of the venue, but further investigation revealed it was due to the venue having an EDI Partner Function.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The team checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that the venue was not available.
2. They then checked the data load and found errors, prompting them to ask the MDG team about these errors.
3. The MDG team informed them that the account had an EDI Partner Function, which was why it was not replicated to Hybris.
4. The user was informed of this and requested the removal of the EDI Partner Function to make the account available in the Marketplace.
5. The team reached out to the MDG Business team to remove the EDI Partner Function.
6. After the removal of the EDI Functionality, Venue 10106131 was replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors.
7. The user was informed of this and confirmed that they were able to log in to the Marketplace.

The issue was resolved by following these steps. To prevent similar issues in the future, it is recommended to ensure that EDI Partner Functions are correctly maintained and removed when necessary.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Staff Sales issue - Shani Nayee - BPID 50044067 - shani.nayee@lionco.com – Incorrect Account Setup
Description:
Hi Team,

Team member BPID 50044067 - shani.nayee@lionco.com is unable to see staff special pricing on Staff Sales site. All products seem to have "View price in cart" message. 4. After the changes done by MDG Business team, we can see the ZRSS condition type.

Summarized_Recommendations:

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Lion Favorites List - NA Products
Description:
Good afternoon team,

Hybris system has reported a list of NA products in customer's favorite lists. I have request SKU team to provide a list of replacement SKUs or confirm SKU deletion status. Once a response is received from them, we can action this report.

Report is in attachments of this ticket.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Lion Favorites List - NA Products
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We have a report generated for Lion Favorites List - NA Products which helps in getting the list of Obsolete Products in Marketplace Favorites list for customers.
2. User gets the data from SKU team, whether an Obsolete product should be replaced with another SKU or removed from Customers Favorite list.
3. With the data provided by the user, we proceed with replacement and removal of Obsolete products in the list.
4. For replacing, we do need wishlistEntryPk and replacementPk. With that we have query and run along with it.
5. For removing, we have a script were we keep the product numbers in the script and run that in HAC Console.
6. Validation is logging into the Marketplace and checking whether the product removed or replaced.
7. In Backoffice with wishlistPk we will validate the same.
 

Resolution - Replacing and removing of obsolete Materials will be done by following above steps.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044540 was raised by Chinmaya from Lion Marketplace Support. The issue was regarding NA products in customers' favorite lists on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. Chinmaya requested the SKU team to provide a list of replacement SKUs or confirm SKU deletion status. The task was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm group.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution was carried out by Sreeja Gadd, a Hybris Analyst. The steps taken were as follows:

1. A report was generated for Lion Favorites List - NA Products, which helped in getting the list of Obsolete Products in Marketplace Favorites list for customers.
2. The user got the data from SKU team whether an Obsolete product should be replaced with another SKU or removed from Customers Favorite list.
3. With the data provided by the user, the team proceeded with replacement and removal of Obsolete products in the list.
4. For replacing, wishlistEntryPk and replacementPk were needed. With that, a query was run.
5. For removing, a script was used where the product numbers were kept in the script and run in the HAC Console.
6. Validation was done by logging into the Marketplace and checking whether the product was removed or replaced. In Backoffice with wishlistPk, the same was validated.
7. After the resolution, the user was asked to validate the solution from their end. The user confirmed the resolution and gave permission to close the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard procedures.

Short description: [BRQ-BS][CUS1-IUE2]SAP C4C Access
Description:
Location: Camberwell
Contact Number: 61448346035
Resolution notes: Hi Matt - thanks for your confirmation. As discussed, for any issues with regards to missing accounts/customers on your access, please raise an ISM ticket for Sales Excellence team. They should be able to help you on this type of issue.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044530 was raised by a user named Matt who was unable to access SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C). The issue was categorized under Sales & Marketing Products, specifically under the subcategory of Cloud for Customer (C4C). The user was located in Camberwell and his contact number was provided. The user wanted to access all Victorian Based Accounts on C4C. Despite several attempts, the user was still unable to access SAP C4C.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and work notes, the following steps were recommended to resolve the issue:

1. Ensure that the employee is already in C4C.
2. Follow the instructions to search for the C4C user and provision access. This involves logging into C4C, going to Administrator->General Settings->Business Users workcenter, searching for the user, and editing their access rights.
3. When assigning access to new users for the first time, go to Administrator->Employees workcenter, search with Employee number or Firstname/Lastname, select Edit, select the Department field by clicking on OVS(F1) double square, select AU01 for Australian users and NZ01 for New Zealand users, and click Save and Close.
4. For approvals, ensure that the user's leader has approved the ticket.
5. If the user is still unable to access the necessary accounts, he should raise an ISM ticket for the Sales Excellence team who should be able to help with this type of issue.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the C4C system.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Relationship of BPID 41100346 in MDG is NOT replicating in Hybris Backoffice
Description:
Good afternoon S-NOW team,

Relationship of BPID 41100346 with venue 10106131 in MDG, is not replicating in Hybris Backoffice. Can you please investigate and fix? I have attached screenshot of the evidence.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Relationship of BPID 41100346 in MDG is NOT replicating in Hybris Backoffice
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that BPID # 41100346 is not replicated and in data loaded there are errors.
2. We asked MDG team about those errors and this is related to the ticket # INC0044550 where the Venue # 10106131 is not replicated due to EDI Partner Function.
3. As per the User request we have removed the EDI Partner Function with the help of MDG Business team.
4. After removing the EDI Functionality Venue # 10106131 is replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors. Along with the Venue the BPID # 41100346 which is linked to # 10106131 is now replicated to Hybris without errors.
5. Informed user on the same and got confirmation that they were able to login in Marketplace.



Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044436 was raised due to a replication issue between the Master Data Governance (MDG) and Hybris Backoffice. The relationship of BPID 41100346 with venue 10106131, which was established in MDG, was not replicating in Hybris Backoffice. This issue was identified by the AM - Hybris eComm team and was categorized under SAP with a low priority.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket, the following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

1. The team checked in Hybris Backoffice and confirmed that BPID 41100346 was not replicated and there were errors in the data load.
2. The MDG team was asked about these errors and it was found that this issue was related to ticket INC0044550 where the Venue 10106131 was not replicated due to an EDI Partner Function.
3. As per the user's request, the EDI Partner Function was removed with the help of the MDG Business team.
4. After removing the EDI Functionality, Venue 10106131 was replicated to Hybris Backoffice without errors. Along with the Venue, the BPID 41100346 which is linked to 10106131 was now replicated to Hybris without errors.
5. The user was informed about the resolution and confirmation was received that they were able to login in Marketplace.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Resolution notes:
Issue: Orders for SA should run through cut off today for Tuesday 03.10.2023 delivery as 02.10.2023 is holiday

ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044408 was raised due to an issue with the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. Orders for SA were supposed to run through cut off for Tuesday 03/10/2023 delivery, but orders placed after cut off were still going on for Tuesday 03/10/2023 instead of the next delivery day. The issue was suspected to be related to the Y2 calendar. An example was given of order 12794229, which was placed after cut off and should have gone on for delivery 10/10/2023.
Summarized_Recommendations:

2. It is recommended to monitor the system to ensure that the changes have effectively resolved the issue.
3. If similar issues arise in the future, it would be beneficial to investigate if there are any other calendar-related discrepancies that could be causing the problem.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Issue with 2 skus not showing on MP
Description:
HI Hybris team
Please could you look at 2 skus below:
1259163 # White Claw Ref Limn 330ml Can Pack 6x4
1259178 # White Claw Ref Strw 330ml Can 6x4 Pack
They have no restrictions as advised by SKU team, but is not visible to customers.
I have tested a few customers, and it does not show 
Please could this be looked as a priority as these are 2 New skus which went live this week.

thanks
Gurinder.
Resolution notes:
Issue - Issue with 2 skus not showing on MP

Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked the 2 SKU in backoffice and found that there are exclusive records for 4 customers.
2. So the SKU are not visible to all users.
3. As a temporary fix after user confirmation deactivated the exclusion record in hybris and did indexing.
4. The 2 SKU are now visible on Marketplace.

Resolution - Deactivated the exclusion record in hybris and did indexing and now SKU are visible in Marketplace.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044335 was raised due to an issue with two SKUs (1259163 and 1259178) not being visible to customers on the Marketplace (MP), despite having no restrictions as advised by the SKU team. These were new SKUs that went live in the same week. The issue was identified as a priority by the Hybris team.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved several steps:

1. The team checked the two SKUs in the backoffice and found that there were exclusive records for four customers. This was the reason why the SKUs were not visible to all users.
2. As a temporary fix, after user confirmation, the team deactivated the exclusion record in Hybris and performed indexing.
3. The two SKUs then became visible on the Marketplace.
4. The team informed the user that the solution for the ticket had been completed and set the status of the ticket to RESOLVED.

Short description: [BRQ]AUC Settlement issue for account 8890420
Description:
HI Kowlini,
Kindly help assist as we are having an error in AUC settlement wherein the remaining balance in account 8890420 should be clear as it is affecting the 632 balance.  I have sent the snip in teams
Resolution notes:
Resolution:
For the account 8890420 it is not possible to post anything manually as this GL is defined as secondary cost element hence previously also I have suggested to reverse the settlement and then post to 632 account manually. It is not possible to post the loader along with 8890420 account as per SAP standard setting.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044303 was raised due to an issue encountered during the settlement of balance in AUC Assets. The user was trying to clear the remaining balance in account 8890420 as it was affecting the balance in account 632. However, an error was encountered during this process. The account 8890420 is defined as a secondary cost element, which means it is not possible to post anything manually to this account. This issue needed urgent resolution as it was affecting the balance in account 632.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue, the following steps can be taken:

1. Reverse the Settlement: As suggested in the resolution notes, the first step should be to reverse the settlement. This can be done using the SAP S4 Record to Report (R2R) system.

2. Post to Account 632 Manually: After reversing the settlement, the next step is to post to account 632 manually. This is necessary because it is not possible to post the loader along with account 8890420 due to SAP standard settings.

3. Check the Transactions Posted Against the WBS Element: This step involves checking the transactions that have been posted against the WBS element. This can help identify any errors or issues that may have occurred during the posting process.

4. Validate the WBS Master Data: The WBS master data should be validated to ensure that it is correct and up-to-date. This can help prevent any errors or issues in the future.

5. Check the Settlement Rule: The settlement rule should be checked to ensure that it is correct and functioning as expected. This can help prevent any errors or issues during the settlement process.

6. Analyze the FXA Fixed Asset Master Data: The FXA fixed asset master data should be analyzed to identify any errors or issues. This can help ensure that the data is accurate and up-to-date.

7. Maintain the Cost Center in the Asset Master Data: The final resolution was to maintain the cost center in the Asset master data, which resolved the error.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] [QI03 -IUE2] SAP automatically putting in results

Summarized_Recommendations:

1. Confirm that SAP is not recording any results. This was explained to the user and confirmed over MS Teams.

4. Investigate the Fiori screen entry process to ensure it is functioning correctly and is not contributing to the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][SURV-IUE2]SA November BOM Sell In not loaded to visits
Description:
Hi team, can someone please help to look at this survey (SA November BOM Sell In), it was created by Ingrid Lowe on the 6/9/2023 and hasn't attached to any visits this week.  I have looked at the Survey, Activity Plan and Routing Rule and I cannot see anything obvious as to why it's not attaching, it's been a while so compared to one of my older surveys set ups and all looks OK to me.  I know they were looking at adding physical visit however I don't believe it's necessary and in this case would be for all visits.  If someone can please help and look into.
Thanks T
Resolution notes:
Issue : Surveys not appearing in visits
Resolution : Advised to tick the assign automatically checkbox in activity plans
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044278 was raised by a user who was having trouble with a survey, "SA November BOM Sell In", not attaching to any visits. The survey was created by Ingrid Lowe on the 6th of September 2023 and despite being created, it was not appearing in any visits for that week. The user had checked the Survey Activity Plan and Routing Rule but could not identify any obvious reasons for the issue. The user requested assistance in resolving this issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution provided by the team was to tick the "Assign Automatically" checkbox in the activity plans. This would ensure that the surveys are automatically added to the visits. The steps to follow are:

1. Create the Plan.
2. Tick the "Mandatory" and/or "Automatically Assign" on the Header.
3. Add the Survey. This will automatically copy the header settings.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket. If you are facing a similar issue, it would be advisable to follow these steps. If you encounter any issues or have further questions, please reach out to the AM - Hybris Marketing and C4C team for assistance.

Short description: [BRQ]Order missed cut off and went through the following day
Description:
Hi Team, 
Order 12786849 was placed on 25.09.2023 at 11.09am prior to cut off (should have gone through cut off Monday 25.09.2023 at 12pm) but it did not go through cut off that day. 
The order then ran through cut off the following day 26.09.2023 even thought the order was dated for the same day 26.09.2023 and was delivered 27.09.2023- a day late.
There were no changes made to the order and no obvious reason for the batch job to push the order a day late? are you able to assist?
Resolution notes:
Issue: Order missed cut off and went through the following day
Resolution: upon checking, the order didn't go through cut-off on 25.09 because it is blocked by user. Provided the log for the same to Julia. Then the same order is picked by 26.09 cut-off job.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044238 pertains to an order (12786849) that missed its scheduled cut-off time. The order was placed on 25/09/2023 at 11:09 am, before the 12 pm cut-off, but it did not go through the cut-off that day. Instead, it ran through the cut-off the following day (26/09/2023), even though the order was dated for the same day. As a result, the order was delivered a day late on 27/09/2023. There were no changes made to the order and no apparent reason for the batch job to push the order a day late.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the order didn't go through the cut-off on 25/09/2023 because it was blocked by a user. The log for this was provided to Julia. The order was then picked up by the 26/09/2023 cut-off job. 

Steps to avoid similar issues in the future:
1. Ensure that orders are not blocked by users around the cut-off time.
2. Monitor the cut-off jobs closely to ensure they are processing orders as expected.
3. Maintain open communication with all stakeholders to manage expectations regarding order processing times.
4. Respond to the survey generated upon ticket closure to provide feedback and help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]10105353 - Royal Hotel Kalbar - XXXX Gold pricing issue
Description:
Good afternoon team,

Venue 10105353 has reported / complained about LUC not matching for XXXX Gold Can 30 Pack - PDP Vs In-cart. I have confirmed the pricing discrepancy. Please see the evidence attached. Kindly investigate and fix at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - 10105353 - Royal Hotel Kalbar - XXXX Gold pricing issue
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked for the pricing conditions we received in Hybris end and found that there are two active ZCP1 condition type
2. Checked with O2C team and found that the two active ZCP1 CCs are not present in S4.
3. Hence asked for MODE C with MDG team and after the night job run the next day we received the pricing conditions without two ZCP1.
4. Informed user that now prices are matching in both catalogue and cart pages


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044234 was raised due to a pricing discrepancy for the Royal Hotel Kalbar (Venue 10105353) on the SAP Hybris eCommerce platform. The issue was specifically related to the LUC (List Unit Cost) not matching for XXXX Gold Can 30 Pack between the Product Detail Page (PDP) and the cart. The problem was identified when the venue reported and complained about the issue. Upon investigation, it was found that there were two active ZCP1 condition types in the Hybris end, but these were not present in S4.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by following these steps:

1. Check Pricing Conditions: The team checked the pricing conditions received at the Hybris end and found two active ZCP1 condition types.

2. Consult with O2C Team: The team consulted with the O2C team and discovered that the two active ZCP1 condition contracts (CCs) were not present in S4.

3. Request MODE C with MDG Team: The team requested a MODE C operation with the MDG team. After the night job run the next day, the pricing conditions were received without the two ZCP1.

4. Inform User: The user was informed that the prices were now matching in both the catalogue and cart pages.

5. User Validation: The user was asked to perform a validation from their end to confirm that the issue was resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the steps taken by the team to resolve the issue.

This issue was similar to a previous one related to order 12765506. Despite the previous Outbound Delivery (OBD) being deleted, SAP generated another OBD, leading to the current issue. The root cause of the problem was identified as a duplicate ticket in reference to ticket no INC0044081. The issue was due to the order being created with an incorrect unit of packaging for the material.

Short description: [BRQ]Issue with Capex for Elements Seafood Grillhouse acct 10165761
Description: Reroute work approval SWIA for Capex. Email attached
Resolution notes:
Resolution: Rerouted the approval

steps: How to reroute approval via SWIA
1. Go to SWIA and enter the following parameters.
Top-Level Task: WS90200036 (Project Request Workflow template)
Status: Filter for not equal to COMPLETED (this will select open tasks only)
Created On: Enter desired creation date range.
Creation Time: Enter 00:00:00 to 23:59:59 to get all created for the whole day
 


2. Select the Approval Task (TS90200105).
 

3. Click on Display Work Item (Administration) button or simply press F7.
 

_
4. Click on Forward button.
 

5. Enter the User ID of approver to be routed to. Then click on Continue (check icon) button or simply press Enter.
 

Status message below will show confirming successful routing.
 

6. To verify, click on Workflow Log button.
 

Click on Agent icon.
 

Click on Selected Agent button.
 

New approver should be showing in the list of agents.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044146 pertains to an issue with Capex for Elements Seafood Grillhouse account 10165761. The problem is related to the SAP S4 Record to Report (R2R) business application. The issue required rerouting of work approval in SWIA for Capex. The ticket was assigned to the AM SAP R2R group and was categorized under SAP. The priority level of the ticket was low.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution for this issue involved rerouting the approval steps. Here are the steps that were taken to resolve the issue:

1. Go to SWIA and enter the following parameters:
   - Top-Level Task: WS90200036 (Project Request Workflow template)
   - Status: Filter for not equal to COMPLETED (this will select open tasks only)
   - Created On: Enter desired creation date range
   - Creation Time: Enter 000000 to 235959 to get all created for the whole day

2. Select the Approval Task TS90200105.

3. Click on "Display Work Item Administration" button or simply press F7.

4. Click on "Forward" button.

5. Enter the User ID of the approver to be routed to. Then click on "Continue" check icon button or simply press Enter. A status message will show confirming successful routing.

6. To verify, click on "Workflow Log" button. Click on "Agent" icon. Click on "Selected Agent" button. The new approver should be showing in the list of agents.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ-DT][PO1-IUE1]  HNK 1255521 - Incorrect QTY STO after converted from STRs
Description:
Hi Alma,

Following up our Teams chat I think there is a rounding value and/or incorrect calculation for Heineken Lgr as this material is 168CAR = 1PAL but STO 7403718521 was incorrectly converted from 1.99987PAL (IBP) to 288CAR in SAP S4. Please refer to attached doc.

Thanks for letting me know how to identify root cause and resolve it.

RD
Business Application: SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE)
Resolution notes:
Resolution steps we were unable to replicate the issue in EMT, hence we have found that material has picked the correct quantity of conversion.
in future if face the issue again we will raise to SAP
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044137 pertains to an issue with the conversion of Stock Transfer Requisitions (STRs) to Stock Transfer Orders (STOs) in the SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE). The problem arises with the material Heineken Lgr, which has a conversion rate of 168CAR to 1PAL. However, STO 7403718521 was incorrectly converted from 199987PAL (rounded to 2PAL) in IBP to 288CAR in SAP S4. The user suspects a rounding value or incorrect calculation issue. Despite attempts to replicate the issue in the EMT, the team was unable to do so and found that the material picked the correct quantity of conversion.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Continue Monitoring: As per the resolution notes, the issue could not be replicated during testing. The material setup appears to be correct. If the issue arises again, it should be reported immediately for further investigation.
2. Reach Out to SAP: If the issue reoccurs, the team should reach out to SAP for further assistance.
3. Close the Ticket: Given that the issue could not be replicated and the material setup appears to be correct, the ticket can be closed for now. However, the situation should continue to be monitored.
4. Test Case Creation: If a similar issue arises in the future, a test case should be created to investigate the problem further.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.
