Short description: SAP is reporting incorrect numbers for Quality and Performance on GL1S12 Filler at XXXX Milton Site
Description: The filler speed is being recorded incorrectly. The filler runs at approx 54k however is registering at 129,480k which is affecting the overall results.
Resolution notes:
Issue:  SAP is reporting incorrect numbers for Quality and Performance on GL1S12 Filler at XXXX Milton Site

Resolution: Numbers displayed are aligned with historian data and those are expected numbers if the filler is running at full speed. No fix is needed for this incident.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044131 pertains to an issue with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system at the XXXX Milton Site. The problem was that the filler speed on the GL1S12 Filler was being recorded incorrectly. The filler was running at approximately 54k, but it was registering at 129480k, which was affecting the overall results. The issue was categorized under Data Reporting & Analytics Products and was assigned to the AM SAP MII group. The priority level for this ticket was low.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Validate the Numbers: The numbers displayed are aligned with the historian data and are the expected numbers if the filler is running at full speed. Therefore, no fix is needed for this incident.
2. Monitor the System: A separate system that monitors the filler speed agrees with the numbers in the historian. This system has previously validated the reject number recordings during the commissioning of the machine for each of the error cases.
3. Understand the Data: The chart is showing an instantaneous speed. Looking at the MPM_PROD_RUN_DATA table, it appears that the 1037 data point has been missed, so the 1038 point is in fact the sum of 1037 and 1038. This is reflected in the EFFEC_DURATION field.
4. Close the Incident: As the numbers displayed in the chart are expected numbers and aligned with the historian, the incident can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated independently.

Short description: [BRQ]ZFFS freight var. rate setup
Description:
Hi team, 
There is ZFFS freight var. rate of 1.59 applied to the price of SKU 1253141 in sales order 12732773 for customer Geoffrey Hughes (export). Could you please advise what has triggered the ZFFS as normally we don't charge freight to export customer. Is it to do with customer setup?
Thanks
Cathy
Resolution notes:
Issue: Could you please advise what has triggered the ZFFS as normally we don't charge freight to export customer. Is it to do with customer setup?
Resolution: Upon checking, ZFFS condition type is determined in Export order because of customer master set up. In customer master, we can see freight list maintained as EXP which satisfy the condition record in VK13.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044128 was raised due to an unexpected ZFFS freight variable rate of 1.59 being applied to the price of SKU 1253141 in sales order 12732773 for customer Geoffrey Hughes (export). The user, Cathy, was seeking clarification on what triggered the ZFFS as freight charges are not typically applied to export customers. She wondered if this was related to the customer setup.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the ZFFS condition type was determined in the Export order due to the customer master setup. In the customer master, the freight list was maintained as EXP, which satisfied the condition record in VK13. The resolution provided was that the ZFFS condition type was indeed triggered due to the customer setup. The steps taken were as follows:

1. The issue was identified and checked in the SAP S4 system.
2. It was found that the ZFFS condition type was determined in the Export order due to the customer master setup.
3. In the customer master, the freight list was maintained as EXP, which satisfied the condition record in VK13.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]ISM Ticket 883440 - LUC Pricing on PDP does not match LUC pricing in-cart
Description:
Good afternoon Team,

Customer 10154410 (Nyabing Community Hub) has complained that the LUC pricing of products on PDP doesn't match with LUC in-cart. I have confirmed that the pricing doesn't match. Evidence attached. Kindly investigate the issue.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - ISM Ticket 883440 - LUC Pricing on PDP does not match LUC pricing in-cart
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked for the pricing conditions we received in Hybris end and found that there are two active ZCP1 condition type
2. Checked with O2C team and found that the two active ZCP1 CCs are not present in S4.
3. Hence asked for MODE C with MDG team and after the night job run the next day we received the pricing conditions without two ZCP1.
4. Informed user that now prices are matching in both catalogue and cart pages


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044122 was raised due to a discrepancy between the LUC (List Unit Cost) pricing of products on the Purchase Display Page (PDP) and the LUC in the cart for customer 10154410, Nyabing Community Hub. The customer complained about this issue and it was confirmed by the support team that the pricing did not match. The issue was categorized under SAP in the Hybris eComm category and was assigned to the AM Hybris eComm team.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by the team through the following steps:

1. The team checked the pricing conditions received at the Hybris end and found that there were two active ZCP1 condition types.
2. The team consulted with the O2C team and found that the two active ZCP1 CCs were not present in S4.
3. The team requested a MODE C operation with the MDG team. After the night job run the next day, the pricing conditions were received without the two ZCP1.
4. The user was informed that the prices were now matching in both the catalogue and cart pages.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the steps taken by the team to resolve the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]Error in DEpreciation Run
Description: HI Kowlini, requesting for your assistance in the attached error, we have run depreciation today and encountered error saying "Account 'Acc.Dep. Accnt.for Ordinary Depreciation' could not be found" kindly assist please.
Resolution notes:
Resolution: Explained the business process
As this Asset falls under Land and we should not apply Depreciation for Land.
Delete this Asset while running depreciation run.

Thanks
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044114 pertains to an error encountered during a depreciation run in the SAP S4 Record to Report (R2R) system. The error message indicated that the Account 'Acc.Dep. Accnt.for Ordinary Depreciation' could not be found. The asset in question falls under the Land category, which should not be subject to depreciation according to business processes. There was a concern that this error might affect the AJAB (Asset Year-End Close) at the end of the year.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Understand the Business Process: It's important to note that assets falling under the Land category should not be subject to depreciation according to standard business processes.
2. Correct Asset Classification: Ensure that the asset in question is correctly classified under the Land category. If it's incorrectly classified, it could lead to errors during depreciation runs.
3. Delete Asset from Depreciation Run: To avoid this error in the future, it's recommended to delete this asset while running the depreciation run. This will prevent the system from attempting to apply depreciation to an asset that should not be depreciated.
4. Monitor Year-End Close: Keep an eye on the AJAB (Asset Year-End Close) process to ensure that this error does not impact the year-end procedures.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard SAP S4 R2R processes.

Short description: [BRQ] Order not able to be reprocessed in Monitor interface report
Description:
Hi Team,

Customer has ordered a sku 1201101 that is not available which turned up on our monitor report, i tried to reprocess the order and can't pull it through. Order management has allowed the sku but the order will not flow through to the system to be corrected to the correct sku. Can you please check why this can't be reprocessed. Thank you very much.

"Sold-To Party ID: 10115075
Continental Hotel 
P/O :7005933
Error: Material 1201101 has status: Returns Only
Product: BOAGS PREM LGHT 4X6X375ML BT CP
Emailed sku:   887487- Raised ticket to Sku management "
Resolution notes:
Issue: Order not able to be reprocessed in Monitor interface report
Resolution: the material 1201101 has a status of "35- Returns only". This is the reason why this error is coming. advised the user to raise an ISM ticket to change the material status
Application: S4
Change Request:NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044108 was raised due to an issue with reprocessing an order in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The customer had ordered SKU 1201101, which was not available and appeared on the monitor report. Despite attempts to reprocess the order, it could not be pulled through Order Management. Although SKU management had allowed the SKU, the order would not flow through to the system to be corrected to the correct SKU. The SoldTo Party ID was 10115075 and the PO was 7005933. The error was due to the material 1201101 having a status of "Returns Only".
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution for this issue was to change the status of the material 1201101. The material currently has a status of "35 - Returns only", which is causing the error. The user was advised to raise an ISM ticket to change the material status. Once the material status is changed, it will be available to order. The steps breakdown is as follows:

1. Identify the SKU causing the issue in the SAP S4 O2C system.
2. Raise an ISM ticket to change the material status.
3. Once the material status is changed, it should be available to order.
4. Try to reprocess the order.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][PGI1- IQU1]Issue with material 1258716
Description: Per email
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Business have initially created the order and change the packaging conversion of the material which causes misalignment of order and picked quantity. And also generated unnecessary delivery and write on in the system. 
Resolution: Business deleted the delivery created, rejected the order and reversed the write off done by the system.
Preventative: Lion Connect new resource was advise for the correct process and steps on how to delete the delivery and cancelled the order.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044081 was raised due to an issue with material 1258716 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system. The problem arose when the business initially created an order and changed the packaging conversion of the material, which led to a misalignment of the order and picked quantity. This also generated unnecessary delivery and write-on in the system. The business needed to delete the delivery, reject the order, and reverse the write-off done by the system.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Delete the delivery: The business should delete the delivery created for the order. This action was confirmed by Lara, who deleted OBD 87804947.
2. Reject the order: The order associated with the delivery should be rejected. This action was confirmed by Lara, who rejected order 12779736.
3. Reverse the write-off: The write-off done by the system should be reversed to correct the inventory and alignment in the system.
4. Preventative action: The new resource in Lion Connect was advised on the correct process and steps on how to delete the delivery and cancel the order to prevent similar issues in the future.
5. Monitor future orders: As agreed with the business, the situation will be monitored moving forward to ensure similar issues do not occur.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on further investigation or additional information.

Description: Hi team, this error is in our law report: Optimization request sent from SAP, Waiting for its acknowledgement from TMS- this is under OBD 0087795059. Can you please investigate and advise? Thank you
Resolution notes:
Root cause: As checked the sales order used for delivery no. 87795059, which is 12779736 has been used for delivery number 87778875 which was successfully processed with 1 CAR as per original order. The order was initially created with 24 BOT, while the material has a packaging of 12 BOT/1 CAR only. 
Resolution: AM team sent email to business to delete the erroneous delivery as duplicate and reject the line item in the SO. 
Permanent resolution: Business shouldn't be manually updating the conversion unit of the material as this will cause integration failure.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044034 pertains to an error in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The error was identified in the LAW report, specifically related to the Optimization request sent from SAP, which was waiting for acknowledgement from TMS. The issue was associated with OBD 0087795059. The root cause of the problem was identified as a discrepancy in the sales order used for delivery no 87795059. The sales order, 12779736, had been used for another delivery number, 87778875, which was successfully processed with 1 CAR as per the original order. However, the order was initially created with 24 BOT while the material has a packaging of 12 BOT/1 CAR only. This discrepancy led to the error.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The AM team recommended the deletion of the erroneous delivery as it was a duplicate and suggested rejecting the line item in the Sales Order (SO). The permanent resolution proposed was that the business should avoid manually updating the conversion unit of the material as this could lead to integration failure. The steps to resolve the issue are as follows:

1. Delete the erroneous delivery.
2. Reject the line item in the Sales Order.
3. Avoid manually updating the conversion unit of the material to prevent integration failure.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][REP3-IBT3]Weekly sales campaign reports have not been received - again
Description:
Hi Team,
Each week my team receive some sales campaign reports, as set up by Amy Veitch. 
These are usually run automatically and sent to our inboxes first thing on a Monday morning.
This ticket is to flag that these reports have not been received today.
Can you please look into this matter as our Shopper team rely on these reports to see what campaigns have been sold in, and  use these reports as target lists for when sending out promotional material direct to venues.
Last ticket raised on this subject was INC0041342.
Thank you,
Mema
Resolution notes:
Issue : C4C Broadcast failed
Cause : Number of record is too high in the broadcast
Resolution : Retriggered the Broadcast
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044030 was raised because the weekly sales campaign reports, which are usually received automatically every Monday morning, were not received. These reports, set up by Amy Veitch, are crucial for the Shopper team as they use them to see what campaigns have been sold and as target lists for sending out promotional material directly to venues. The issue was assigned to the AM - Hybris Marketing and C4C group and categorized under Data Reporting & Analytics Products. The problem was identified as a recurring issue, happening every month-end.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue was found to be due to the broadcast failing because the number of records in the reports was too high. 
2. The team retriggered the broadcast, which seemed to resolve the issue temporarily. 
3. However, given the recurring nature of the problem, it is recommended to have a discussion to find a more permanent solution. 
4. One possible solution could be to schedule the broadcasts at different times or increase the time limit for the broadcast completion, as it currently fails automatically if it cannot be completed within 60 minutes from the start time. 
5. It might also be beneficial to review the number of records in the reports and see if there's a way to manage them more efficiently to prevent the broadcast from failing. 

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on further investigation and findings.

Short description: [BRQ][DTW4-SDT1] - AFO data to be reloaded for all 3PL plants, refer original Ticket INC0043986
Description:
Hi team,

Please reload AFO data per Ticket INC0043986.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Issue: There was no 3PL SOH data for all plants for Sunday 24th September and most plants for Monday 25th September.

Resolution:

1) Identify the Plants and Dates of the data to be reloaded based on user request.

2) Delete requests loaded for current date in /LION/AD_LAW08.

3) Do selective deletion of data in AD_LAW08 & CM_LAW08 using filters in PLANT and DATE fields.

4) Load data from source to CM layer ADSO and then from CM layer to AD layer ADSO by running the DTP with Plant and Date filters.

5) Execute RSPC_API_CHAIN_START function module in SE37 to reload the data for current date.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044026 was raised due to an issue with the AFO data for all 3PL plants. The problem was that there was no 3PL SOH data for all plants for Sunday 24th September and most plants for Monday 25th September. The user requested a reload of AFO data as per the original ticket INC0043986.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution for this issue involved several steps:

1. Identify the Plants and Dates of the data to be reloaded based on user request.
2. Delete requests loaded for the current date in LIONAD_LAW08.
3. Perform selective deletion of data in AD_LAW08 and CM_LAW08 using filters in PLANT and DATE fields.
4. Load data from source to CM layer ADSO and then from CM layer to AD layer ADSO by running the DTP with Plant and Date filters.
5. Execute RSPC_API_CHAIN_START function module in SE37 to reload the data for the current date.

In addition, based on historic tickets, the following steps are recommended for resolving similar issues:

- Highlight the whole AFO table and press delete to remove all values.
- Once all data are removed, refresh the report again.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][PMR2-IDT1]Unable to consume 1258981
Description: Unable to consume material 1258981 to PO# 100003495901. Error reads: "No stock matched the selection"
Resolution notes:
Root cause: For material 1258981 goods movement bin  was not set up correctly in the PSA due to this material failed to consumed under the PO 100003495901.
Resolution: AM team informed business to update the material goods movement bin to STAGE_ING and asked to consume the material manually for the PO, and shared the helpsheet to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044025 pertains to an issue with the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW system, specifically in the Enterprise Warehouse Management (EWM) subcategory. The problem arose when the user was unable to consume material 1258981 to Purchase Order (PO) 100003495901. The error message displayed was "No stock matched the selection". The root cause of the issue was identified as an incorrect setup of the goods movement bin for material 1258981 in the Production Supply Area (PSA).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Identify the root cause: The issue was traced back to an incorrect setup of the goods movement bin for the material in the PSA.
2. Update the goods movement bin: The AM team advised the business to update the goods movement bin to STAGE_ING for the material.
3. Manual consumption: The business was instructed to manually consume the material for the PO.
4. Provide guidance: A help sheet was shared with the business to assist in the process.
5. Close the ticket: After the issue was resolved, the user was asked to close the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]PO DP Reference Data not visible in FBL1N
Description:
Hi, PO Downpayment (DP) data is entered by end user when creating the DP requests, but the entered data (supplier invoice number) is not visible in the Reference field in Manage Supplier Line Item (FBL1N). Data required to help automate the downpayment AP processes. Existing supplier using downpayment is supplier 8000121 ANHEUSERBUSCH INBEV MX99.

Refer to attached email and screenshots for details. Please investigate why the data is not visible in FBL1N and if it can be display. Thanks.
Resolution notes:
Inform to user How to get the reference field in FBL1N :
Steps: -
Step1: - Go to FBL1N transaction.
Step2: - Apply the filter for the clearing document and provide any clearing document which you want.
Step3: - execute the line items.
Step4: - Now reference field visible in reference column.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user reported an issue with the visibility of the Downpayment (DP) reference data in the Manage Supplier Line Item (FBL1N) in the SAP S4 Procure to Pay P2P system. The user needs this data to automate the downpayment Accounts Payable (AP) processes. The user has identified that the supplier invoice number, which is entered when creating the DP requests, is not visible in the Reference field in FBL1N. The user has requested an investigation into why the data is not visible in FBL1N and if it can be displayed.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided, the following steps were recommended to the user to get the reference field in FBL1N:

1. Go to the FBL1N transaction.
2. Apply the filter for the clearing document and provide any clearing document which you want.
3. Execute the line items.
4. Now the reference field should be visible in the reference column.

However, it was noted that the reference field is not required for ZV documents as these are already cleared accounts. The reference field is useful for clearing the accounts automatically. The user can find the reference for uncleared documents only, which is document type KA and RE for clearing document. 

It was suggested that a separate task be created for Kimberley Eroles to provide a Purchase Order (PO) History extract/report. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or clarification.

Short description: [BRQ] [GRN1-IIT1]BEVCHAIN ASN BLOCKED  0087781080
Description:
BEVCHAIN ASN 0087781080 cannot be unloaded or good receipted.
Error message : Goods movement bin not determined or entered.
Is there a help-sheet to edit the goods movement bin for a material?
This is the second instance of this issue.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: The ASN is blocked since the material for line item 20 was not maintained for Goods Movement Bin
Resolution: AM team maintained the Goods Movement bin of the material in /SCWM/PRDI transaction code
Preventive:  New materials should be assigned by the Goods Movement bin prior to usage of the material in the system.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0044005 pertains to a problem with BEVCHAIN ASN 0087781080, which could not be unloaded or good receipted due to an error message stating "Goods movement bin not determined or entered". This was the second instance of this issue. The business application affected was SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW. The user requested a help sheet to fix this issue.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The issue was resolved by the AM team who updated the Goods Movement bin for the material that was previously blocked. The line item has now been released. 
2. The root cause of the issue was that the ASN was blocked since the material for line item 20 was not maintained for Goods Movement Bin. 
3. To prevent this issue from recurring, it is recommended that new materials should be assigned by the Goods Movement bin prior to usage of the material in the system. 
4. The user should be provided with a help sheet to guide them on how to edit the goods movement bin for a material, as requested.
5. After the resolution, the business confirmed that the ticket could be closed. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and do not involve any additional insights or suggestions from my end.

Short description: [ALR] [ALR2-ICP4] Inodes/sybase/IUse%: 94  on  syavsapase01.lion.aws
Description:
Dear Team,
            An alert has been triggered from ORIGIN : OMi , Category : Linux, SubCategory : AWS is triggered at 2023-09-23 04:02:58 EST,
            
            Value : ,
            ciHint : syavsapase01.lion.aws|syavsapase01.lion.aws,
            Environment : PRD,
            Priority : 4 - Low
Resolution notes:
Hi Team,

We will now be setting the status of the ticket to RESOLVED.

Issue Details: Issue due to INodes in /sybase filesystem reaching 94% in syavsapase01 (ICD)
Business Impact: No business impact
Resolution Details: Removed old sybase trace log files.
SLA Breach Reason: N/A
Change#: N/A

Regards,
Irvin
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket with the number INC0043911 pertains to an alert that was triggered from ORIGIN OMi, under the category Linux and subcategory AWS. The alert was triggered on 23rd September 2023 at 04:02:58 EST. The issue was related to the inode usage in the sybase filesystem on the server syavsapase01lionaws, which reached 94%. The environment affected was PRD and the alert was of low priority (4). The ticket was assigned to the AM SAP Basis group and was related to the SAP Business Information Warehouse application. The issue was due to the inode utilization in the sybase filesystem reaching 94% on the syavsapase01 ICDB server. There was no business impact reported.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by the team by removing old sybase trace log files, which reduced the inode utilization. The IDM Development system was also restarted. The steps taken were:

1. Identified the high inode usage on the sybase filesystem on the server syavsapase01lionaws.
2. Removed old sybase trace log files to reduce the inode utilization.
3. Restarted the IDM Development system.
4. Set the status of the ticket to RESOLVED.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and no additional steps were generated by me.

Short description: [BRQ-SY][CAM1-IAP4]SMS Trigger Texts have not been showing since July
Description:
Hi team,

As noted above, when checking the SMS Trigger Texts segmentation block in SAP Marketing Cloud in the Segmentation Models tile, it indicates that the last response to an SMS Campaign by a customer was on July 27th. This can be seen in the provided screenshot. 

As we've sent dozens of SMS campaigns throughout August and September, there should be more SMS responses showing since July 27th. Can this be looked into?

Please note there's been a previous ticket on this issue: INC0032736
Resolution notes:
Hi Zoe - good day! As discussed on Teams, we are now tagging this ticket as resolved.

Root cause: There was a migration of hostname on Sinch side to which impacted the current replication of SMS back to SMC.

Resolution: We have updated the correct hostname on SMC configuration and also updated the latest mapping on CPI side to fix this issue permanently.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043826 pertains to an issue with the SMS Trigger Texts in the SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) application. The user noticed that the last response to an SMS Campaign by a customer, as indicated in the SMS Trigger Texts segmentation block in the Segmentation Models tile, was on July 27th. Given that multiple SMS campaigns were sent throughout August and September, the user expected more SMS responses to be showing since July 27th. The issue was categorized under Sales & Marketing Products, specifically SAP Marketing. The user also noted that there was a previous ticket on this issue (INC0032736).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Investigate the Issue: The team was asked to look into the issue and understand why the SMS responses were not showing up as expected.
2. Update Hostname: The root cause of the issue was identified as a migration of hostname on the Sinch side, which impacted the current replication of SMS back to SMC. The resolution involved updating the correct hostname on SMC configuration.
3. Update Mapping: The team also updated the latest mapping on the CPI side to permanently fix the issue.
4. Test the Solution: The user was asked to test the solution by creating a new SMS campaign in the test environment and report any issues encountered.
5. Await Response from Sinch: The team was awaiting a response from Sinch on the list of mobile numbers that sent SMS since July.
6. Deploy Changes: The team planned to deploy the changes overnight and revert the ticket to Sinch based on their testing.
   
Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: [BRQ][INT3-IDT1]Pricing not matching with Landing and cart page
Description:
Pricing for the 2 below customers is not matching the landing page and cart price
Ravensthorpe Palace Hotel -10110057 palacehotelravensthorpe@gmail.com 
10114952 - mallalahotel@outlook.com

screenshots attached
Resolution notes:
Issue - Pricing not matching with Landing and cart page
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked for the pricing conditions we received in Hybris end and found that there are two active ZCP1 condition type
2. Checked with O2C team and found that the two active ZCP1 CCs are not present in S4.
3. Hence asked for MODE C with MDG team and after the night job run the next day we received the pricing conditions without two ZCP1.
4. Informed user that now prices are matching in both catalogue and cart pages


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043788 was raised due to a discrepancy in pricing for two customers, Ravensthorpe Palace Hotel (10110057) and another customer (10114952). The issue was that the prices on the landing page and the cart page were not matching. Upon investigation, it was found that there were two active ZCP1 condition types in the Hybris end, which were not present in S4.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Check Pricing Conditions: The team checked the pricing conditions received at the Hybris end and found two active ZCP1 condition types.
2. Consult with O2C Team: The team consulted with the O2C team and found that the two active ZCP1 condition contracts (CCs) were not present in S4.
3. Request MODE C with MDG Team: The team requested a MODE C operation with the MDG team. After the night job run the next day, the pricing conditions were received without the two ZCP1s.
4. Inform User: The user was informed that the prices were now matching on both the catalogue and cart pages.
5. User Validation: After resolving the issue, the user was asked to perform a validation from their end to ensure that the solution was effective.
6. Respond to Survey: The user was asked to respond to a survey upon ticket closure to help improve the service provided to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Changing Venue Name on MP
Description:
Hey team,

This customer’s old account is still showing as active within MP even though it hasn’t been used in two years.

This has been causing confusion for the customer as one account is causing issues when trying to place orders.

Account number 10004567 is closed, however can we please make sure that it is showing as ZZZ for the customer.

 

When the customer has the option to switch venue, it is showing as this:

 

Please reach out if you have any further questions.

Cheers, Will Holmes
Resolution notes:
Issue - Changing Venue Name on MP
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in backoffice on the Account number 10004567 if the name has ZZZ or not.
2. Checked with MDG team on the account and found that there is ZZZ in the venue name.
3. As in S4 it is showing the name with ZZZ, we manually replicated account name and changed accordingly.
4. Informed user that Account number 10004567 is showing with ZZZ in the Marketplace.


Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue raised in ticket INC0043771 was related to a customer's old account (Account number 10004567) still appearing as active within the Marketplace (MP), despite it not being used for two years. This was causing confusion for the customer when trying to place orders. The customer requested that the account be marked as "ZZZ" to indicate its inactive status.
Summarized_Recommendations:

The following steps were taken to resolve the issue:

3. As in S4 it was showing the name with "ZZZ", they manually replicated the account name and changed it accordingly.
4. The user was informed that Account number 10004567 is now showing with "ZZZ" in the Marketplace.

Short description: [BRQ]Time stealer not closing downtime
Description: Time stealer not closing downtime, filler running the whole time.
Resolution notes: The reason for showing open downtime is that MII did not receive close downtime event on time. It was received at 21:12:54 instead of 19:49:50. Hence between 19:49:50 to 21:12:54 it was showing open downtime.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043711 pertains to an issue with the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system, specifically with the "Time Stealer" not closing downtime. Despite the filler running the whole time, the downtime was not closing as expected. The issue was identified as a low priority problem within the SAP MII assignment group. The problem was that MII did not receive the close downtime event on time. It was received at 21:12:54 instead of 19:49:50. Hence, between 19:49:50 to 21:12:54, it was showing open downtime.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Investigate the reason for the delay in receiving the close downtime event. This could involve checking the system logs or any error messages that were generated during this period.
2. Monitor the system to ensure that the close downtime events are received on time in the future.
3. If the issue persists, consider escalating it to SAP support for a more in-depth investigation.
4. Close the incident ticket, given the issue has been resolved and confirmed by Scott.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own understanding of the issue.

These OBDs were split due to large loads and have been delivered but not closed off in SAP. The business application team was asked to investigate this issue. The inventory team confirmed that there were no issues raised from S4 for these deliveries. However, the deliveries were not yet processed.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided and historical tickets, the following steps are recommended:

1. Confirm with the inventory team and BVC (BevChain) about the updated status of the deliveries. 

2. If the inventory team and BVC confirm that there are no issues on their end, proceed to the next step.

3. Check for any missing load number in the delivery. This could be a potential reason for the issue as the order might have been subjected to a redelivery request, effectively removing the order from the existing load. 

4. If the payload generates without the load ID, this could be the root cause of the issue.

5. Once all issues are resolved and confirmed by the business, close the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided and may need to be adjusted based on further details or developments.

Short description: [BRQ][IBD1-IDT1]88 pallets of finished goods without IBD
Description: 88 pallets of finished goods without IBD
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Rounding value of the material was again change from 1 to 9 which causes the rounding value in the STO and for the delivery to created with incorrect delivery quantity. Hence, ASN was not created and sent to BVC to receipt and to scan.
Resolution: AM team manually updated the delivered quantity in the deliveries to match the pick quantity and manually PGI. 
Preventive: Sent email to MDG team to revert back the changes that was requested by the business so that it will not fail again for future deliveries.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043687 was raised due to an issue with 88 pallets of finished goods without an Inbound Delivery (IBD). The problem was identified as a change in the rounding value of the material from 1 to 9, which caused an incorrect delivery quantity in the Stock Transport Order (STO) and the delivery. This resulted in the Advance Shipping Notice (ASN) not being created and sent to BVC for receipt and scanning. This issue has been repetitive and has previously impacted End of Life (EOL) processing.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Manually Update Delivered Quantity: The AM team should manually update the delivered quantity in the deliveries to match the pick quantity and manually Post Goods Issue (PGI). This will ensure that the ASN is created and sent to BVC for receipt and scanning.
2. Revert Rounding Value Changes: The MDG team should be contacted to revert the changes made to the rounding value of the material. This will prevent future deliveries from failing due to incorrect delivery quantities.
3. Communication with Business: It is important to communicate with the business about the changes made and the impact it has on the deliveries. This will ensure that they are aware of the issue and the steps taken to resolve it.
4. Preventive Measures: To prevent this issue from recurring, it is recommended to send an email to the MDG team to revert back the changes that were requested by the business. This will ensure that the rounding value of the material is not changed in the future, preventing failures in future deliveries.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IDT1] 1258716 Batch RETURNZN appeared in inventory today in plant 1027
Description:
Hi team,

I will forward SAP screen shots for 1258716 Batch RETURNZN that appeared in inventory today in plant 1027.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Root cause: The Non Stock Order was created initially by the business with incorrect quantity which is 24. However, the packaging of the material per cartoon is only 12. Hence, the delivery was created with 12 BOT but is showing as deficit of stocks since it still reading the order quantity as 24.
Resolution: AM team manually updated the conversion quantity in the delivery from 24 to 12 so that PGI can push through.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043685 was raised due to an issue with batch 1258716, labeled RETURNZN, that appeared in inventory at plant 1027. The problem arose when a Non-Stock Order was initially created by the business with an incorrect quantity of 24, while the packaging of the material per carton was only 12. This discrepancy led to a deficit in stocks as the system was reading the order quantity as 24, but the delivery was created with 12 BOT (Bottles).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The AM team manually updated the conversion quantity in the delivery from 24 to 12 to allow the Post Goods Issue (PGI) to push through. This resolution was successful, and the team sought confirmation to close the ticket. 

Steps breakdown:
1. Identify the discrepancy between the order quantity and the actual stock availability.
2. Manually update the conversion quantity in the delivery to match the actual stock availability.
3. Post Goods Issue (PGI) to push through the delivery.
4. Seek confirmation to close the ticket after successful resolution.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [PROT-IOT1]add user to processing team
Description: Hi There, Please add Lisa- Marie Samuels to the NZ sales Excellence Team to process ISM tickets
Resolution notes:
Request: Add to processing team
Resolution : Added  Lisa- Marie Samuels to the NZ sales Excellence Team
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043673 was raised with a request to add Lisa Marie Samuels to the NZ Sales Excellence Team in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The ticket was categorized under Sales & Marketing Products and was assigned to the AM Hybris Marketing and C4C group. The priority of the ticket was low.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution was achieved by following these steps:

1. Log into C4C.
2. Open Administrator -> General Settings -> Org Structure.
3. Search for the processing team in Org Hierarchy using the Search Icon or by expanding the Org hierarchy. It is recommended to use the search Icon.
4. Once the processing team is identified, click the Org ID to open the team.
5. After opening the Team, navigate to the Employees Tab where employees and Managers (Escalation leaders) can be added or removed.
6. Click the Add button to add employees/Managers to the processing team.
7. Once the Add button is clicked, a screen will pop up where employees can be added.
8. Search and select the employee and press the Add button (Unlimited Date -> 12/31/9999 MM/DD/YYYY). Note: Valid To Date should be on or before the employee's Valid To date.
9. C4C will automatically pick up Valid From as today's date and Valid To as Unlimited. Update the Valid To date as mentioned in the employee's profile.
10. Employees' Valid From and Valid To Date can be found in People -> Employees Workcenter.
11. Click on the name and open the employee and expand the header field to see the Valid From and To Date.
12. Once done, untick the Primary Checkbox and Save.
13. For removing employees from the processing team, select the employee line item and press the Trash Button to delete and save.
14. The employee is now added/removed in the processing team. This can be confirmed in People -> employees -> Org Assignments.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the work notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ-AC][SEC1-S403]Need Access to SAP BW test and SAP BW q and Analysis for office
Description: Need Access to SAP BW test and SAP BW q and Analysis for office
Resolution notes: We have assigned BWT and BWQ access to user's profile, thus we are proceeding with closure of the ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user requested access to SAP BW test, SAP BW q, and Analysis for Office (AFO) in Microsoft Excel. The ticket was assigned a low priority and was handled by the AM SAP Security group. The user's profile was updated with BWT and BWQ access.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. To access Analysis for Office (AFO) in Microsoft Excel, the user should search for the Analysis for Microsoft Excel application or open Excel.
2. If AFO is installed, an 'Analysis' tab will be visible in the Excel ribbons. If the Analysis ribbon is missing, the user should refer to the knowledge article "Lion IT - AFO Add-in Missing in Excel".
3. The user should select a cell where they want to place the report and under the 'Analysis' tab, click on 'Insert Data Source' and then 'Select Data Source'.
4. Click 'Skip' on the Logon screen and the connections list will show.
5. Under Connections, the user should select the source system and click Next. The usual source of data for reporting is NGP2 Production BW/4HANA (BWP).
6. If asked, the user should input Client 010 and Language EN.
7. The user can directly search for their query, or display available queries under the 'Area' tab. It's important to select queries only (ending in Q00X like /LION/CP_R2R01_Q001) to avoid authorization errors.
8. For further instructions on other AFO functionalities, the user should refer to the attached 'AFO - Knowledge Articles for End Users.xlsx'.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the knowledge base document KB0011335.

Short description: For Basis Team - Issue with Solution Manager not being able to Pass Urgent change to Test
Description:
Hi Team,
  Can we have SOLMAN fixed so that we can use the function to move TRs into Test?

When I release the task to the transport in DEV 020, I go to “Pass Urgent change to Test” in SOLMAN.
When I save, I get this error:
"You can't set status due to status profile customizing or authorizations:

I was told months ago during Fermentum that this had something to do with the test clients and was temporary. The work-around is to have the Basis Team move the TR each week. 
It would be better to have SOLMAN working as it used to, so that users are able to move their TRs to Test by themselves.
The detailed message is attached.
Thanks,
Peter
Resolution notes:
Resolution: User has confirmed for access and ticket closure over TEAMS. Hence, closing the ticket.
RFC:CHG0034692
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043595 was raised by a user named Peter who was having issues with the Solution Manager (SOLMAN) in SAP Hana Cloud. The problem was that he was unable to use the function to move Transport Requests (TRs) into the Test environment. When he tried to save his changes, he received an error message stating that he couldn't set the status due to status profile customizing or authorizations. He mentioned that this issue had been previously identified during Fermentum and was supposedly temporary. The current workaround was to have the Basis Team move the TR each week, but Peter expressed a preference for SOLMAN to be fixed so that users could move their TRs to Test independently.
Summarized_Recommendations:

Short description: [BRQ] [QI05- IUE2] Could not enter into long term inspection lot to enter analytical results
Description: Heineken lager 1254837 Batch 0000156745 is usually a long term inspection which we can enter result even after the batch is been UD'd. But in this case we could not as it says status STIC. But the HKN inspection plan has already been set to long term inspection for some tests but could not access for this specific batch.
Business Application: SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE)
Resolution notes: Regarding the mentioned Inspection lot all inspection has completed, guided to user if user wants to re-enter result, as no action is pending from Am team after confirmation from user, we care closing this ticket.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043567 pertains to an issue encountered in the SAP S4 Manufacturing and Quality Environment (MQE). The problem was with the Heineken lager 1254837, Batch 0000156745, which is usually a long-term inspection where results can be entered even after the batch has been UD'd (Usage Decision). However, in this case, the user could not enter results as it showed status STIC. The Heineken inspection plan has already been set to long-term inspection for some tests, but access was not available for this specific batch. The issue was categorized under SAP and specifically under Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII).
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved guiding the user on how to reenter results as no action was pending from the AM team. The steps taken were as follows:

1. Open the 'Schedule Maintenance Plan' tile.
2. Enter the Maintenance plan number and hit Enter.
3. Click on 'Manual Call' to call a new inspection lot.
4. The start date will be automatically set to today's date but can be changed to a future date if required. Once the start date is set, click 'Continue'.
5. If there were two types of packages shown in the table, select the one required for the inspection lot. In this case, only the monthly inspection lot was required.
6. The inspection lot will then show up on the manual calls page with a status of 'Save to call'. Once the page is saved, the inspection lot will be created.
7. Click 'End of Process'.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [NSSR][BRQ][GRN2-IOT1]Open STOs for ZFINs that require closing or cancelling
Description:
We have 4 open STOs between Site 1016 and Bevchain 1024 that need to be closed.
They all are for pallets that do not exist.
The first is one that was Ghost Pallet Reversal but left an open STO.
The next 3 are pallets that were GR'd by Lion SAP support so suspect something unusual has happened.
Appreciate help with these to clear the reporting. Details attached as Excel file. Thanks Dave.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Clean -up of historical Ghost Pallets from storage location of 1006 before EOL have migrated to IM. 
Resolution: AM team have reversed the GR and deleted the IBD and scrapped the OBD and have saved the queue in SMQ3 as per recommendation from SAP.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043543 was raised due to four open Stock Transport Orders (STOs) between Site 1016 and Bevchain 1024 that needed to be closed. These STOs were for pallets that did not exist. One of the STOs was left open after a Ghost Pallet Reversal, and the other three were pallets that were Goods Receipted (GR'd) by Lion SAP support, indicating a potential unusual occurrence. The issue was related to the clean-up request of historical data, specifically historical Ghost Pallets from storage location 1006.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team reversed the Goods Receipt (GR) and deleted the Inbound Delivery (IBD).
2. The Outbound Delivery (OBD) was scrapped and the queue in SMQ3 was saved as per SAP's recommendation.
3. The business was advised to complete the reversal process of GR from MII since the Process Orders were closed due to the data being quite old.
4. The business was also advised to write off these materials from their inventory if there were no physical stocks available. They could use the reason code EOL discrepancies to clear the stocks.
5. After these steps, the business confirmed the closure of the ticket.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the actions taken by the respective teams.

Description:

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IDT1]Blocked ASN
Description:
1258885 CP White Claw Mango
We have Goods Receipt this material before.
However ASN 2256 is showing blocked.
Not sure if issue lies with the master data or material ordering.
Please advise as site is encountering this issue multiple times.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: ASN created was not populated with Goods Movement Bin for item no.10.
Resolution: AM team have manually updated the ASN with Goods Movement Bin through transaction code /SCWM/PRDI and this have unblocked the ASN. 
Preventive: Material must be set-up with Goods Movement Bin data in EWM.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043507 pertains to a blocked Advance Ship Notice (ASN) 2256 for the material "1258885 CP White Claw Mango". Despite having received goods for this material before, the ASN is showing as blocked. The site has encountered this issue multiple times. The root cause was identified as the ASN created was not populated with Goods Movement Bin for item no.10.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team manually updated the ASN with the Goods Movement Bin through transaction code SCWMPRDI, which unblocked the ASN. 
2. For a permanent fix, the Goods Movement Bin for this material must be maintained so that it will not fail in the future and for new materials. 
3. To avoid ASN failures, the following should be ensured:
   - The Purchase Order (PO) should not be in Edit mode when the supplier sends the ASN.
   - The supplier should adhere to ASN rules, such as not exceeding the maximum number of characters (10 characters) for the batch number.
   - The batch expiry date should be included in the ASN.
   - The correct unit of measure should be used in Dispatch Quantity.
   - The Ship Notice Type should be populated with either 'Actual' or 'Estimated'.
   - The Dispatch Quantity should match the Total Shipped Quantity.
4. After resolving the issue and with no pending actions, the ticket was moved for closure.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] [DP04-IUE1] Unable create a customer source combination
Description:
I am trying to create a customer source combination for Coles Liquor SA for Bevchain eagle Farm and receive the below rejected record. 

Existing :801604-1025 - Coles Liquor SA-Bevchain Gillman
Additional Combination to be created : 801604-1030- Coles Liquor SA-Bevchain Eagle Farm
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: Suggested the user to use a transaction code to maintain the Customer that is not visible in IBP.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user was trying to create a customer source combination for Coles Liquor SA for Bevchain Eagle Farm in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system but encountered a rejection. The existing record was 801604-1025 - Coles Liquor SA-Bevchain Gillman and the user wanted to create an additional combination: 801604-1030 - Coles Liquor SA-Bevchain Eagle Farm. The user was suggested to use a transaction code to maintain the Customer that is not visible in IBP.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided, the following steps can be taken to create a new customer account in MDG:

1. Go to MDG (Master Data Governance) Tile.
2. Choose 'Customer Requestor' and click on it to open a new tab.
3. Click on 'Process Customer' to open a new tab.
4. Click on 'New' from the dropdown, then click on 'Organisation'.
5. Click on 'Sold to/Payer/DQS/Exp/Groc'.
6. In 'Grouping', select 'Z001' from the dropdown list.
7. Add details such as Name line 1, address, language, Telephone, and Tax numbers (ABN/AU0).
8. Add relationships if a contact person is already existing in SAP.
9. Add a description (including the ticket number), notes, and attachments.
10. Go to 'ERP Customers', then 'Delivery and Payment Terms'.
11. Update terms to 'Y099', select from the list or type and enter.
12. Hit 'Done' twice.
13. Hit 'Save' and then 'Submit'.
14. Go through the Approval process. Approving the change request will give you an account number.
15. Add hierarchy if it is provided by the sales rep.

Please note that this account will not flow to C4C unless details like Shopper Channels and hierarchy are provided by the sales rep/requestor. The user was also advised to use the transaction code 'lionibpcusthier' for customer master hierarchy maintenance in S4.

Short description: [BRQ]Unable to select my name for 'Person Responsible' within 'Manage Project' tile in SAP
Description:
Hi There,
I have access to 'Manage Projects' tile in SAP and have started to load my CAPEX projects, however I cannot selet my name for the 'Person Responsible'. My name is not showing as an option to select. Screenshots attached. 
Is this a data issue with the picklist or have I selected something incorrectly which is driving the picklist options. 
Cheers,
Erin
Resolution notes: added name in PM list, requested fixed asset team to add name in CRF tool.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user, Erin Smith, encountered an issue while using the 'Manage Projects' tile in SAP Ariba onDemand. Despite having access to the tile and starting to load her CAPEX projects, she was unable to select her name for the 'Person Responsible' field. Her name was not appearing as an option to select. She was unsure if this was a data issue with the picklist or if she had selected something incorrectly which was affecting the picklist options.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by adding Erin Smith's name to the project manager list in SAP. The steps taken were as follows:

1. To get the employee id, the bp number was first retrieved using the se16n kna1 table, where the name was given as the username. This returned the customer number, i.e., the bp number.

2. The empid was then retrieved by going to the se16nBUT0ID table, where the bp number was inputted. This returned an 8-digit employee id number.

3. The username was then retrieved by going to su01d and inputting the first name or last name to find the exact username.

4. The name was then added to the project manager list by going to ngrac_e for ffid access logon. The reason was given as the incident description as inc number-ops6. A new entry was added with the Responsible number as the emp id number, the name, and the office user as the username. This was then saved.

Please note that these recommendations were generated based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][INT1-IDT1]Venue 10152323 status in Hybris Backoffice is CLOSED
Description:
Hi team,

Venue 10152323 has *CLOSED* status in Hybris Backoffice. Can you please investigate this issue? We need this venue to change its status from *CLOSED* to *ACTIVE*.

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue - Venue 10152323 status in Hybris Backoffice is CLOSED
Steps taken to resolve the issue :
1. We checked in backoffice and can see that the venue # 10152323 is in closed status
2. Checked with MDG team and found that there is a relationship "is replaced by" maintained which caused the issue. 
3. After correcting the relationship and now we can see the Venue status is in Active status.
4. Informed user that Venue status is ACTIVE now.

Resolution - Issue was resolved by following the above steps
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043351 was raised due to the status of Venue 10152323 in Hybris Backoffice being CLOSED. The user, Chinmaya from Lion Marketplace Support, requested an investigation into this issue and a change of the venue's status from CLOSED to ACTIVE.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution process involved the following steps:

1. The team first checked the backoffice and confirmed that the status of Venue 10152323 was indeed CLOSED.
2. They then consulted with the MDG team and discovered that a relationship had been replaced by 'maintained', which was causing the issue.
3. After correcting this relationship, the status of the Venue was updated to ACTIVE.
4. The user was then informed that the Venue's status was now ACTIVE.

The user, Chin Gailad, confirmed that the venue is now active and requested the closure of the ticket. The issue was resolved by following these steps. If similar issues arise in the future, it is recommended to follow the same process. Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge.

Short description: [BRQ][ACC1-IAC1]Cheers staff logins
Description: As per email to Rohit we have a number of non LionCo staff that dont have the same set up so is not sending through to Cheers Marketplace portal and there fore cant login. Aaron Browning has said that is because the emails in the AD profile are not the same and doesnt then flow through please get this fixed ASAP
Resolution notes:
Resolution Details: 
So there are two type of issues happened in this ticket-

1) Cheers user logon not working-  
Root cause-
We have checked with downstream systems and found that the email id is different in Success factors and S4, hence user is getting Cheers login issues. We checked the Success Factors to S4 replication logs for the "sarah.maingay@fourcornersspirits.com" [user who is having the issue] and found that its not replicating because of  "cost Center" error . 
Business MDG @Finance.MDG@lionco.com checked the issue on the "Cost center" error, once it is done we replicated the correct email address from SF to S4 and then redirect to hybris, this will fix the issue completely.

2) Beer points issue due to user data setup in S4-

this is a H2R issue which team fixed the user data setup in s4 and replicated the accounts once again which fixed the issue in hybris. User is now able to see the beer points for the expected staff user.

The issue is resolved now for the affected users.
We are closing the ticket as per user confirmation. Let us know if you have any questions.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043310 pertains to two main issues. The first issue is related to Cheers staff logins not working. The root cause was identified as a discrepancy between the ID in Success Factors and S4, which was causing login issues. The second issue was related to Beer points due to user data setup in S4. This was identified as a H2R issue which was fixed by the team.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. For the Cheers staff login issue, it was recommended to check the Success Factors to S4 replication logs for the user facing the issue. The issue was not replicating due to a cost center error. The Business MDG was tasked to check the issue on the cost center error. Once resolved, the correct address could be replicated from SF to S4 and then redirected to Hybris, which would completely fix the issue.
2. For the Beer points issue, the team fixed the user data setup in S4 and replicated the accounts once again which fixed the issue in Hybris. The user was then able to see the Beer points for the expected staff user.
3. The ticket was closed as per user confirmation. However, it was recommended to keep monitoring for any further questions or concerns related to this ticket. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: Default Ship Updates via Marketplace don't update data in S4
Description:
Hi team,

We've noticed that when a customer updates their default ship-to address via Marketplace, this does not update the customers default ship-to in S4.

Please refer to screenshots provided - as a test/example I had updated GG Wellington Hutt Rd's (10000976) default ship to from their own address/account to 20108811 Glengarry Wines via Impersonating their Marketplace account on Friday 15/09 but when I checked again on Sunday 17/09 the default ship-to address in S4 was still showing GG Wellington Hutt Rd 10000976.

Can you please investigate why changing the default address for an account via Marketplace doesn't change the default ship-to in S4?

Cheers,

Seth
Resolution notes: Closed by Caller
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043276, with a low priority, was raised concerning an issue with the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) system. The problem was identified when a customer updated their default "ship-to" address via the Marketplace, but this change was not reflected in the S4 system. The specific example given was for GG Wellington Hutt Rd (account number 10000976), which had its default "ship-to" address updated to Glengarry Wines (account number 20108811) via the Marketplace. However, when checked later, the S4 system still showed the default "ship-to" address as GG Wellington Hutt Rd. The ticket was assigned to the AM - SAP MDG group for investigation.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Investigate the integration between the Marketplace and the S4 system to identify any issues that might be preventing the update of the default "ship-to" address.
2. Check the synchronization process between the two systems to ensure that changes made in the Marketplace are correctly reflected in the S4 system.
3. Review the specific example provided (GG Wellington Hutt Rd and Glengarry Wines) for any anomalies that might have caused the issue.
4. If necessary, consider implementing a manual update process for the default "ship-to" address in the S4 system as a temporary workaround until the issue is resolved.
5. Once the issue is identified and fixed, conduct tests to ensure that updates made in the Marketplace are correctly reflected in the S4 system.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my own knowledge, and further investigation may be required.

Short description: [BRQ]Return orders - RT87723947 & RT87745258, failed.
Description:
Hi team,

Please advise on this issue.

Thanks,
Resolution notes:
Issue: Return orders - RT87723947 & RT87745258, failed.
Resolution: Return order was in open state due to missing route code, advised the user to add and update the customer master data as well
Application: S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043275 pertains to the failure of return orders RT87723947 and RT87745258. The issue was identified as the orders being in an open state due to missing route codes in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) business application. The user was advised to update the route code on the return and raise a ticket for Master Data Governance (MDG) to update the customer master data. However, the route codes for the Transportation Zone (Tzone) 1000020133 were not configured for shipping condition 02, leading to the failure.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Update the Route Code: The user should update the missing route code on the return order. 
2. Update Customer Master Data: After updating the route code, the user should raise a ticket for MDG to update the customer master data. This is crucial to ensure that the updated route code is reflected in the customer master data.
3. Configure New Route Code: If the shipping condition in the customer master is correct, a new route code needs to be configured for shipping condition 02. 
4. Contact Bevchain Team: If the order RT87723947 has not been received, the user should reach out to the Bevchain team to process this order.
5. Monitor Order Processing: The user should confirm when the orders are processed to ensure that the issue has been resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and the knowledge documents.

Short description: [BRQ][DTW4-IDT1] Customer is unable to view / download OPC for venue 10156281
Description:
Good afternoon team,

Venue 10156281 is unable to download OPC on Marketplace. I have attached screenshot of the error. Can you please investigate this?

Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue: Customer is unable to view / download OPC for venue 10156281
Root Cause: PSD is not enabled in the Customer master data for 10156281.
Resolution Steps:
1. Checked if there are data in the OPC Report in BO Prod for customer 10156281. No data found.
2. Checked in backend table for /LION/AD_REV48 if there are data for 10156281. No data found.
3. Checked the master data in t-code XD03 in S4 to check PSD for customer 10156281. PSD is blank.
4. Inform the user to raise an ISM ticket to update the customer master data.
5. Once updated, wait for the next run of PC_TD_REV_WEEKLY and check if data is now showing for customer 10156281.
6. Refresh the OPC Customer List report for the customer's banner (801122 - WA1).
7. Run the OPC publication for WA1 and wait for it to complete.
8. Ask user to validate the OPC report in Marketplace.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue pertains to a customer (Venue 10156281) who was unable to view or download the Order Price Condition (OPC) on the Marketplace. The root cause was identified as the PSD (Product Service Description) not being enabled in the Customer master data for 10156281. This resulted in no data being found for the customer in the OPC Report in BO Prod or in the backend table for LIONAD_REV48.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution steps provided in the ticket, the following actions are recommended:

1. Check if there is data in the OPC Report in BO Prod for customer 10156281. If no data is found, proceed to the next step.
2. Check in the backend table for LIONAD_REV48 if there are data for 10156281. If no data is found, proceed to the next step.
3. Check the master data in tcode XD03 in S4 to check PSD for customer 10156281. If PSD is blank, proceed to the next step.
4. Inform the user to raise an ISM ticket to update the customer master data.
5. Once updated, wait for the next run of PC_TD_REV_WEEKLY and check if data is now showing for customer 10156281.
6. Refresh the OPC Customer List report for the customer's banner 801122 - WA1.
7. Run the OPC publication for WA1 and wait for it to complete.
8. Ask the user to validate the OPC report in Marketplace.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific circumstances of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IUE2]ASN with extra line that needs to be deleted out so the ASN can close
Description:
We have a ASN (DN-00015016) where all but one of the items has been delivered.  We need to delete out the item that hasn't been delivered so we can close out the ASN.
When I try to do that, I get an error message saying that the Quantity Adjustment is not possible due to confirmed quantity.  I vaguely remember being able to do this once before, but I don't know what else needs to be done first.

If this can't be looked at today, can you please contact Calvin Lim between 6am and 2pm or Craig Heterick between 2pm and 10pm, as I'll be on leave.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Requested to GR the ASN (DN-00015016).
Resolution: AM team completed line item 30 and GR'd the ASN completely.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043089 pertains to an issue with an Advance Ship Notice (ASN) DN00015016 in the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) application. The ASN has one item that hasn't been delivered, and the user is trying to delete this item to close the ASN. However, an error message is displayed stating that the Quantity Adjustment is not possible due to confirmed quantity. The user recalls being able to perform this action before but is unsure of the necessary steps. The user requested assistance, and if the issue couldn't be addressed immediately, they provided contacts for further communication.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team completed line item 30 and Goods Receipt (GR) the ASN completely. This action seems to have resolved the issue.
2. For future reference, if a similar issue arises, it may be necessary to investigate the error message in more detail to understand why the Quantity Adjustment is not possible. 
3. If the issue persists, consider reaching out to a higher level of technical support or consulting with the software vendor.
4. After resolution, ensure to close the ticket and provide resolution notes for future reference.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of typical procedures for resolving such issues.

Short description: [BRQ-DT]15/09 National STRs Conversion to STOs not Working in SAP S4 - All orders not Released to BevChain
Description:
Hi Team,

I run deployment every day but today - specifically with QLD we have issues which is not allowing generating any automatic STOs 2.0 ex QLD to all other lanes resulting in manual intervention required to key orders for BevChain to load the finish goods.

I was informed a massive upload was done between 8.17am-8.40am today but when I published orders in IBP was 8.11am PRIOR the updates ...

Attached file of STRs errors. Could you please guide me how to identify error through SAP next time I know how to troubleshoot problem.

Thanks and Regards,
RD
Resolution notes:
Root Cause : when user was run the report , Material were going updated by Peter at the same time. 
Resolution Steps: User know the manually steps to convert the STR into STO.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0043065 was raised due to an issue with the conversion of National STRs to STOs in SAP S4. The problem was specifically with Queensland and it was preventing the generation of any automatic STOs 2.0 ex QLD to all other lanes. This resulted in manual intervention being required to key orders for BevChain to load the finished goods. The issue arose when a massive upload was done between 8:17am-8:40am on a particular day, but the orders in IBP were published at 8:11am, prior to the updates. The user requested guidance on how to identify such errors through SAP in the future.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The root cause of the issue was identified as a timing conflict between the user running the report and the material updates being done by Peter at the same time. 
2. The user is now aware of the manual steps to convert the STR into STO. 
3. To avoid such issues in the future, it was suggested that any urgent master data activity should be confirmed with the user prior to execution. This would ensure that there are no conflicts with the timing of report runs and updates. 
4. The ticket was closed as no further action was pending from the team's side.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] Customer (Staff Member) was charged a different price in-cart - Order #12687951
Description:
Hi team,

Please refer to the attachment. Customer saw a different price on the Product Display Page however, was charged a different price in-cart (Order #12687951). We need to refund the difference in price as calculated in the attachment. Can you please let me know who can refund this difference to staff member's account?

               Product Name                 SKU                PDP Price      In-cart Price Difference
Boags XXX Ale                             1255645                  $48.83                   $53.51             $4.68
Boags Premium Lager                     1201881                   $51.52                   $56.20             $4.68
Boags St. George                             1254749                   $40.68                   $54.00           $13.32

                                                                                   Grand Total                                                   $22.68


Regards,
Chinmaya
Lion Marketplace Support
Resolution notes:
Issue:  Customer (Staff Member) was charged a different price in-cart
Resolution: As advised by Trevor, informed the user to contact Destiny to process the refund
Application: S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue revolves around a customer staff member who was charged a different price in the cart for their order (Order 12687951) compared to the price displayed on the Product Display Page. The products in question are Boags XXX Ale, Boags Premium Lager, and Boags St George. The total difference in price amounts to $22.68. The user, Chinmaya, from Lion Marketplace Support, has requested a refund for the price difference.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and the attached "How to Raise a Pricing Credit Service" guide, the following steps should be taken:

1. Calculate the expected pricing: Export the data for the first order and the rekeyed order. Identify the line items where the pricing differs and calculate the difference. This will be the amount due for crediting.

2. Raise a complaint/credit request: Use the "Complaint Guided Creation - Debit/Credit Request" feature in the system. Enter the invoice number of the rekeyed order (Order 2) as the reference and select the billing document and items that need a pricing credit.

3. Enter the complaint details: Provide a description and select the appropriate category and credit reason.

4. Enter Resolution Notes: After creating the complaint, edit it to add resolution notes.

5. Create an Invoice Correction/Credit: Use the "Invoice Correction/Credit" feature to create a correction for each line item that needs a credit. Enter the condition type and the amount due for crediting for each line item.

6. Verify and finalize: Ensure that the Net Value equals the amount due for crediting. If correct, finalize the process.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the provided "How to Raise a Pricing Credit Service" guide.

3. The AM SAP LAW team should then clear the incorrect stock data. In this case, they cleared the 40 kg stock in the Stock Overview for material 1258974 and batch RH258 under SLoc 1001.
