Short description: [BRQ] [SLP4-IOT3] App Job inconsistencies
Description:
It's been raised that our Operator Name is inconsistent between jobs.

ZBA_SP_SUPPLY_INPUT_KF_OFFSET is used in only 3 App Jobs, and contains only 11 KFs
ZBA_SP_SUPPLY_INPUT_KF is used in almost every other job, including jobs that have an offset, and has 17KFs

Can we please confirm what the difference is between the two, and align them?
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: Details were provided as requested in the ticket - on feedback after 3 consecutive follow ups. Closing via 3-strike rule.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042807 was raised due to inconsistencies in the Operator Name between jobs in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) application. The operator ZBA_SP_SUPPLY_INPUT_KF_OFFSET is used in only 3 App Jobs and contains only 11 Key Figures (KFs), while ZBA_SP_SUPPLY_INPUT_KF is used in almost every other job, including jobs that have an offset, and has 17 KFs. The user requested clarification on the difference between the two and alignment of them.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the information provided, the differences between the two operators are as follows:
1. Time selections for both are technical, but ZBA_SP_SUPPLY_INPUT_KF_OFFSET has an offset of 1.
2. Both operators are used by different Key Figures.

To resolve the issue, the following steps were taken:
1. Provided details as requested in the ticket.
2. Followed up with the user for feedback three times.
3. Edited the Snapshot details in the planning area to refresh the operator IDs in the application job.

The resolution was completed without the need for a Request for Change (RFC). The ticket was closed following the 3-strike rule due to lack of feedback after three consecutive follow-ups. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ-DT][PO1-IUE1] can not raise PO due to error
Description:
I am trying to raise a PO for supplier 7000949 Gladfield Malt,
The item code i am having an issue with is 1250576 which I have ordered before for site 1033.
The fault is saying control key 0000 cannot be used here. The line is automatically populated when the item code is entered.
I have raised a PO with the same supplier with this item code taken out and it has worked fine, so I'm picking something must have been changed with this material.
Resolution notes:
The cert type and QA control have been updated in the contract 6000000024 line item 250
After the contract was updated the cert type and QM control key is getting correctly populated while creating the PO.
As no further action is pending from P2P team, we are going ahead to close the ticket
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The user was trying to raise a Purchase Order (PO) for supplier 7000949 (Gladfield Malt) for item code 1250576 at site 1033 in the SAP S4 Procure to Pay (P2P) system. However, they encountered an error stating "control key 0000 cannot be used here". The error was automatically populated when the item code was entered. The user had previously raised a PO with the same supplier without this item code and it worked fine, leading them to believe that something must have been changed with this material.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was resolved by updating the certificate type and QA control in the contract 6000000024 line item 250. After the contract was updated, the certificate type and QM control key were correctly populated while creating the PO. The steps taken were as follows:

1. Select the line item whose certificate type and QA control needed to be updated.
2. Update the certificate type and QA control fields and save it.
3. After the contract was updated, the certificate type and QM control key were correctly populated while creating the PO.

In addition, it was recommended to re-trigger the PO message output types via the ME22n transaction code to enable the PO print. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: [BRQ][EWM2-TEC2]Stock in SAP not correct
Description: There are multiple batches in SAP that seem to exist in the Stock Overview tile, but not in the Warehouse Monitor. Could I please get somebody to have a look at this as this has caused us to stock out, because the Material Planner saw that we had more stock on site than we actually did?
Resolution notes:
Hello Sjoerd,

As we have updated the changes in TEST ENV . Please help us to complete UAT document as once you are back from the leave, you can verify the changes in TEST and let us know your thoughts.

As of now, we are closing this ticket and once you are back, we can create a new ticket and take it further.

For moving the changes to Production.

Thanks!
Preethi
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042725 pertains to an issue with the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system, specifically in the Enterprise Warehouse Management (EWM) subcategory. The problem was identified as a discrepancy in the stock data between the Stock Overview tile and the Warehouse Monitor. Multiple batches seemed to exist in the Stock Overview tile but were not present in the Warehouse Monitor. This discrepancy led to a stock out situation as the Material Planner was misled by the incorrect stock data, believing there was more stock on site than there actually was.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Based on the resolution notes and additional comments, the following steps were taken and are recommended for similar issues in the future:

1. Update changes in the TEST ENVIRONMENT: Changes were made in the test environment to address the issue. It is recommended to always test changes in a controlled environment before implementing them in production.

2. Complete User Acceptance Testing (UAT) document: The UAT document is crucial for verifying the changes made in the test environment. The business user was asked to complete the UAT document once they returned from leave.

3. Address known issue in Stock Transport Orders (STOs): The integration failure was due to a known issue in STOs where delivery dates should not have different dates. However, due to a split in Bevchain, different delivery dates were given. This issue needs to be addressed to prevent similar problems in the future.

4. Correct Outbound Deliveries (OBDs): Incorrect OBDs were identified and corrected. This involved updating the Job Id in the LIONLAW_DT_PAL table view, removing incorrect OBDs, and saving the changes. The OBDs were then input in the VL02N transaction, the picked quantity and batch were updated, and the goods issue was posted.

5. Close and reopen ticket if necessary: The ticket was closed with the understanding that a new ticket could be opened for further action if needed once the business user returned from leave.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][PMR2-IIT1]When consuming labels in MII got an error message which usually means a stuck queue. Will be unable to reverse materials at the end of the PO.
Description: EWM will show that materials are consumed but MII shows not consumed and an error during consumption. Usually in the past this has been put down to a stuck queue.
Resolution notes:
Root cause: Business requested to reverse the consumption in EWM.
Resolution: AM Team reversed requested quantity 18,500 for material 1260268 of PO 100003461835.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042684 pertains to an error encountered during the consumption of labels in the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system. The error message usually indicates a stuck queue, which prevents the reversal of materials at the end of the Purchase Order (PO). Despite consumption being reflected in the Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) system, MII shows the materials as not consumed, leading to an error during consumption. The material in question was 1260268, and the requested quantity for reversal was 18500 from PO 100003461835.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Identify the error: The error message during consumption in MII usually indicates a stuck queue. This needs to be addressed to allow for the reversal of materials.
2. Verify the consumption status: Despite the error in MII, the EWM system shows the materials as consumed. This discrepancy needs to be resolved.
3. Request for reversal: The business requested the reversal of consumption in the EWM system. The AM Team reversed the requested quantity for the specified material from the PO.
4. Confirm resolution: After the reversal, confirmation is needed from the relevant parties that the stock is visible and in the correct location. Once confirmed, the ticket can be closed.
5. Provide guidance: If there are challenges in following the reversal process, a help sheet can be provided for guidance. If necessary, a call and screen share can be arranged to guide through the process.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and do not rely on the knowledge base documents.

Short description: [BRQ]Credit variance between credit and invoice
Description: Invoice amount 6635.90 credit amount 6632.00
Resolution notes:
Issue: Credit variance between credit and invoice
Resolution: Upon checking, variance happening because of ZOE1 applying only in Credit memo as it is designed to reference as delivery document instead of Invoice. Advised the same to business and requested to raise a Service request for the enhancement.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042354 pertains to a credit variance between a credit and an invoice in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The invoice amount was 663590 while the credit amount was 663200. The issue was identified as being due to the ZOE1 discount condition type in unplanned returns, which was calculating only on the credit memo. This was because the current design of the system was using the delivery as a reference when creating unplanned returns, not the invoice.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Upon investigation, it was advised to the business to raise a service request for enhancement as the variance was happening due to ZOE1 applying only in the Credit memo. This is because it is designed to reference the delivery document instead of the Invoice.
2. The business was provided with the investigation results and advised to raise a service request for the fix as it falls under NSSR.
3. The issue is due to the current design where unplanned returns are using Delivery as a reference but not the Invoice. If this needs to be changed, a service request should be raised where approval from SDMs can be requested to proceed with changes.
4. The ABAP team was consulted to understand why Z0E1 is not applied on the Credit memo. The issue was found to be with all unplanned returns with condition type ZOE1. Full Pallet Discount Z0E1 is not applied in Standard order Invoice and Unplanned returns but applied in Credit invoice.
5. The issue is currently being replicated in a lower environment for further investigation and to find a potential fix.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard procedures.

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Production issue: Product Category data in Hybris
Description:
The name/ID of some Categories in Hybris are not following the design.

The issue was noticed in the NZ site, when a user selects a Brand or a filter in the Product Listing page. 
We have seen this before and I think maybe it was resolved for the other categories but not this one?

1. There are two Categories sharing the same name. This is causing issues when using the filters in Marketplace, as there is no way to identify which of the two categories have been selected:

This happens when:

• Navigating via Products > Shop all merchandise
• In catalogue, filtering by Category > Merchandise

In the Hybris Shop, the two categories are presented as main categories, however when selecting the first one (with 488 items) then the second "Merchandise" appears as a subcategory (with 140 items). Is this mapping incorrectly assigned? 

Refer to images attached.


2. There is inconsistency between the name and the ID of the "Premix" category. All other categories follow the same rule, where the ID and the name is the same. This is obvious when a customer selects "Premix" in the filters, but the result actually show up as "Ready to Drink". Can the names be aligned?

Refer to image attached.
Resolution notes:
As we have fixed the issue in TEST ENV.  Once user is back from sick leave, user can verify the changes in TEST.
For now, we will not be able to move the changes to production without user acceptance.
As of now, we are closing this ticket and once user is back, we can create a new ticket and take it further.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042336 was raised due to a production issue with product category data in Hybris. The problem was that the nameID of some categories in Hybris were not following the design. This issue was noticed in the NZ site when a user selects a Brand or a filter in the Product Listing page. There were two categories sharing the same name, causing issues when using the filters in Marketplace as there was no way to identify which of the two categories had been selected. Additionally, there was inconsistency between the name and the ID of the Premix category. All other categories follow the same rule where the ID and the name is the same. This was obvious when a customer selects Premix in the filters but the result actually show up as Ready to Drink.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The issue was investigated and found to be due to duplicate Merchandise data setup in the backend, causing it to show up twice in categories and in facet filters. The issue was fixed in the TEST environment and the user was asked for validation. Once confirmation is received, a Change Request (CR) will be raised to move the fixes to Production. The steps taken to resolve the issue were as follows:

1. Identified the issue with the category data setup in Hybris.
2. Found that the issue was due to duplicate Merchandise data setup in the backend.
3. Fixed the issue in the TEST environment.
4. Asked the user for validation of the fix.
5. Plan to raise a CR to move the fixes to Production once confirmation is received from the user.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may need to be adjusted based on the specific system configuration and user permissions.

Short description: [BRQ] [JO01-IUE1] Error reporting - What is failing and why
Description:
Hey team, 

Noticing consistent failures in the below jobs. 

ZBA SP Transactional Data Load Daily
ZBA SP Master data Load Weekly

What is the process that AM have for investigating / reviewing / diagnosing the cause of the errors, then raising those issues for the business to change / fix their data? What's the expectation here?

Some of the issues are pretty obvious (transactional) but the master data errors (weekly) are huuuuge.
Even if the business could get a snapshot of the data errors to review after the weekly load, we could take steps to fixing up the data.

Cheers,
Ben
Resolution notes:
Resolution details: Agreement with Ben is to send weekly error monitoring.
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042185 was raised due to consistent failures in the "ZBA SP Transactional Data Load Daily" and "ZBA SP Master data Load Weekly" jobs in the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. The user, Ben, requested information on the process for investigating, reviewing, and diagnosing the cause of these errors, and how these issues are raised for the business to change or fix their data. The user noted that some of the issues were obvious transactional ones, but the master data errors were significant. The user suggested that if the business could get a snapshot of the data errors to review after the weekly load, they could take steps to fix the data.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Regular Monitoring: Agreement was made with Ben to send weekly error monitoring. This would help in identifying the errors and taking necessary actions in a timely manner.
2. Review of Plant Status Changes: Screenshots were provided to Ben showing the plant status change from MDG to S4 end. It was noted that MDG CR changes will flow to S4 and other downstream systems once the CR is final check approved.
3. Testing in QA: Ben requested a test run in QA to confirm the process flow. This would help in identifying any discrepancies in the process flow.
4. Review of Postprocessing Errors: A compiled list of postprocessing errors and explanations for each was provided. For the product master errors, there was a separate ticket/communication.
5. Review of Historic Tickets: A ticket resolution recommendation was provided based on historic tickets. This included issues like BOM not being available for FG in MII and LMS, and issues with downloading logs in the Data Integration app.
6. Communication with Relevant Parties: It was noted that for the transactional and master data jobs, they had previously aligned with Alex that they would only send steps which failed that are not postprocessing related. They could send Ben the list of data errors if needed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ] Order not hitting cut off
Description: Order 12749030 did not go through cut off. Part of the order went on to back order cancellation, however no OBD created and unable to create OBD manually either. Could we please investigate why.
Resolution notes:
Issue: Order not hitting cut off
Resolution:  found that the delivery was not created because of the document was blocked by some other job or by another user. provided there is no block by another job
Application: S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0042038 was raised due to an issue with Order 12749030 in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The order did not go through the cut-off process as expected. Part of the order went on to back order cancellation, however, no Outbound Delivery (OBD) was created and manual creation of OBD was also not possible. The issue was investigated to determine the cause.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Upon investigation, it was found that the delivery was not created because the document was blocked by another job or user. 
2. The error log confirmed that no jobs specific to this were running at the time. 
3. The likely cause for the delivery not being created by the job before cut-off could be because the document was locked by another user. However, there was no log available to identify who that was.
4. The issue was resolved by correcting the recipe and reversing the earlier lot. 
5. Moving forward, it is recommended to ensure that documents are not locked by other users or jobs during the cut-off process to prevent similar issues. 
6. The ticket was closed following the resolution of the issue.

Please note that these recommendations are generated based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of best practices.

Short description: [BRQ]MII machine state not working correctly when ending order on keg pasteuriser
Description:
The pride keg plant. KP1PS01. when pressing "production end" the MII machine state goes back to "new" instead of "completed"
Please assign to SAP MII team / Jigit bhayani
Resolution notes:
AM team completed all operations for affected orders in MII through backend.
AM team to implement preventive measure - When TECO is done for an order, Complete all order operation with status New, Hold or Active in MII. Currently New operation remains as it is in MII. This will be implemented through change request.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0041978 pertains to an issue with the BRQMII machine state in the SAP Manufacturing Integration Intelligence (MII) system. The problem arises when ending production on the pride keg plant KP1PS01. Instead of transitioning to the "completed" state as expected, the MII machine state reverts back to "new". The issue was assigned to the SAP MII team for resolution, with Jigit Bhayani identified as the MII Developer.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The AM team completed all operations for the affected orders in MII through the backend. This was the immediate solution to the problem.
2. As a preventive measure, it was suggested that when Technically Complete (TECO) is done for an order, all order operations with the status "New", "Hold" or "Active" in MII should be completed. Currently, operations with the "New" status remain as they are in MII.

Short description: [BRQ] [SP03-IAP1] Monthly Discrete - no explanation for missed demand
Description:
Please keep as P2 - as this will stop the weekly plan from running today, which will have impacts to production.

In the discrete log for non-delivery, its giving an error: "Runtime too short to give an explanation"
Can you please check the app job why it "ran short" as far as i can tell the same amount of time was made available?
Explanation information: Explanation rate for non-deliveries is 0.00%. (Not explained amount: 2582078.1586870016)
Resolution notes:
Adjusted the discrete S&OP Operator to run from 43200 to 42300 seconds. Removed adjusted values in the explanation for the discrete jobs. 
RFC# N/A
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0041806 pertains to an issue with the BRQ SP03IAP1 Monthly Discrete where there is no explanation for missed demand. The error message indicates that the runtime is too short to provide an explanation. The explanation rate for nondeliveries is 0.00 and the not explained amount is 25820781586870016. The issue is impacting the weekly plan, which could have repercussions on production.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Adjust the discrete SOP Operator to run from 43200 to 42300 seconds.
2. Remove adjusted values in the explanation for the discrete jobs.
3. Change the runtime for the explanation scope to higher (e.g., 1200 seconds).
4. Untick the "Missed Adjusted Values" if only the missed demand is needed.
5. Consider reducing the explanation horizon from 25 weeks.
6. Check material costing and ensure the pricing is maintained.
7. Assign the issue to the Enable Me queue for the team to fix and resolve.
8. Update the other discrete jobs for AU to have a total time of no more than 12 hours and reduce discrete to 42300 seconds.
9. Raise an OSS ticket to SAP for further assistance if needed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and may require further investigation or adjustments based on the specific circumstances of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][APP3-IDT1]Production issue: Hybris is invalidating user's token and causing Marketplace sessions to be lost
Description:
When a customer Updates their password, Hybris is invalidating both the current user access_token and refresh_token.
This should not be the case as the user is already authenticated so should be able to continue transacting using the current tokens.

To replicate:

1. Login to Marketplace and navigate to My Profile > Change password page
2. Change the user's password 
3. Attempt to Change venue

Current outcome: User is logged out

Expected outcome: User changes venue and continues transacting

 Hybris endpoint:  https://api-test.lionaws.com/lionwebservices/v2/lion-au/users/polash.rahman@lionco.com/password
Resolution notes: As this is not a valid bug, CI is needed to include in the design. Spoke to Ivonne and got the comfirmation for ticket closure.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The issue reported in ticket INC0041640 pertains to the SAP Hybris eCommerce application. When a customer updates their password, Hybris invalidates both the current user access_token and refresh_token. This is causing Marketplace sessions to be lost. The user is then logged out when they attempt to change venue, which is not the expected outcome. The user should be able to change venue and continue transacting. The issue is replicable in a test environment.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
Upon investigation, it was found that the OAUTH token is getting revoked when changing password by default. This is included in the out-of-the-box code and not designed in Lion code. As this was not included in the design, it is concluded that this is not a valid bug. 

Steps to address the issue:
1. A Change Implementation (CI) is needed to include this in the design.
2. Consult with Ivonne Diaz Garcia for further investigation and confirmation.
3. Check the backend code and API to understand why this is happening.
4. Once the CI is implemented, test the functionality to ensure the issue is resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and further investigation may be required.

Short description: [BRQ]Customer being charged min freight on transfer of goods
Description: When raising a transfer of goods the customer has been charged incorrectly for min freight on the debit memo- Customer 10120500 was credited 3.94 for the freight- customer 10129933 was then charged $35 for the min freight- see attached (complaint reference numbers 9000240670/9000240671
Resolution notes:
Issue: Customer being charged min freight on transfer of goods
Resolution: Advised user about Key combination in ZFFS condition type. If we update below Freight list to $0.00 for order reason 103 – CRD/DBT Transfer of goods, this will avoid calculating Freights for TOG. Testing is also successful.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0041318 pertains to an issue where a customer was incorrectly charged for minimum freight during a transfer of goods in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. Specifically, Customer 10120500 was credited $394 for freight, and then Customer 10129933 was charged $35 for minimum freight. The issue arose during the creation of a transfer of goods where no freight should have been applied as the customers themselves were transferring the goods. The issue was identified as being related to the key combination in the ZFFS condition type.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution provided advises the user to update the Freight list to '000' for order reason '103 - CRDDBT Transfer of goods' in the ZFFS condition type. This change will prevent the calculation of freights for Transfer of Goods (TOG).
2. Testing was conducted in a lower environment to confirm that maintaining the new ZFFS condition with respect to Order reason - Transfer of Goods is working as expected.
3. It was also suggested to update the customer master Freight List field as blank to avoid fetching the freight details for these customers, but this would mean no freight will apply moving forward for these customers.
4. The user was asked to respond back to the survey generated upon ticket closure to help improve the service to the business.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system.

Short description: [BRQ] returns not resolving
Description:
Hi team
Can you please check why these returns did not auto resolve upon receipt of stock
9000157607, 
9000198851, 
9000195609
All three have same credit reason ADR Customer Return Non-Invoiced Stock, all product returns, all full receipted with customer resolution coms notes completed but are still in released status.
Resolution notes:
Issue: Can you please check why these returns did not auto resolve upon receipt of stock
Resolution: Complaints did not resolve as there is no credit memo created for advance returns.  As this is a new configuration where refund code is 0% and after goods movement is completed complaint should Resolved. User agreed to raise a CI for the same.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0041083 was raised due to an issue with certain returns not automatically resolving upon receipt of stock in the SAP S4 Order to Cash (O2C) system. The returns in question are 9000157607, 9000198851, and 9000195609. All three returns have the same credit reason - ADR Customer Return NonInvoiced Stock. Despite all product returns being fully receipted with customer resolution communications notes completed, they remained in the released status. The issue was identified as the absence of a credit memo created for advance returns, which is a new configuration where the refund code is 0 and the complaint should resolve after goods movement is completed.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The user agreed to raise a Change Initiative (CI) for the issue. This step is crucial as it will help address the problem and implement necessary changes.
2. A discussion was held with the Business Lisa and O2C functional Lead Ellys Sie, confirming that this fix/change will fall as a CI.
3. It was noted that complaints which have a return order, return delivery, and respective credit memo resolve automatically. However, the complaint mentioned in the ticket does not have a credit memo, hence it cannot be resolved automatically.
4. For complaints that need to be resolved, sample documents were provided for reference.
5. It was clarified that for ADR returns of non-invoiced stock, which were not invoiced, no credit memo should be created.
6. It was recommended to check if any credit memo was raised or if this is normal. Based on standard logic, advance return complaints get resolved once return delivery and credit memo is completed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [INT]Apparent SAP drop - Multiple instances
Description:
Looking at the Filler MII page, From Early Shift on Aug 20, 2023 to Late shift Aug 21, 2023 (and it will possibly occur again), there appears to be a SAP drop out once a shift where SAP does not register that the filler is running for about 10 minutes, and then spikes up to speeds of over 1,000,000 cans/hr when it comes back to life. During these periods, the SSCC labellers at the palletisers do not automatically print and so each pallet has to be manually printed out, often causing downtime before the situation is realised. 

As mentioned before, this appears to have happened once a shift for the last few shifts, so about 5 times so far.
Resolution notes: CHG0035050 - implemented at Tooheys to change MII Destination to UWS Destination. Overall it is deployed at Boags, Geelong, Pride, XXXX and Tooheys. Hence closing this ticket
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0040660 pertains to an issue with the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing (LAW) system. The problem was observed from the early shift on August 20, 2023, to the late shift on August 21, 2023, where SAP did not register that the filler was running for about 10 minutes per shift. This resulted in a spike in speeds to over 1,000,000 cans/hr when it resumed. During these periods, the SSCC labellers at the palletisers did not automatically print, causing each pallet to be manually printed out, often leading to downtime. This issue occurred approximately once per shift for the last few shifts, about five times in total. The resolution was implemented through CHG0035050 at Tooheys to change the MII Destination to UWS Destination, which was also deployed at Boags, Geelong, Pride, XXXX, and Tooheys.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Monitor the system to ensure that the issue does not recur. 
2. If the problem does occur again, additional logs that have been enabled should provide more detailed information for troubleshooting.
3. Keep the team informed about any developments or recurring issues, as they may need to conduct further investigations.
4. Consider replicating the issue in the test system to better understand the problem and find a solution.
5. If necessary, reassign the issue to the MII team for further investigation.
6. Maintain open communication with the business, and arrange for a call if requested.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ]Production issue: WebMethods call for BillingDocment has incorrect field type for PaymentDate field.
Description:
The following wM call:
rest/hybrisCommerceCommon.service.BillingDocument?venue=50041510&companyCountryCode=AU11&dateFrom=2022-08-21&dateTo=2023-08-21&status=C

returns a record with a paymentDate which is not a date.
e.g.
{
      "companyCode": "AU11",
      "payerId": "50041510",
      "documentDate": "2023-01-17",
      "paymentDate": "    -  -  ",
      "documentType": "SC",
      "documentTypeDescription": "",
      "documentNumber": "8400055021",
      "salesOrderNumber": "",
      "soldTo": "",
      "amount": "64.13 ",
      "currency": "AUD",
      "documentStatus": "A",
      "creditDebit": "H",
      "status": "S",
      "statusMessage": "Details of Billing Document is fetched Successfully",
      "poNumber": ""
   },


As per documentation:
https://ngp2-lion.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HE/pages/1766064310/S4+-+Billing+Documents
This field should be a date.

This is causing errors in production as MP expects to manipulate a date value. This also effects data integrity.
Resolution notes:
Issue: No billing history and account statements are visible on Marketplace for account 50041510
Resolution: No statements generated because of missing filed Bank Statements in employee master data. This is now update by Pavira with the approval of SDM.
Application: SAP S4
Change Request: NA

We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0040651 pertains to a production issue where a WebMethods call for the BillingDocument had an incorrect field type for the PaymentDate field. The user reported that the WebMethods call was returning a record with a paymentDate that was not a date. This was causing errors in production as MP expected to manipulate a date value. This also affected data integrity. The issue was identified as no billing history and account statements being visible on Marketplace for account 50041510. The root cause was identified as missing fields in the Bank Statements in the employee master data.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Investigate the issue: The team started by investigating the missing billing history and account statements on Marketplace for account 50041510.
2. Identify the root cause: The team identified that the issue was due to missing fields in the Bank Statements in the employee master data.
3. Update the employee master data: The missing fields in the employee master data were updated by Pavira with the approval of the Service Delivery Manager (SDM).
4. Monitor the situation: The team planned to monitor the situation and provide an update.
5. Communicate with the user: The team communicated with the user to discuss the issue and the steps taken to resolve it.
6. Request user feedback: The user was requested to respond back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help in improving the service to the business.
7. Address any further concerns: The team was prepared to address any further concerns raised by the user.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket.

Short description: [BRQ][GRN1-IDT1]Material Setup Issue (crown)
Description:

Summarized_Issue:

The issue was that the EWM material was not set up completely, specifically missing the packing specification, which prevented it from being receipted. The ticket was assigned to the AM SAP LAW group and was categorized under the SAP S4 Logistics and Warehousing LAW business application.
Summarized_Recommendations:

1. The AM team maintained the packing specification of the material in S4. This was the first step in resolving the issue.
2. The business created an ASN to receipt the stock in the system. This was a necessary step to ensure the material could be properly tracked.
3. A meeting was set up with SAP to discuss how to address the issue. This was important for understanding the root cause and identifying potential solutions.
4. An OSS note (717588 2023) was raised to address the zero quantity line item in the IBD. This was a proactive step to prevent similar issues in the future.
5. The business confirmed the closure of the ticket, indicating that the issue was resolved. The goods receipt (410002623183 183898653703) was completed by the business.
6. For future reference, if similar issues occur, the same steps can be followed to resolve them. 

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and are not generated by me.

Short description: [ALR][ALR4-ICP2] FileSystems/usrsap/Use%: 97  on  syavsapcsd01.lion.aws
Description:

            Value : ,
            ciHint : syavsapcsd01.lion.aws|syavsapcsd01.lion.aws,
            Environment : PRD,
            Priority : 4 - Low
Resolution notes:
Hi Team,

We will now be setting the status of the ticket to RESOLVED.

Issue Details: /usr/sap in syavsapcsd01 is nearly fully utilized.
Business Impact: No business impact as this is only a development system
Resolution Details: Performed cleanup of unused content repositories in CSD.
SLA Breach Reason: N/A
Change#: N/A

Regards,
Irvin
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0040583 was raised due to an alert triggered from ORIGIN OMi, under the category Linux, SubCategory AWS. The alert was triggered because the 'usrsap' filesystem on the server 'syavsapcsd01.lion.aws' was nearly fully utilized, reaching 97%. This issue was primarily due to overutilization of the content server. The team was in the process of dropping the old repository from the Content Server and was consulting with SAP on possible cleanup of repositories inside the Content Server. An OSS was raised with SAP (692975 2023) as the Content Server DATA area was full.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The team successfully performed a cleanup of unused content repositories in CSD, specifically deleting content repository ZD and ZC. This action resulted in the reduction of filesystem and content server utilization.
2. It is recommended to continue monitoring the utilization of the content server to prevent future overutilization.
3. Regular cleanup of unused content repositories can help maintain optimal utilization levels.
4. It may be beneficial to consult with SAP for further recommendations on managing repositories inside the Content Server.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes and work notes provided in the ticket and my understanding of the issue.

Short description: [BRQ][COT1-RP2]Discrepancies S4 to C4C AU Shopper Channels L1, 2, & 3 data
Description:
Hi,
A/C 10166364 has inconsistencies in Class & Characteristic values in C4C vs S4.  C4C says the customer is On Prem/Dining, S4 Off Premise (which is accurate).  This customer, along with 10167578, 10167206 are not appearing in the S4 Customer Database and I have no idea why.  Can we please troubleshoot.  Thanks
Resolution notes:
Issue: C4C AU shopper channels were not aligned with S4
Resolution: Extracted all customers AU shopper channel from S4 & C4C, compared them & replicated using DRFOUT t-code.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0040290 was raised due to discrepancies in Class and Characteristic values between SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) and S4 for AC 10166364. The customer was listed as On Premise/Dining in C4C, while S4 accurately listed it as Off Premise. Additionally, this customer, along with 10167578 and 10167206, were not appearing in the S4 Customer Database. The issue was categorized under SAP and specifically under Master Data Governance (MDG). The priority level was set to low.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved several steps:
1. Extract all customers AU shopper channel data from S4 and C4C.
2. Compare the extracted data.
3. Replicate the data using the DRFOUT tcode if there are discrepancies.
4. The C4C team compared the customer details to the MDG business team to update the characteristic.
5. The inconsistent data was then replicated to C4C.
6. An ISM ticket (852446) was raised to maintain the factory calendar as 3 customers had pending messages due to a blank factory calendar.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: [BRQ-BS] Solution required on reversal of overaccrual on ZPAD CCID's
Description:
The previous solution to reverse $9.1m resulted in issues in paying customer rebates.  Please provide a new solution on how to reverse the overaccrual on the ~740 customer ccid's
Problem with rebates: INC0036635
Initial soultion: Refer to IINC0024516
Resolution notes:
Issue: 9.1 Mil over accrual fix

Resolution: Please refer to  the attached  emails for the  solution  and we have created a PR #PRB0040412  to track the status until business perform the  suggested solution.

RFC: NA
Application: S4
 
We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0036731 pertains to an issue with the reversal of over accrual on ZPAD CCIDs in the SAP S4 Revenue (REV) system. The previous solution to reverse 91 million resulted in issues in paying customer rebates. The problem was identified in 740 customer CCIDs and was related to a historical data issue. The issue was assigned to the AM SAP REV group and was given a low priority. The problem was also linked to another incident, INC0036635, and a previous solution was referred to in INC0024516.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
The resolution involved creating a problem request (PRB0040412) to track the status until the business performs the suggested solution. The steps taken were as follows:

1. Investigate the historical data issue and understand why the CCIDs are erroring out when the Z5PI documents were generated.
2. Identify that the values of the over accruals are coming from the accounting and not from the CCIDs, causing issues whenever a final settlement manual document is posted.
3. Propose two options to fix the issue:
   a. Option 1: Businesses can create FI upload files (LIONFI_GPUPLOAD) using the combination of the GL account 2043000 for CCID 2000078553 and transferring to GL account 4102000 having a combination of customer/material.
   b. Option 2: If option 1 is not applicable from the business side, opt for option 2 which involves moving the values from affected CCID to placeholder CCID (positive value), creating JV document with returns, rerunning the last dated delta accrual, creating JV document with standard, and creating Auto final settlement document.
4. Request for time until Monday to execute a few scenarios in a lower environment to understand the behavior of the proposed solution.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Short description: Unable to access Condition Contract screens/tiles/T-Codes in SAP
Description:
REPEAT OF TICKET INC0030686

Hi team,
We appear to have an issue accessing SAP transactions to manage Condition Contracts
Example of transactions affected: WCOCOALL, /LION/REV_CUST_COCKP.
We have tried in both the SAP GUI and in Fiori with the same result, although the screens load it will not load any data or pull up any search results.
Resolution notes:
Request: Unable to access Condition Contract screens/tiles/T-Codes in SAP
Resolution: As per SAP advice , the tiles are working slow because of memory issues.
Application: S4
RFC:  NA
 
We would like to appreciate if you can response back to the Survey generated upon ticket closure to help us in improving the service to the business.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0033138 was raised due to an issue with accessing SAP transactions to manage Condition Contracts. The transactions affected include WCOCOALL and LIONREV_CUST_COCKP. The problem was experienced in both the SAP GUI and in Fiori. Although the screens loaded, they did not load any data or pull up any search results. This issue was identified as a repeat of a previous ticket, INC0030686. The issue was assigned to the AM - SAP REV group and categorized under SAP and Revenue. The resolution notes indicate that the tiles are working slowly due to memory issues.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The Basis team provided SQL plan traces for this issue and ran traces in EMP, finding that processing is slow when selecting from table WB2_CDS_CCS_ACCRUALS_REVERSAL through program LIONREV_CL_SERVICECPS.
2. It was found that several jobs running in EMP related to condition contracts are normal jobs that regularly run without any issues.
3. Most of the processing time is spent on the database, with no issues found on the database. The issue seems to be isolated to reading condition contracts.
4. There is slowness when accessing table WB2_CDS_CCS_ACCRUALS_. 
5. As per SAP advice, the tiles are working slow sometimes because of memory issues. This issue will be brought to SDM note.
6. An SAP incident was raised after ABAP analysis and Case ID 493480 - 2023 was created.
7. It is recommended to reassign this issue to the Basis team for resolution.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of SAP systems.

Short description: [BRQ] SF to S4 integration
Description: Hi there. There are inconsistencies between the data in SuccessFactors (updated data) and S4 (old data). This is causing issues downstream in systems like concur. Can someone from IT please support with checking the integration as this cannot be checked/fixed by the P&C team that manage SF and we are getting a lot of queries.
Resolution notes: There is no integration problem in SF and SAP, we are resolving leader issues, hence we are closing this ticket
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0029808 was raised due to inconsistencies between the data in SuccessFactors (updated data) and S4 (old data), which was causing issues in downstream systems like Concur. The problem was identified in the SuccessFactors business application and was assigned to the AM SAP H2R team. The issue was categorized under Integration Products. The request was for IT support to check the integration as it could not be checked/fixed by the PC team that manages SuccessFactors.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. The resolution for this issue involved confirming that there was no integration problem between SuccessFactors and SAP. The team was resolving leader issues and hence decided to close the ticket.
2. The Integration team checked and found two standard SAP interfaces in CPI for SF to S4 integration: "Replicate Employee Master Data and Org Assignments from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to SAP ERP or SAP S4HANA" and "Replicate Organizational Objects from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to SAP ERP or SAP S4HANA".
3. The team suggested that since these are standard interfaces, they can only validate the data coming from SF to S4 by enabling the trace in CPI. This needs to be informed to the integration team before the data sync.
4. The team recommended reaching out to SAP for further support since these are standard interfaces.
5. The team requested the user to review the proposed solution and confirm if the issue has been resolved so that the ticket can be closed.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the resolution notes provided in the ticket and not generated by me.

Resolution notes: We have one more ticket open for this issue. Also we request Christopher to contact us though teams or email at gayathri.ratnam@lionco.com when he has expenses to submit. We can manually change the leader and make the claim reach the correct approver. Routing the investigation to the open ticket RITM0046097. With this information we tag this ticket as resolved.
Summarized_Issue:
ISSUE:
The ticket INC0011182 was raised by Christopher Whitfield, the Network Optimisation Manager at Lion, requesting an update to his Concur expense approver to his new leader, Brett Harmston. Despite the correct leader details being maintained in SF, there was a mismatch with SAP, resulting in the wrong leader being assigned in Concur. This issue led to expenses being sent to an old leader. The issue was identified as a dependency on the H2R team to check the approval flow in S4 and why the data from SF was not being updated correctly in SAP.
Summarized_Recommendations:
RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Acknowledge the issue and understand the request.
2. Verify the current leader details in SF and SAP.
3. Identify the discrepancy between the leader details in SF and SAP.
4. Engage the H2R team to investigate why the data from SF is not being updated correctly in SAP.
5. Once the issue is identified, correct the leader details in SAP to match those in SF.
6. Confirm the update with Christopher Whitfield.
7. Test the updated leader details by having Christopher submit an expense claim.
8. If the expense claim is directed to the correct leader, Brett Harmston, the issue can be considered resolved.
9. Close the ticket once the issue is resolved.

Please note that these recommendations are based on the information provided in the ticket and my understanding of standard ticket resolution procedures.
